hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is one of the newest hotels in Tokyo and it is absolutely amazing. The lobby and bar area are breathtaking. The staff is amazing. The rooms are spacious, modern and very comfortable. This is quite possibly the most incredible hotel experience that I have ever had.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I have come here multiple times and can’t imagine a nicer hotel in Tokyo. I actively miss this hotel when I’m home. There is an intimacy here, almost like a boutique hotel, that doesn’t conflict with the big-hotel luxury of the place; much of that is the wonderful staff service.And it is luxurious! I particularly like how every room is wonderful; you do not need to book the highest-end rooms, as you do in some hotels, to have access to features like a splendid bathroom in your room, plus the gym and pool. The entire hotel is non-smoking as well.As the hotel rooms are on the upper floors of this high-rise, every view is a gem. The window wall is one of my favorite features, with a long window seat that reminds you there is plenty of pleasure to be had just sitting with a cup of tea and a sweet and cozying up in your room.Even the standard rooms are spacious and immaculate. Small thoughtful treats will greet your arrival in your room. Beds are extremely comfortable, lights and window shades are operated by a bedside iPad. Temperatures are easily regulated. Wi-fi is free and fast. There are plenty of electric sockets. The bathroom has a huge tub and a separate shower; the toilet is tucked away behind its own door (and the toilet lid greets you by opening when you approach). The glass bath wall opaques at a touch. Tons of elegant toiletries including toothbrushes and exfoliating cloths. Robes and slippers provided, amenities such as kettles, coffee maker, refrigerator, iron, and hair dryer are all there for you. The cabinetry gleams with a clean white finish. You will wish you could just decide to live there for the next year.The pool is a large indoor lap pool at a comfortably warm temperature, the locker rooms have their own mini-onsen right there, plus a lounging area with a view. It, too, is utterly immaculate and stocked with luxe amenities.It is located in a building with a mall on the lower floors, including a gourmet grocery, restaurants, flower shop, a Dean and Deluca, etc. The stores even keep late hours.The Prince Gallery is located between two subway stations (Akasaka-Mitsuke and Nagata-Cho) on different lines, barely a block away from either. Both stops have easy access to central subway lines/stops. I never needed a taxi with such convenient subway access. Though the area’s reputation is to be surrounded by administrative buildings and such, it has plenty of walkable shopping, restaurants, etc. to its south, and Roppongi Hills just a short distance east, and it is very centrally located in Tokyo. You will not feel isolated!Basically? I would like to marry this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Where do I begin?With the white gloved service upon arrival of our vehicle from the airport?With the swift removal of our many pieces of luggage and delivery to our room?With the quite smooth elevator ride up to reception?With the pleasant aroma of the reception area and the spotless hotel? (We did purchase the difuser oils in the gift shop!)With the smiling, polite, efficient receptionist who not only told us where to find the elevator but escorted us to it?Are you seeing a trend here?Our King room was exquistely designed and furnished, huge window wall overlooking the city, many amenities - robes, slippers, chocolates, tooth and hair brushes, etc. The most comfortable bed that can be found in a hotel with premium bedding and linens. The wet room in the bath area had a huge soaking tub, rain shower and a hand held, both with plenty of water pressure. Bathroom amenities were also plentiful and premium quality. The high tech ToTo toilet only took a few minutes to figure out for a first timer using such technology .... and it did a good job too.The smoking lounge was well appreciated by my wife who did not have to go outside to smoke. Ventilation was supurb because even as a non-smoker I hardly noticed any smell when I met her there.We only had dinner twice in the hotel ..... food and service was delightful.The bar area also served food along with drink.There are plenty of restaurants and food choices on the first 3 levels of the building ... a grocery store, Dean and DeLuca, chocolatier, bars, noodle shops, steak, etc. Something for everyone.As a bonus, it is only a 3 minute walk to the vast subway and train station which was a life saver after a full day of touring. The hotel is not inexpensive, but it is worth every Yen.If we return to Tokyo it would be our #1 pick.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Prince Gallery is shiny and new. The hardware is impressive, and so is the tech. And the lobby and restaurant areas have sweeping views of Tokyo (and beyond.) In some rooms, you'll be treated to view of either the Palace grounds and/or Mount Fuji.The entry-level rooms are decent sized, unlike other properties. And breakfast was well executed - there's a buffet area, but eggs are made to order, and they do a suberb job of it.Service is warm and friendly. I did not use the concierge, but acquaintances have raved about how awesome they are - I don't doubt it.In a city that is in no way lacking in world-class luxury accommodations, amazingly a Marriott property stands neck-and-neck with the best of them. And it's a better value than most of the others (such as Aman.)

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: There is something simply amazing about how far the staff and this hotel goes to be perfect. From the amazing lobby staff (Thank you Risa O. and Sumire S) that greet you in white gloves, perfect uniforms, with a professionalism that is second to none - to the details of floor to ceiling Chrystal clear windows with the best views of Tokyo - to the best bed I have slept in ever, The Prince Gallery is true 5 star service in every aspect. The staff inspires you to be better yourself , to know that every detail is important. The bar, the restaurant, the facilities, even the escalator below it, it was all perfect. There are probably hundreds of other items I didn't see that they made perfect, triple checked, and have ready. I will be staying here again in a week and looking forward to the return. The views alone at night are worth it to give yourself a treat and see what the best of the best is. It is here.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I've stayed in numerous five star Marriott properties, and currently am an ambassador elite member. This was my third stay at the Prince Gallery, and it is my favorite hotel in this world. This hotel is something out of a cinematic production, from the moment you exit the cab you have the white glove service. There is this smell in the hallway, which is paved with this unique black stone I have never seen before in other hotels, and it just feels very therapeutic.The rooms are amazing, with huge windows, including select rooms/suites that have showers with unbelievable city views. The food is amazing, from the sushi dinner to Teppan to room service (get the Wagyu set). I just love this hotel. It is truly an experience staying here, and I encourage you to try it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is one of the most expensive hotels I have ever stayed at but also one of the most absolutely amazing. The view was breathtaking the room was top notch luxury and technology and the breakfast buffet was amazing.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I came to this hotel on my anniversary trip and the hotel was able to upgrade me to a corner room suite (I’m also Bonvoy platinum). The room was beautiful. It also had a fantastic TOTO washlet toilet with the lid and bathroom light turning on automatically when you walk in the bathroom. These toilets are far superior to any toilet in North America, why aren’t they commonplace in North America as they are in Japan?The room also had fantastic views of the city and Imperial Palace and has an iPad to control the curtains and lights etc. The pool and bath areas are great (Japanese style naked, separate sections for gents and ladies). The morning breakfast in the Oasis restaurant was awesome, great buffet options and one option from the menu. I also had dinner at Souten. It is a very nice restaurant and I got the Souten meal which was about $200 USD per person, so that is quite pricey, but it was a multi-course mealthat included Wagyu beef, so that probablyaccounts for much of the large price tag. Best part of the hotel is the staff. They are incredibly friendly and helpful. They even arranged to courier a tote bag we had mistakenly left at our last hotel in Hakuba (3-4 hours away) and it arrived in less than 24 hours. Exceptional staff, they do a wonderful job in everything they do.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel is absolutely 5 star! you are welcome in the facility, you feel Japanese hospitality, and the they help with anything you can dream off to get it organized for you. rooms are large, bed is really good, and service outstanding. to the metro station akasaka mitsuke it is 5 min walking.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Use your Marriott points for this 5-star hotel. top floors only with stunning views some of Imperial Palace. One of the best locations too. Easy access through speed train and subway. Note: rates for Olympic Season start at around $800.00 for US-style room-sized 400 to 500 square feet. Highly recommended MeuterMedia

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel used to be Akasaka Price hotel. I didn't realized that until I arrived to the hotel. This hotel became so beautiful. I stayed at Conrad, Andes Tokyo during this trip and all those hotels were beautiful. However The Price Gallery hotel was my favorite hotel because of the view, comfortable bed. Everything you need was near by. I'll stay this hotel again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Situated in a relatively quite area of Tokyo, the hotel is very modern and really very nice. The location is a block away from the subway line and plenty of food and beverage options are within easy walking distance. Rooms were nicely appointed and the shower had amazing water pressure! Bathroom is a little tight for two people, but workable. Club lounge was stocked with lots of food and beverage options, although the morning breakfast buffet was a 3/5 for quality and choice of foods. Fitness room has everything you need....coupled with an amazing view. Actually the view from anywhere in this hotel is striking; I woke to Mt Fuji in the distance! Hotel bar was nothing special but altogether adequate. Concierge services were exceptional and their insight and assistance on everything from tours to restaurants was much appreciated. Housekeeping staff also very good. Quick and efficient, yet helpful and not rushed, check in and out service by the front desk was also very good. Overall no complaints and you will not be disappointed in your stay at this property.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Spent final night of a vacation in Japan at the Prince Gallery. After checking in, we were given a glass of champagne before being escorted to our room with the most magnificent view. The room settings were controlled by an iPad (lights, curtains etc). The staff was exceptionally attentive and the hotel has wonderful amenities (pool, hot tub, sauna). I selected breakfast as my check in gift, and enjoyed a delicious buffet overlooking the gardens. Centrally located to multiple subways, with lots of great restaurants in the area.We only stayed for 1 night but really made an impression- I travel for work ~80%, and this is the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My first stay at the Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho Hotel was a fortunate surprise as my usual business hotel was booked out. My office is in the Maronouchi area and I tend to stay close to the office however the Prince Gallery was just a short trip away. My first impressions of the hotel were “wow”! The view from the room was simply spectacular and my partner and I never tired of sitting in the comfortable cushioned window box and looking out at the open view. We also sampled the hotel restaurants and bars which were absolutely top quality and shared spectacular views with a funky modern design to provide a very modern take on the Japanese business/leisure hotel. Unfortunately my stay was cut short by Typhoon Hagibis. I must commend the staff highly for keeping myself and my business colleague informed of the situation. Trains and the limousine bus to Narita had ceased running, but a small window opened up on Friday evening for Saturday transportation to Narita on the limousine bus. The concierge desk rang late Friday night (we had asked to be notified if the situation changed) and secured us tickets on the Narita Limousine Bus that only operated a few services on Saturday morning and allowed us to depart the hotel at 7am and make the last flight out of Narita and back home to Singapore at midday before the airport and all transport systems in Tokyo shut down. The client-centric approach and organization this would have taken given the large number of guests facing disruption from the Typhoon was a credit to the staff that managed this seamlessly and smoothly. I highly recommend this Hotel for either the business or leisure traveller to Tokyo. And make sure you take in the Japanese breakfast - it is sensational!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We had an amazing time at the Prince Gallery when we visited Tokyo Christmas 2019. During our visit we stayed at Park Hyatt Tokyo, Ritz Carlton Tokyo, and Prince Gallery. All were exceptional, but Prince Gallery stood out and would be our choice if we were to visit again. We traveled as a family...mom, dad, and 8 year old son. Location1. Prince Gallery2. Ritz Carlton3. Park HyattLocation is really the deciding factor here for us as all three hotels were exceptional in terms of room, facilities and service. Prince Gallery is right next to a subway station where four lines intersect. This was extremely convenient as we were traveling with our young son. Also, there is a convenience store, deli, restaurants in the building and lots of restaurants nearby down the street. Ritz Carlton is connected to Tokyo mid town which houses lots of shops and restaurants, but subway stations are a ten minute walk. Park Hyatt isn’t close to anything. You’ll have to walk pretty far for any stores, restaurants or convenience stores. Room1. Park Hyatt2. Prince Gallery3. Ritz CarltonPH has the biggest standard room and the decor was my favorite. As platinum at Marriott, we were upgraded to a corner view room on our last day at Prince Gallery. The corner king view at the prince was simply breathtaking and really ended our visit on a high note. The tech at PG was also a nice touch. It was helpful to have all of the controls for the room in one place, instead of having to search for light and curtain switches.Fitness, spaAll three were great in their own way.Service1. Ritz Carlton2. Prince Gallery3. Park HyattService at the ritz was just a notch above that of PG and PH.BenefitsGetting breakfast at PG as platinum Marriott members really makes a difference. There aren’t a lot of places open before 11am in Japan and it helped to have a free good breakfast before we started our day. PG’s better location and free breakfast as platinum members really made it stand out when ranking these amazing hotels.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed for two nights in the lead up to Christmas. The hotel is beautifully designed and chic and takes in place among Tokyo's leading hotels. The best part was the room... our room had a big window seat where you could sit for ages and stare at the uninterrupted views, the bathroom was wonderful with soaker tub, seperate shower and excellent toiletries. The bed was also very comfortable. The staff were excellent and check-in etc. very well managed. The location is also excellent... Close to a subway station and the area as you cross the road near the Aksaksa subway station is very lively with lots of small streets, bars, restaurants etc - everything you need for an authentic Tokyo experience just a quick walk from the hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I had been looking forward to ending our Asian trip and my birthday on a high note and walked into our room and realized that half of our view was of the roof below us that jutted out. I don't think I have ever been so disappointed in a hotel in my life. We had stayed in some very nice hotels on the trip and I thought this was going to be the best one of the group. I was wrong and VERY close to tears. On my birthday.Otherwise it was a nice hotel with all the bells and whistles that you would expect of it and had I not had an obstructed view it would have exceeded my expectations and I would be writing a love letter to it like most people who stayed there do. Instead it has left a very nasty taste in my mouth. Which is sad.The staff were very nice and I got the impression that they did all that they could do but because the hotel was full, there was nothing they could do. As I started to say, the room was very nice and spacious. The bathroom was one that I wished that I could bring home. And the location was quiet but there were a lot of places to eat nearby. It really was a lovely hotel in a lovely part of town. If you are going to stay here, make sure that you are not on bottom floor or rooms or you could end up as disappointed as we were. The hotel really should sell these rooms as obstructed views.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My go-to place in Tokyo for business. Excellent hotel situated in a strategic location in Akasaka. Spacious rooms, great bar and breakfast, nice fitness area with Japanese sento overlooking the city, impeccable service.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Combined elegant & modern decoration. Fine utensils in hidden cabinet. Curtains/lights/temperature controlled by iPad. (Even request for the spare parts)The Japanese breakfast set(semi buffet) is amazing for the crab, beef, uni......

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This was my second time staying here. I am still in awe how amazing the experience is. The rooms are extremely clean, and the tech is ridiculous. For those who have concerns about the shower/bath being behind transparent glass, know that a touch of a button instantly frosts it. It's also soundproof so you won't hear the shower from the bed. The view from the room is also breathtaking. The bed was like sleeping on a cloud. The gym has pretty much everything you need to get a decent workout on the road. In addition to the cardio, there's a pull down machine, two dumbbell sets, a guided bench press/squat machine, and a cable crossover machine. When using the pool, understand that they have strict rules for it since it's not chlorinated. You need to wear a shower cap and shower before you get in. Also, if you have tattoos, you might have to cover it or will be denied entry. That being said, the pool and the locker rooms are very clean and impressive. I would recommend sitting in the hot tub with the view of the city.The club room on the 34th floor was also very nice. It's not 24 hours, so please keep that in mind. The Hors d'Oeuvres were all high quality, especially during happy hour. If you go any other time, there's still beer and sake available. I also think there's other drinks the staff can make, although I didn't ask. Obviously you're going to pay to stay here. However, if you are looking for an experience of a lifetime, I would absolutely recommend the club level room. I cannot wait to stay here again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My family and I have stayed at the Prince Gallery twice and can readily admit this is my favorite hotel in the world. To provide some perspective, my next favorite is the Shangrila Singapore Valley Wing. Room. Both times we have stayed with my family of four (2 teenage kids) and taken the corner suite with adjoining room for the kids. The suite has a 270 view of Tokyo and is just spectacular. Sitting in the window seat enjoying a morning Nespresso (they have my favorite flavor in the room) watching the city come alive never gets old. The layout of the sitting area next to the bedroom allows for a perfect spot for us all to comfortably sit in between jaunts across the city. If you want to sleep in, the automatic shades (two: sheer and blackout) work wonders and add a modern touch to the traditional deep-wood furniture.Having said all, this can’t say enough about the bathrooms. On the amenities, it’s one of the few times I have ended up purchasing the brand being used. The towels and robes are amazing but (and I’m by no means an exhibitionist) taking a rain shower or sitting in the deep bathtub with a floor to ceiling view of the city is something everyone should experience.I should also note the bathroom in the adjoining room has glass walls that turn opaque when someone is using it. I have to admit we played with that for at least 5 minutes when we first walked in!Hotel. The other parts of the hotel we used are the guest lounge and breakfast, which for us became an integral part of the day. Neither of my teenager kids are big morning people (even less so with jetlag) but every morning we all made our way to the top floor to take in the morning views and beautiful array of foods. We’re just a basic eggs & bacon family but ending up eating pastries, fruits, pastas, the most perfect poached eggs and so much more. In the afternoons and evenings, we would come back to the lounge for a snack or evening drink. With daily changing changing hors d’ouevres and a light selection of wine, beer, liquors (I was never found wanting), it was great because after having been through the onslaught of food choices in Tokyo, just walking up and grabbing what was there was a relaxing way to get a snack.Only on my second stay did I discover another hidden gem: the fitness center and spa. You absolutely have to take advantage of the sauna and hot/cold baths. I only did it in the evening but relaxing in the hot bath looking at the night sky over a sprawling city was magical.Finally, the staff are just incredible. If you’ve never experienced it, Japanese service is really at it’s own level. In particular, Mr. Zentaro Usami is incredibly helpful and took great care of my family.Hope this helps!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for the first night of our honeymoon before leaving for our next stop, and it was one of the most wonderful hotel stays (if not the most wonderful) I've ever had. We were jetlagged from our 12 hour flight but the room was so gorgeous and comfortable we stayed up late anyway and got a couple drinks in the beautiful bar. (Plus it was only a few steps from the station, so navigating there from the airport was no problem.) The staff were very helpful and attentive, even when English was limited. We couldn't get over the view at night OR in the morning. The room was a really good size even by our Western standards, and the bed was comfortable. The glassed-in bathroom allowed for a bath with an amazing nighttime view, and you can also frost the glass for privacy. We had breakfast in the club lounge, and the food was pretty nondescript, but the place was very quiet and relaxing, again with a pretty view. I only wish we had stayed longer. When we come back to Tokyo we will absolutely be staying in this hotel. We stayed in some nice hotels this trip including a beautiful ryokan, but this was my favorite. It was easily worth the price for us.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for three amazing nights and enjoyed everything about the hotel. The room had a good size with huge window and a super comfortable bed. I specifically really liked the yukata robes and slippers that they nicely put on the bed every evening. The bathroom is simply the best that I've ever seen (I spend more than 120 nights in hotels annually)Breakfast in the main restaurant and tea hours in the club were also very good quality and delicious.Location is really good. I wasn't sure before my trip about not being in the middle of action, but every evening I appreciated coming back to the peaceful area of the hotel. It's 5-min walk from different subway lines and good restaurants.Everyone that we encountered was very polite and friendly.Make sure to enjoy the pool and jacuzzi in the morning when it's not crowded. We had a peaceful experience which helped with our soar muscles after walking miles and miles in Tokyo.Overall, an excellent 5-star stay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Beautifully styled hotel with relatively large rooms for Tokyo. Great service but a little cold and sterile feeling. Lounge access for Platinum members but as a vegetarian I would appreciate more options, however, overall, it was a nice space and had the basics.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We were on the club level with an amazing view. The bed was very comfortable and the shower area was huge. Everyone who worked at the hotel were helpful and kind. We were there during the new emperor’s coronation so there were dignitaries staying there and therefore secret service everywhere we went. Was not a problem for us as everyone was very polite!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The rooms are huge (by Tokyo’s standards), the digital lighting and tablet that controls the room was like a personal butler. The staff were helpful and even continued giving useful tips even after I have finished the conversation. The drop off entrance is in the basement, shaded from the sun and rain.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel had an obligation to advise us when we booked that our stay would be severely interrupted by the Hotel's decision to turn the hotel into what you experience at an airport and even worse. Everyone had their bags searched and were asked to walk through security guard with detectors. Even if you had only just walked out and they could see your room card, they would force you to stop and actually ask you to open up your handbag. Then to make matters worse you could only use certain elevators and the staff had the audacity to say "Excuse me, step aside, important person coming". You would be made to stand still and wait. Then some embassy staff and embassy security staff would walked passed.". You would be told "Ok thank you, you can proceed now, but you need to only use this elevator". This went on for our stay and we found it shameful and all the hotel had to do was email us and say they are having some embassy staff stay at the hotel, and because these people think they are important and deserve special treatment, you will be subjected to having your hand bag searched, and you will need to go through security men every single time you walk in and out of the hotel. This is not a holiday. This is an accurate and detailed evaluation of the rest of the hotel, and we are able to supply dates and name and room number.Club Floor:The staff are lazy. You actually have to ask them "Is this table ok to sit at, it looks like there is no one here, but there are dirty plates and glasses and we have been standing around and wondering if we can sit here". They are so lazy, they just seem to be at the front desk on the computer but there are no guests there. Next, they do not replenish the canapes etc after 6.15pm even though they are open until 7pm and we found it was so stingy and a lack of canapes etc that we have paid for in the higher room rate. We also noticed that the security staff and staff of the embassy were using the Club Floor and they were on their mobiles and looking at everyone, it was very uncomfortable. We don't feel they should have been allowed in there because the Ambassador wasn't in there. The Rooms:The Security Men stood on all the floors and starring at any guest who came out of the lift and there were security men standing in the corridors. It was really uncomfortable and not right that management of this hotel out of sheer greed didn't tell us up front about this intrusion. If you want to have Ambassadors and staff in your hotel and basically turn the hotel into an airport, even worse actually than the airport because at least at the airport people don't stop you and say "Please stop, important person is going to be walking by". What an absolute joke that these people actually think they are important. We thought the Prime Minister must have been there and even if he was and he wasn't, the hotel has an obligation to advise guests who are on a holiday this is what is going to happen and if you don't feel comfortable, then you can have the opportunity to choose another hotel. The Bathrooms:The bathrooms are dysfunctional. There is ONE small sink and hardly any vanity space. And when you stand at the ONE small sink which is low, your legs are pressing into a metal rail for a towel. The lack of vanity space is terrible and this was in their Executive Club Room, so it would be the same for the other rooms. We spoke to some other people and they commented on the one sink with hardly any vanity room. Next, the toilet is close to the sink and the toilet detects you near the sink and the lid goes up etc as if you are going to walk in and use the toilet. The shower is a joke. If you are in the shower and someone wants to use the bathtub, they have to walk through your water because the bath and shower are in the same large area with no separation and all the tiles around the bath are wet from the shower. The Bed:The bed was very comfortable and clean.The TV:The only TV in the world where we couldn't get it to be in English and we had to ring up Reception twice.The Reception Staff:The lady who checked us in spoke English but didn't really understand English. She was shocking and was giggling and had no idea what we were asking. When we asked her if we could speak to someone who spoke English she just giggled again. The Concierge:Really obvious she dislikes her job. Unfriendly, and it was like we were a nuisance to ask about things and of course while we were at her desk "Excuse me, please stand aside....Important person coming, please stand still, thank you thank you" Some lady probably one of the wives comes walking through with her staff. Then, other guests were told "Only use this lift". The Lifts:If you pay the extra for the club lounge, you have to change lifts. Terrible design and set up.Conclusion:We found the Japanese people in Tokyo so well mannered and lovely except here in this hotel. They had no regard for the huge amount of money we paid to stay at the hotel, which was worse than staying at the airport. The staff in the club lounge are just down right lazy. One staff member said No English and went and got a man. Food was terrible. Waste of money. Small too. The management are devious not telling paying guests about the embassy staff staying at the hotel and the interrogation and having to stand aside and having to open up your hand bag. If these people are important to you, then sacrifice your other rooms for innocent people like us paying full freight money for the rip off club floor rooms and the lazy staff who are in the club floor.You really are a shame to such a beautiful city. You bring down the integrity of your brand. Honesty is always the best policy. Be up front and tell full paying guests about the interruptions next time, and let the guests decide if they want this type of holiday.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: From the moment we arrived I could not fault one thing. The hotel is stunning, positioned perfectly and with views from every room and the staff are beyond gracious and helpful which is so important when you can’t speak any Japanese. Every facility is available and more. The rooms are huge, the bathrooms magnificent and your every need is thought of including th3 use of pajamas if you choose. The bar was amazing and everything I ate on Sight was delicious. I even remarked I had no need to go out but just stay in and enjoy being pampered. Don’t miss this one.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Facilities are great. However I believe hospitality is the service you provide and this hotel a lot of training to do. They are nowhere close to RC Kyoto. Club Lounge staff are nice however they need to walk around more and tidy and pick up empty glasses napkins etc. from previous guests. Food there is not worth it. I don’t understand why a hotel in Tokyo serve makers mark but no Japanese whisky! Concierge seems afraid to recommend a restaurant they just count the names something I can do on my phone. Check in process was not very welcoming or informative. Overall staff is not very friendly or genuine. Interactions seem little robotic unfortunately. I don’t even want to get into using the pool which we were allowed two hours after we went there when we were getting ready to go to dinner. Comical! And we are titanium elite members if that means anything...Views from rooms and the service at the bar was great. So if you can get a good rate and lower your expectations decent place to stay. Thank you.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Our experience at the Prince was fantastic. Upon arrival in our taxi we went under the hotel and were greeted at the drop off entrance by several folks, then whisked upstairs to the main lobby for check in. They took our bags for us, then upon check in they showed us all of the amenities in the room. The room is fully connected, so everything can be controlled by the panel or the in-room iPad. Luxurious bed and bedding, beautiful bathroom, and incredible views over the city. We loved everything about it and highly recommend the king room. We very much look forward to our return trip to the Prince! Quick note for status holders of Marriott, discount at food is offered. We did not know this when we had dinner (paid yen) but found out at lunch when paying with our Bonvoy card, so that’s an awesome thing!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This was our second stay at The Prince Gallery Tokyo and it was great! Although this was not planned and we booked last minute because we were stuck in Tokyo because of Typhoon Hagibis we were very well taken care of by the staff at this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Wonderful hotel with spectacular city views. Impeccable rooms with beautiful and well thought of layout and design. Will stay again when back in Tokyo. 5 stars through and through. My only suggestion to staff would be to train concierge better. They seem to be at a loss to recommend good authentic places and not sure they understand what tourists are really looking for.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I like everything about this hotel: its one of those great hotels whose floors start above ground level so you get a view of the city. Outstanding customer service and attentive from arrival at ground level to every step in the hotel.I always feel they are overstaffed downstairs compared to any other hotel in the same category around in other continents to give this outstanding service.The restaurant for breakfast has a large selection and you can't but help notice the proprietary aroma (that is available in the gift store) when you come to the hotel lobby and rooms.Finally, the health club / fitness center is very well equipped. Free weights (including benchpress), large number of treadmills that makes sure nobody is waiting for one.There is also a full length pool for doing laps. And if facing the right side, you get a view of Mount Fuji...

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: close to the train station and have a good swimming poor which can only accept adults elder than 18. Breakfast is till 10 AM but platium member can't use lounge. There is a beautiful little garden from 4th floor. It's convenient to book airport shuttle cost 1 hour and easier than taking trains.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Thank goodness my job involves extensive because I could never afford this type of hotel on my personal budget! Wow! It oozes top end luxury and style and so it should for the price! You get everything you pay for and more.Firstly it smells amazing! That might sound random but take my word for it, every corner is perfumed.Each window has a big city Tokyo view!The rooms are Uber comfort and space with all of the expected bells and whistles.The bar is right out of a movie scene!Win the lottery and go! You won’t regret it. What an experience.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: From the second you arrive in the building lobby, you are treated like royality....the service is exceptional...Very convenient location for touring, shopping, and dinning options....also, for transportation (right next to subway station).But the rooms....WOW. The rooms are large and comfortable, have great views and have every luxury feature known to man... power drapes, privacy glass in the bathroom, central light and air conditioner centrally controlled from a tablet, or panel by the bed.The breakfast buffet was in 1 word....spectacular. Also, the view from the bar and restaurant is breathtaking.My only, and I mean ONLY criticism...as a Marriott Titanium level, you do not have access to the club level without an extra charge.I would absolutely recommend this hotel, and stay again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: After spending one week in Seoul in a Four Seasons, we arrived to The Prince Gallery Tokyo and we were pleasantly surprised with the high standards they provide. At first we wanted to stay in a Ritz Carlton, but some friends recommended this hotel and we really were impressed by the level of service and the quality of the facilities. We booked a suitewith amazing views to the Palace and an amazing bathroom (it has a big window, amazing when you use the bathtub). Service is Topnotch and at the same level of a Ritz Carlton or the Four Seasons we stayed the week before. The Club Lounge is a must!We will happily return to this hotel when in Seoul!Thank You!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My wife and I traveled to Tokyo and Kyoto this September for a special anniversary trip. The Prince Gallery hotel did everything possible to make this stay incredible while in Tokyo. We had a beautiful Corner King Suite with a view of the city and have to say after staying in luxury hotels around the world, this was the most incredible room I've ever been in - the bathroom was amazing. And the location was absolutely perfect in between the city's best neighborhoods and train station. I would recommend this hotel to anyone with the budget to splurge. It's worth every penny. Thank you to the staff who made us feel like a true guest in Japan. Domo arigato!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: A great hotel with excellent view of Tokyo and a central location. The hotel is close to two Metro stations. Central enough to reach every where in Tokyo within 30 minutes by taxi. Great services. Excellent swimming pool, bathing area has perfect view of the city. The restaurant took some time to serve the foods but the quality was top class. A lively bar during weekdays because of the offices nearby. The room is modern and luxurious. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Excellent hotel with extremely comfortable room which had an amazing view of city being on 34th floor. Very handy for metro station so very easy to get around. Many nearby restaurants too. Breakfast had a good variety of western and Japanese food. Would definitely recommend

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Beautiful hotel with a modern design. Got upgraded to a suite which was extremely spacious. Staff was friendly and professional. F&b experience was good at the hotel precisely the bar on the 35th floor. As well as there is a Starbucks connected to the hotel woth other f&b outlets

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Beautiful large room, amazing views of the city and such a great spot for exploring Tokyo. Metro line within a few minutes of the hotel. Easy to get there on the Manouchi line from Tokyo Station - less than 10 minutes. If you don’t have breakfast included, there is a nice Dean and DeLuca coffee shop underneath the hotel at the bottom of the escalators. Definately recommend this hotel. Close also to bars and restaurants in Akasaka!!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Just returned from a 5 night stay at this amazing hotel. First off, it's very easy to get to. We opted to take the Narita Express from the airport directly to Tokyo Station. From there get on the Marunouchi Line towards Ogikubo and hop off at M13, Akasaka-mitsuke station. The Prince Gallery can be easily seen after exiting onto the street. Another alternative is the Friendly Airport Limousine which offers bus service directly to the hotel. We were sold on the rooms prior to our trip by going on youtube and watching videos from people who have stayed there. Our room was not worn or distressed from previous use. We loved the huge window that looked out towards Tokyo Skytree. We'd spend many nights on the padded bench against the window just talking and soaking it all in. The décor is beautiful and the room was very well laid out. There were useful amenities like an ironing board/iron that we utilized as well. One big thing that we discovered later during our stay was the conbini on the second floor of the building. Japanese convenience stores are a step up from what we have in the States in terms of fresh food offerings. We ended up eating at conbinis several times during our vacation and it was like striking gold when we found out there was one in the same building. During our first night at the hotel we were hungry and spent almost $75 on room service. You can spend a fraction of that at the conbini downstairs.Speaking of food, the Oasis Garden does have a legit breakfast offering. You can choose from the buffet plus one item from a set menu or a traditional Japanese breakfast sans the buffet. At around $40 per person it's a tad pricey. If you book a room with breakfast included I calculated the savings to be around $10 per person versus paying for it separately. Despite the price, we enjoyed it so much that we came back every morning during our stay to fuel up for all the walking that was to come. The views from the dining area aren't too shabby either. Some random notes. The hotel smells amazing. Certain public areas have the most amazing scent. It was lovely returning to the hotel and smelling this as you walked around. The service was impeccable too. Although many people recommend staying in Shinjuku or Shibuya we really enjoyed this area of Tokyo since it felt like we were returning to someplace quiet. It was also nicely positioned between the areas of the city that we wanted to explore. We definitely plan on staying here again for future trips.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Spent 5 nights at the Prince Gallery Hotel in August staying in a club floor room. The room was extremely spacious by Tokyo standards, exceptionally well furnished and serviced twice daily. The hotel itself and the room had stunning t views over Tokyo. The club lounge is small but of top quality, with an excellent breakfast selection. Service throughout the hotel was top notice and perfunctory. The hotel has two major subway stations within a 2 minute walk and is within walking distance to a lovely collection of restaurants and shops within the Kioicho area. Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We came for a long weekend to escape the rains in southern Japan. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and the service was wonderful. I can’t imagine that there is a room that doesn’t have an amazing view of the Tokyo skyline. We stayed in the standard deluxe room with a king bed. However, this bed was significantly larger than a king bed- I think it was actually two full beds put together. It. Was. Amazing. The floor to curling windows have electric shades you can operate from an iPad- which means you can make it completely black out dark in your room. We slept like babies for the entire weekend!All of the amenities in the room were top notch. The bath and shower was simply amazing. Housekeeping was friendly.The hotel sushi bar was excellent, and no need for reservations. We also enjoyed the hotel bar, which has an excellent cocktail menu and killer view.As stated, the hotel is in a mixed use development- so there is a Dean & Deluca, Starbucks, supermarket, convenience store, and numerous restaurants within an elevator ride. You are also a 3 minute walk to two metro stops, so you basically have all the good metro lines within easy access (Ginza, Marunouchi, Hanzomon, Nambouku lines).The only thing that hotel could improve on was the arrival. When we arrived at the Porte-cochere in our taxi, we were escorted inside and told our room wasn’t ready. So they asked us to take a seat in the entry area- which is very modern, Japanese-minimalist style. There were quite a few people waiting in this area. What we didn’t realize at the time is that this wasn’t the lobby. We sat in this area for about 20-30 minutes- it was slightly warm since the doors are constantly opening and closing and they didn’t offer any water while we waited. If we had just rolled off a long international flight, I might have been more irritated about this scenario.Eventually, we were told our room was ready and we were escorted to the elevator and the actual lobby on the 36th floor for check in. I’m not sure why we couldn’t have waited for our room in the hotel lobby on the 36th floor with the gorgeous view and beautiful lounge area.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The Prince Gallery is actually inside a larger mixed-use building with shopping and offices on the lower levels. The hotel is mainly on the upper 10 or so floors. This means the lift configuration is a bit odd as you have to change lifts to get from the reception area to the room floors. No biggie. The view from every floor is spectacular! We were facing the Imperial Gardens and Tokyo Skytree and it was fantastic. The bar on the 35th floor also had a stellar view of Tokyo Tower and some amazing drinks. One of us fell in love with the mixed berry mojito! One of the best things about the hotel though is the location just opposite a metro station. This was how we got around the whole city and it was amazingly convenient to have 5 different lines to choose from. The hotel was also very sweet and left us some nice goodies when we arrived as we were celebrating our first anniversary! Always a nice touch to go above and beyond! The bathroom was also a shining star. The array of available toiletries was incomparable! The Toto smart toilet raised and lowered its own lid when you entered or exited the toilet space. The glass walls surrounding the bath/shower area could go opaque if you wanted extra privacy. It was a spectacular experience overall!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: For starters, Ms. Tanaka San at the front desk foxed snafus in our reservations and got us back on track quickly. This is a small luxury collection hotel within the Marriott fwmily and does NOT offer some of the automatic lounge privileges that accrue to the Titanium level guests Restaurant for Breakfast .. amazing .. spa health club all up to par and very well located for Tourist and Shopping .. using the subway system

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel ticks many boxes, however travelling it’s 2 (well behaved teens aged 14 and 16) we were very disappointed that to learn that not only could they not use the hotel pool (one of reasons for booking) we also couldn’t sit in the bar after 6pm‍♀️ would choose another hotel over this next time

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Amazing contemporary luxury hotel in Tokyo. The reception, restaurants and lounge are located on the top floor with view over Tokyo. Especially breakfast is breathtaking as not only quality and variety is outstanding but the view is simply stunning. The rooms are perfect with open layout and very high-class materials and features. As you expect the service and room service are also high class. Everything in this hotel is designed to highest standard and ultra modern.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed at the Prince Gallery Hotel for 5 days recently in one of their spacious corner deluxe rooms. The hotel itself is located at the top of a tall skyscraper in the Chiyoda district of Tokyo which offered us amazing 180 degree view of surrounding Tokyo. It is located literally right next to the Asakasa-Mitsuke station which allows for easy access to 2 Tokyo Metro lines and thus easy access to the main tourist sites. We arrived here from Narita Airport to the metro station. The room itself was immaculate with a spacious bathroom which we loved the separate bathtub/shower head space. There was evening turn down service which was very much appreciated We were able to enjoy the breakfast buffet at the Oasis restaurant which has both Western offerings as well as Japanese breakfast option. Thought the variety of food offered was slightly less compared to similar luxury hotels throughout Asia. Overall, we loved our stay at the hotel and would stay again on our next visit to Tokyo. I think that when someone stays at a luxury hotel, the level of service must be truly outstanding to distinguish itself from other hotels and the Prince Gallery definitely has that level of service !!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My stay was 7/27~8/1. During my check-in, I met the Front Desk staff "Kiminami-san", he explained very carefully to me during the check-in process and provided two small gifts to my kids. I have ordered a birthday cake as surprise to my wife, they send to my room on time. Birthday cake is lovely and their arrangement is appreciated. Supervisor Club Lounge "Hirota-san" prepared and printed what I need (fishing centre and character cafe), although he did not explained to me directly, ito-san passed the information to me and explained very clearly to me. I did not enjoy the breakfast at Club, but I feel the kindness from the club team, they always keep a pleasant face to guests. On 7/28 morning, I woke up early and went to Front Desk to check some information on my trip, I found "Kiminami-san" worked intently, that was 06:00, very honestly, in other hotels, you may find some Front Desk staff in the sleepy mode, I did not see any tiredness from "Kiminami-san", I saw his professional. If you stay in this hotel, I strongly recommend you to have a Japanese Buffet, it takes around 15~20 mins to prepare, but it is really lovely breakfast. I also needs to thanks your Concierge team, before my stay, I sent a lot of emails on my activity... subway route, restaurant, opening hours, admission fee.... thanks to "Mukai-san", "Yamaguchi-san", "Takayanagi-san", Nozaki-san", "Hasegawa-san", "Momoi-san".... very appreciated your prompt email reply and provided very accurate and detailed information to me. Not sure when will come back, but it must be an good opinion to stay in Tokyo. I got 2 nights with room upgrade, thanks "Kiminami-san' for your help in my upgrade.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I'm Bonvoy Platinum status and have stayed in the Prince Gallery many times. It's a good quality hotel in a good location but this stay was disappointing. There is zero recognition of Platinum membership and the check in experience was poor. For the price, and with no benefits, the Hyatt offers a better alternative.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Check-in and left in-between for other cities and came back during last day after AMAN Tokyo. The service staff at the level 2 recognize me and even remembered where I went. This makes it delightful comparing to AMAN.The concierge assist me greatly in making recommendations and booking the restaurants via email. The lounge and rooms are faultless.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This property was a pleasant surprise in every aspect of our experience and, considering the quality, I would label it a good value. The staff were extraordinary - one of the concierges, Hannah, called all day to get us a difficult dinner reservation [Thank you, Hannah]. The rooms were spacious, especially considering this is Tokyo. I loved the pajamas and robes provided. The shower was one of the best I have ever had in a hotel. The location allows easy access to 4 subway lines as well as some local attractions within walking distance while the views from our room were spectacular. The fitness center was also excellent with full equipment and trainers on site. Lastly, we ate the buffet breakfast at the hotel twice which was exceptional. All in all, this is a fantastic place to stay and will be my regular hotel in Tokyo from now on.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: They do not offer anything to recognize Titanium members, so no room upgrade, no lounge access and no welcome gift. Now with that said this is a fabulous hotel and one of the nicest we have ever stayed at. Don’t hesitate to book here. Floor to ceiling windows with beautiful views of a Tokyo. The shower had the best water pressure of any place I have ever stayed, it was even better than my water pressure at home. The concierge was wonderful, she gave us perfect instructions to ride a bullet train, ride the rope ways and see Mt Fuji- we wanted to do it on our own and not as part of a tour and her guidance was spot on and we had a blast. The concierge also recommended the best teppanyaki restaurant. Really enjoyed the concierge recommendations and the restaurant in the hotel is also very good after a long day out. We rode the Narita Express train from NRT airport to the Tokyo station and then you can either ride the subway or take a short cab ride from the station to the hotel. When at the airport just buy a round trip ticket right where you walk out from customs- be sure to reserve your seat and time for the return train ride.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is one of my two favourite Tokyo Hotels (the other being the Peninsula) and is truly exceptional. Excellent staff, stylish and modern luxury rooms and excellent bathrooms. The bathroom is an all-glass room in the back corner of the room itself, and the glass frosts over to create an opaque wall at a touch. The breakfast service is fantastic and the staff are helpful, polite and attentive without being over bearing. The hotel benefits from a stunning bar area which looks over Shinjuku and has a three storey floor to ceiling glass window. It is futuristic and stylish/modern and worth a visit in of itself.The hotel is located on the 34-36th floors of a modern glass building, and is based over a high-end shopping centre with many great Resteraunts. It also has dedicated underground /metro access which is convenient for Akihabara and Shinjuku. It also has the best smoking lounge in Tokyo (if you need one) .Each room has an iPad which controls the temperature, curtains, windows and room service/cleaning services. The iPad is really useful because it comes in several languages (although the staff speak impeccable English with many who speak Mandarin and Korean. The beds are very comfortable. Although the rooms are a bit smaller than comparable hotels (like the Peninsula) they are laid out in such a way that they feel larger and more spacious. I think the rooms are all standard sized across the hotel (except the very high end suites) and have stunning views with large windows and bay window seating area. The hotel is stunning all-round and is great value for what they offer. The room service was excellent and the dining options equally good. I can’t think of any way it could improve.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I don’t often write reviews, and when I do they are usually positive. This is the rare exception. I do not feel entitled, but I do have the expectation that the room type I reserve and pay for is available on arrival. The fact that I am an upper tier member (Titanium) only makes it worse that my room type was not available. Ironically, my colleagues were offered complimentary lounge access. I received nothing. And to be clear. I reserved a King room and was give two twin beds. Yes, twin beds. On a more trivial level I asked for my folio to be emailed at checkout. My email address was confirmed, but 3 days later I have not received the folio. Not sure what to suggest, but I’ll look for other Bonvoy properties on future visits.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I'm going back to this hotel in two weeks, the third week-long stay this year. It's a beautiful hotel, and the rooms are well appointed. Staff is excellent; all the best of Japanese attention to detail and service is felt here.Breakfast is great at the lobby restaurant. They mix it up a little bit every day, which is nice.My only gripe with the hotel is the lounge access. The first time I was there I believe the front desk gave me lounge access as a welcome. It was great. I stopped by every day to grab a snack or drink.I'm an Ambassador status with Bonvoy - the highest status you can achieve with the chain, High spend, and high night count. Despite this, when I was there last week, I couldn't get lounge access. I thought it was a mistake at first because I'm a frequent visitor and the highest tier. But at the front desk, they would not offer it.I'm going to be staying at the Prince Gallery in two weeks again for another week stay. I'm hoping I can get the lounge access again. This would bump it back up to a five-star rating!It's a lovely hotel overall. The area it is located - Akasaka has a huge amount of restaurants just a few blocks away from the hotel. Lots of options.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Have AN very memorable stay last year, upon seeing a very good price on Marriott sale at dates after golden week, I just book without hesitation.Prior to arriving, exchange a few emails with concierge team for restaurant reservation and purpose of visit, alas the restaurant we want to book don't accept phone booking, it must be a direct booking via the appointed website.Been reading some horrible review about the hotel prior Bonvoy integration, but the front desk make some exception for this stay.Upon arriving, Bell Desk team is very polite and helpful with our many pieces of luggage, while check-in, the room was upgraded to Grand Deluxe Premier(62m), It was not shown on my account prior, a very nice surprise for our anniversary trip, last year even better, upgraded to Designer suite with SNA(not applicable after integration).The KeyCard printing is much better now, it was faded easily.Well, the room is huge by Tokyo standard, with swan anniversary decoration, thank you PrinceGallery team, :D, It's facing Tokyo sky tree which makes night view even better. The bathroom also huge, I still remember spending me time at the bathtub and just enjoy Tokyo scenery. New USB port beside the bed? or I forgot that it was there last year, only remember they provide charger and cable.Given exception to enjoy the lounge by concierge team, thank you for this nice gesture and recommend me to book club room (which I never did). Lounge much less crowded from past stay, it's still gorgeous, with polite and attentive staff, and in my opinion with tastier hors d'oeuvre, I can understand why some hi tier member gets frustrating, not able to enjoy complimentary lounge access.Breakfast is almost the same, I can't understand why some reviewers don't like the BF, it is one of the best that I ever tried, with so many variations to choose, and the main selling is the VIEW. The choice still the same, western / buffet / beautiful Japanese BF presentation. Tried the swimming pool this time, just want to enjoy the scenery. This hotel also has a good looking and comfortable smoking room just beside the business room, A little suggestion time limitation for using the computer extended to 2 hours, sometimes 1 hour is not enough to do the works, have to start all over again opening this and that.While checking out, have quite a long line, and a bit messy, due to a small misunderstanding. but it was handled gracefully. Again, the Bell Desk team very helpful with our luggage.Overall it is an excellent experience again, will give this hotel 5 star anytime. Hope the SNA reinstate and lounge access restore.Will be back again no matter what is the benefit, :D

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great hotel - can't beat the location. It is a smaller hotel in a commercial tower and very elegantly done. Staff is really friendly and desire to serve. Concierge team was really amazing finding us last minute dinner spots (everyone has reservations everywhere). Food is great in the hotel - we tried lots of spots. Bars are fun and chill depending on your mood. outside of the hotel is tons of great food options too. Rooms were clean, good size and quite comfortable. Pool and onsen is nice view and great place to relax as well. i would say all in all it was a very lovely stay. if I was going to give any constructive criticism in would be for the oasis Garden, the hotel all-day dining. Food is great - it was just the general flexibility of the staff that was challenging. They are just too rigid and struggle when you ask for something out of the ordinary. For example, my wife ate an early lunch and we wanted to sit next to each other on a bench seat. We were the only people in the entire place, but they could not offer us any place to sit next to each other and even asking the manager on duty, they still could not figure it out. Claiming to have reservations all coming in shortly, but we ate our food, had a relaxing bottle of wine and left the place with tons of empty seats that would have fit our needs. these little things are an annoyance and don't fit the super luxury service level that the hotel is going for.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: A really great and beautiful hotel. Tons of modern touches, with wonderful staff who were super helpful. Fantastic views from the suite and great bar drinks and ambience. Would definitely stay at again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The location of the hotel is great. It's within walking distance to the metro and quite centrally located. The service ranges from great to simply impeccable. Housekeeping in particular stood out. Our room was cleaned to perfection and all the supplies restocked even at evening turn-down. Our basic room is spacious, especially considering the hotel's in the center of Tokyo. The room is very quiet. The bed is comfortable.I only had the Japanese breakfast on the 35th floor and it was quite lovely. I preferred it over the buffet because it's more unique and is served. The spa facilities and swimming pool are amazing for winding down after a day of sightseeing. My only complaint is that tattoos need to be covered to use the swimming pool and spa facilities but the seals they provided did not work. I am aware this is the norm in Japan but it is 2019 and this is a very international hotel. I have also seen other hotels that state very clearly that they are fine with tattoos at the hotel spa so it is being done. Overall I had a wonderful stay and will definitely be returning!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Thank you Prince Gallery. We had the best time in Tokyo. We stayed here for 7 days. The hotel concierge helped us make a reservation to dine at Jiro. It would of been impossible to get a reservation on our own. We were also upgraded to a corner room. The room was amazing. We were able to see the night view of Tokyo Tower and Skytree from our bed and also while taking a bath. The hotel is very clean and modern The staff were all friendly and polite. We also enjoyed breakfast. There weren't any surcharge for Japanese Breakfast. The lounge was amazing too. I would love to stay here again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel is great. Very modern clean and nice. Location is excellent. Nice gym nice breakfast nice bar. Language is a barrier (like in other hotels) so you need lots of patience ...room was big and price was excellent or what you get

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The most incredible hotel in Tokyo! Super modern and exclusive! From the bar you can admire view for the Tokyo tower. In the middle of the city centre. Very close to the palace. The bathroom has the glassy walls. Would love to back there!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for three nights prior to beginning a cruise, and I hated to leave my lovely room. I had booked a "basic" room due to being a Titanium Elite Bonvoy member and believing that I'd at least get a one-category-up upgrade. Unfortunately for me, our trip coincided with Golden Week, and I was promptly told (nicely) upon check-in that no upgrades were available. I was expecting a sad little room but was extremely happy with what I got.The view is spectacular, the bathroom was amazing - the enclosure included both the huge shower space and the tub, which created a warm, cozy little area - the toilet has more functions than my cars, the window shades create COMPLETE darkness that I wish every hotel had, the bedside room control panels were extensive, the A/C worked well, the bed was super comfortable, and the closet space was excellent. Other than wishing Luxury level hotels offered Lounge access to Titanium members for free, I can't fault this room in the slightest. We had drinks and dinner in the bar area with its amazing view, and the food was excellent and staff were very friendly. It is a little hard to eat on the low seats / tables if you're of a normal Westerner height, so I'd recommend the bar.Check in was an interesting experience, with the staff having us sit in the lobby and them coming to us, but it felt like a luxury hotel touch. Bell staff were superbly friendly as well. The location is good due to a very short walk to the subway station.Overall I was very pleased with the hotel and would recommend it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: There is so much to say about this 5 star hotel but I'll make it short and sweet. If you are in the Tokyo area, this really is a must stay. From the moment we checked in until the sad moment we checked out they were amazing. The respect level is so far above so many 5 star hotels I have stayed at. They 100% make you feel that you are their only concern, and whatever you need is completed. The room was very large and had a stunning view of the Tokyo Tower and city surroundings. The hotel food, and bar area well kept and well staffed. The local area has plenty to see and do, food, bars etc. Its a short train ride to many "must see" sights as well. Thank You to everyone at THE PRINCE GALLERY

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This was a fantastic experience - the hotel sits atop a high-rise and occupies the 30-36th floors. You go to the 36th floor to check in. I was fortunate enough to be able to bring my wife with me on a business trip and we both were treated to about the best hotel experience that you can imagine. The hotel itself is spectacular - the views are amazing and the rooms are very nice, spotlessly clean and extremely comfortable. The shades are excellent, the A/C worked flawlessly, the bed was super comfortable so consequently we slept very well. The bathroom is amazing, with a rain shower that was just perfect, plenty of super soft towels and robes (plus great turn-down each night) and even a electronic smart toilet (really). The staff are practically falling over themselves to be of service, I cannot say enough about them. They are gracious, kind, thoughtful and courteous and also fun - we really enjoyed Kentaro and his team in the Executive Lounge each day - we miss them already! Speaking of which, they also gave us a great variety of food and drink and went out of their way to help us on everything from sightseeing to finding a place to watch Formula 1 on television. Finally, the pool/spa/fitness room is on the 30th floor and it's huge with top-notch equipment, a helpful staff and spectacular views. If you are lucky enough to be able to stay here, do - it's a memorable experience for sure.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I am currently staying at the The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho together with my family. I have chosen this hotel mainly because it has a pool so that we can relax with my two daughters after a long day’s sightseeing. Unfortunately, when we tried to use the pool today we were told it is an adult only pool. This is not mentioned on the website nor on my booking confirmation. On the contrary, I have seen it being advertised for its “all year round indoor pool”. Had I known that this doesn’t apply to children, I would have chosen a different, cheaper hotel so I am not just disappointed for my kids but also annoyed about the additional cost.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We wanted our last night in Tokyo to have a city view, and this place delivered. Pros:-We left our bags with them to go explore before our room was ready (and after we checked out before heading to the airport). -The views. Holy lovely. We had city views of Tokyo Skytree and the rest of the cityscape. It was so happy.-Cutting edge technology in the rooms. Everything is operated by tablet (blinds/shades, lights, temperature). -The bathtub was heavenly. Not only did it also have a view, but there was a perfectly placed, foam-like headrest.-Lovely staff. -Comfortable bed and bedding. Con:-I wish we had stayed longer!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Just got done checking in - Titanium member - I am not offered lounge access. Actually they explain Marriott changed to Bonvoy and changed the program. Actually front desk staff not nice about it.I got a crappy room.Good example of the hotels making up their own rules.Avoid this hotel unless you don’t want any Marriott benefits.#bonvoyed

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Exclusive hotel, the best luxury city hotel I've ever been to.The rooms are very large and comfortable and all have great views of Tokyo as they are between 30 and 35 floors.I was here for 4 days during the golden week. The service was excellent. And the man in the reception helped us a lot on the problems we had with the credit card.We had access to the executive lounge, breakfast was very quiet, with an excellent choice of dishes. In the evenings it was much more complete with people, but the food offered was of a very high quality.The hotel's location is excellent, close to 5 metro stations, and the nearby Akasaka neighborhood is full of restaurants.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Probably the best hotel in Tokyo. Stayed here twice already and the service is just superb from reception to Spa to turn down service! International breakfast buffet (about 4,400¥ pp, including tax/service) has a very nice selection of tasty food. And the views are spectacular from any corner.
