hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We have traveled the world and have stayed at many luxurious hotels. If I had to make a list of my top 5, the Prince Gallery Hotel makes the list. It is a modern hotel with high tech amenities and at the same time the grace, courtesy and attention to detail. We were upgraded to a Deluxe room on the 30th floor that had a view of Mount Fuji. The curtains, bathroom with the see through glass (that frosted with a click of a button), the quality of the mattress were superb. The Spa has a jacuzzi with a view of the Tokyo sky line. The 90 min deep tissue massage was one of the best I have had and left me rejuvenated from our travails. We had a meal at the fine dining restaurant. We got a corner window table on the 35 the floor with a panaromic view of the Tokyo night skyline.Would definitely stay here again. Recommend without reservations

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We been there in April, room with a great view and full set of facilities and amenities, the bed super comfortable, the curtain is so brilliant, it is wow made me with a deep sleep. Stuffs so friendly and super helpful. They do have multi drinks plus cocktails at club lounge ( there’s no cocktail menu) but not a big issue,we do enjoyed.We also try a cocktail at the rooftop bar, it was so fantastic. The breakfast is quite good, a great swimming pool and also the fitness center. Location is abit far away from tourist attractive area but it’s alright because they close to the subway and there’s two subways is nearby.We totally enjoyed and loved our stay with them.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My partner and I were staying at this spectacular hotel for two nights in the last two days of the Heisei era. Great thanks to 宇佐美さん in the club lounge. We felt warmly welcome during the check-in process, and the corner room is so impressive to stay with. The room is high tech and spacious. The view is astonishing. We can see the Skytree and Tokyo Tower at the same time when we were in bed! And the Tokyo tower view while in the shower or taking a bath! The club lounge is high quality as well a bit crowded while it seems a bit crowded during the time we stayed. The location of this hotel is very accessible. There are two subway stations and five subway lines. We will definitely visit again at our next Tokyo trip!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed recently to give it a test. Rooms are very well thought out and quiet, and the bed extremely comfortable. Front desk service was fine, as was the bar, but the overall ambience was of a 3 or 4 star business hotel, albeit a brand new one. The breakfast was disappointing; weak breads, perfunctory fruit selection and meagre salads, reminiscent of a domestic-focused regional Japan offering. Japan's labor shortage, especially in hospitality, really showing up in the youth and inexperience of some of the floor staff. And the music throughout? Bizarre and detracting from the ambience rather than adding to it. C&W and American pops in the Japanese baths; random trance influences in the bar and a bit of everything, all of it too loud, in the all-day restaurant. Conclusion: If you can cocoon yourself in the room this is probably a worthwhile destination, but if you want an all round lux hotel experience, you can do much better in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We had a great stay! Had a little trouble when we tried to book a tour and the concierge could not find tickets because of golden week. By the time we found out we did not have the tickets, there was nothing we could do, but the concierge CHIAKI KIMIWADA went out of her way to find us something to do an a tour to take. She even went to the train station twice to make sure we got tickets. She helped us a lot and gave us clear instructions as to what to do once we got there. She is a great concierge, the hotel is lucky to have her!All the staff was nice, and check-in check-out was swift.The room was a great size for Tokyo hotels and had the best view ever!Loved the shutter for window and convenience of opening and shutting.Loved the japanese toilet!The hotel was great with a few inconveniences:*Breakfast was just average with very little variety. Also, because of the holiday, you had to wait to be seated and they closed at 10, so you had little time.*Room lighting was annoying having to use iPad (I am very tech, so this was not the problem), you can't control everything and some lights you could only turn on or off with the general switch button. It's annoying to have to turn on ipad, press room controls, and theeeeen turn on or off what you want. At other hotels, the controls are right there when the tablet is touched.*No way to turn off auto light when going to toilet at night, annoying because you don't want to wake up, just go. The bathroom senses you're coming, so it turns on the light and wakes your companion!*Getting to your room is not swift, have to take 2 elevators.*Food is expensive.*This is in the financial district so not many places to go to by foot.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel itself is nice, with a beautiful view and the rooms are impeccable.Unfortunately, I have something negative to say.Being a 120days/year world traveler, I often experience different 5* hotel chains and individuals.Two things are not acceptable for a Luxury Collection Brand, wi fi in the room is the slowest ever experienced, a paradox in a high tech city such as Tokyo.The second bad note is about breakfast and the quality of foods.Salmon completely covered by onions...stiff bread...Cheese assortment is ridiculous as well as ham and similar ..zero Healthy zone with selected food...Zero options for allergic and celiacs...Espresso coffee served with a plastic coffee spoon.Last but not least, the waiting time at the entrance is not acceptable.I often stay at Mandarin, a thousand time better experience.Finally, I personally believe the merger of two giants like Marriott and Starwood is lowering the upscale brands from the second to a more mass experience.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: One of the best city hotels i've stayed in without a doubt. Good location near the subway station. Great rooms - very comfortable bed, huge TV and blackout blinds (we missed breakfast on the first morning as we thought it was still the middle of the night!)Decent facilities too - good length swimming pool, gym, sauna, Japanese-style bathing area etc. Buffet breakfast good without being spectacular.Service was very good and concierge was helpful booking restaurants, recommendations etc.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This Hotel is in the class of The Gritti Palace, the St. Regis Bal Harbour, etc ...Modern, clean, superlative service, great breakfast, location ... what’s to complain about? Nothing !!We’ll be back !!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: First stop on a trip to Asia and they set the bar very high for the rest of the trip. Check in process was quick and easy with great views from the lobby. Room was very clean with many great features like electric blackout blinds and curtains. Only problem we encountered was the tv remote didn’t work very well. The gym and pool area were well maintained with good views. Cleaning staff did a great job and were very flexible with requested cleaning and turn down service times. The lobby bar was nice although expensive. The hotel is connected to a nice mall with many good restaurants, Starbucks, and dean and deluca. This is very convenient if you are tired and jet lagged upon arrival and want a quick and easy meal. The hotel is also conveniently connected below ground to 3 subway lines. Every staff member was eager to help upon arrival and this hotel proved its worth. I was a bit concerned what kind of service we might get at this hotel because the concierge was a bit unresponsive a few months before arrival when I was trying to make dinner reservations. They apologized for the oversight and redeemed themselves during our visit, I will definitely stay there again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great looking hotel in a very convenient location , close to CBD. Rooms are good sized and comfortable.Fairly pricy though and would expect better services for that cost. Breakfast is very average, the access to rooms is a bit complicated.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed 3 nights in April over Easter and from the moment we arrived, everything was perfect! Service is at a high standard and coupled with very pleasant smiles and attention.The Hotel occupies 6 levels (floors 30 to 36) of a modern building with reception on level 36. We booked a Club corner room which was on level 30 which was large and had floor to ceiling windows. We found level 30 to be very convenient as the fitness room, sauna, spa and swimming pool was also located on this level.The Hotel is located above the Nagatacho subway, so only a few steps and you are on your way. In Tokyo, the subway is your friend and the best way to get around the city to explore... and it operates like a Swiss watch!. The Kioicho area (where the Hotel is located) is a high end business district and only a 10 minute walk to the imperial palace. In the evenings, it is nice and quiet and because the rooms are located on levels 30-36, you will have a stunning view of the city lights at night.Breakfast offers a large quality range of options from Asian to Western selections and you will have wonderful views to down your coffee or tea. The Beds are super super comfortable and the room has fully automated electric blinds and curtains that you can adjust using the room iPad or wall switches. All in all, a wonderful stay at a super luxe hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Thank you for another wonderful stay. This was a special stay for our family and we all had a very nice time.We enjoyed our rooms very much. But more importantly the staff at the hotel provided wonderful service. Usami-san in the Club Lounge provided excellent service once again. The breakfast restaurant staff were all very pleasant and special mention goes to Chef Kizuka-san who provided extra care and service for us. Thank you again for another wonderful stay. We look forward to our next stay!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed five nights and this hotel was a perfect peaceful base to come back to after days of exploring Tokyo. We pretty much walked Tokyo and many key locations were within an hour walk in any direction. The walk to Maranouchi/Ginza is beautiful alongside the imperial palace particularly during Cherry Blossom time. We had a club room that was very modern, well-equipped, and with great views. The lounge was excellent with very friendly staff and we never found it crowded during our stay. The bar has an amazing view, and the pool and gym area are excellent. We arrived early and spent some time at the Dean & DeLuca cafe downstairs but other people seemed to gain access to the club lounge if they were on the club floor so worth asking about this if you're early. Excellent hotel I would highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This was my second stay at Prince Gallery, and unfortunately overall experience is much worse than a year ago. The hotel is no longer offering lounge access for Marriott Elite members (they explain this as being consistent with Marriott Bonvoy conditions, but I cannot imagine the Marriott prevents any property from offering additional benefits). I was granted access, however on the exception basis (without event asking for it, which I really appreciate). The lounge itself is average - food selection is very limited and each day it is exactly the same. Beverage selection is also average. The is a nice benefit if complimentary, but definitely it is not worth to pay extra for it (is such case I would choose Ritz Carlton). The service in the hotel is brilliant with one exception - the restaurant when the breakfast is served. I’ve used it 4 times during my stay and twice I’ve received differnt dish than ordered. The serive is also inefficient - waiting time for hot dishes is usually long and simetimes the dishes are cold when served. Such isses should not happen in a hotel of this class.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: As someone who travels the world on business I have never stayed at a finer hotel. I can’t imagine why anyone would rate this hotel any less than 5. Do yourself a favor and book the concierge floor and you will feel like a Prince for sure. Natsumi is wonderful and the team provide service above and beyond any I’ve ever experienced and the views are incredible. This is the very best!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great Hotel in the centrum of Tokyo. All the rooms are between floor 34 - 36, with an extraordinary view on the city, and sometimes on Mount Fuji. Very professional and firendly staff, what is probably the most important point.2 restaurants in the hotel, both of them very good! We certainly will come back to this hotel for our next trip to Japan :-)

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: If you are visiting Tokyo and want to stay in a beautiful and modern hotel, this is it! The lobby is amazing and the club lounge is calm and relaxing. Our room had huge windows with sweeping views of the city and a lovely glass shower with a privacy button that could turn the glass opaque in a click. The bed was comfortable, and turn-down service was provided nightly. The hotel is in a great, walkable area with easy access to the metro. What makes this hotel so exceptional is the amazing service! Everyone who works here goes above and beyond to make your stay comfortable. We felt so welcomed by front desk clerk Minako, bellboy Toshiki Furuya, concierge Mai Saeki, and Club Lounge Manager Kentaro Usami and his team. They all did everything they could to meet our needs in a genuine and caring way. My husband and I both loved this hotel and would highly recommend it to any travelers. We look forward to returning on our next trip to Tokyo!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We were staying in this hotel for 4 nights and every staff is so helpful! I asked the hotel to set up some balloons and prepare a cake for my boyfriend’s celebration, and they had pulled it off!Kudos to Hannah R. Nagahata who has helped to reserve some good restaurants in Tokyo. She went way beyond and even prepared a hard copy map and the photo of the entrance of the restaurant in case we could not find it! Really appreciated her help to make our stay perfect. Will definitely return to the hotel!You could see the cherry blossom down the hotel if you are in that season too!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Just stayed The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho for my birthday. Prior to arrival, I sent a message to request for a room with a better view. Knowing that it is peak season, I know upgrades will be nearly impossible. For the first 2 nights, they upgraded us to the Deluxe King room with Mount Fuji view. Though the room is not big, it was very comfortable. For the last 3 nights, the staff went an extra mile and upgraded us to the Kioi Suite as we are platinum members. It was very generous of the hotel to give this upgrade during peak season. We had complimentary continental breakfast as our benefit. For us, it was more than sufficient. What was really outstanding about the hotel was the standard of service. Having stayed in numerous hotels in the past 2 decades, the service here is definitely the best!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel is well situated very close to two metro stations.We had a lovely comfortable, large, modern room with great views. We even got to see Mount Fuji when it was a clear day. The room was very quiet.The staff in the hotel were really helpful and efficient.The main reception is up on the highest floor of the building and to get down to street level we had to take the lift up and then get a different one down.The only slight disappointment was the teppanyaki meal we had in the hotel one night which was extremely expensive and not as good as we were expecting.Very nice breakfasts though with a good choice.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho is a beautiful hotel. Out of the 4 hotels we stayed at during this trip, this was definitely our favourite. The room and view were just gorgeous. We loved the rainfall shower and the privacy button that turns the glass opaque, the blinds and curtains that open and close at the touch of a button, the comfortable bed, and the ample storage space. The only complaint I have about the room was the glow from the control panels (one by the bed and one on the wall). They were quite bright and couldn't be dimmed, but could be covered up at night.Staff were amazing, from check-in to check-out. The concierge staff were extremely helpful, reserving our bus to Narita and assisting with an order from Amazon Japan. And I really appreciate the fact that there was no charge to have a package delivered to the hotel, as many American hotels nickel and dime you to no end.I know a lot of people are whinging and whining about the fact that Marriott Bonvoy members (platinum & higher) no longer get lounge access. We were fortunate enough to still get lounge access because we made the reservation back in January, before the change. It was nice to have access to the lounge for afternoon tea and for drinks, but the evening appetizers were only OK. There was no hot food, which was really surprising, and the same food was served each evening. This was a disappointment. Marriott Bonvoy members still get breakfast in the restaurant, and the buffet was great -- lots of variety of both western and Asian foods. If I don't have access to the lounge next time, I would still choose to stay here. This property really is that nice.Thank you for a most amazing experience. I can't wait to stay here again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: this is am amazing hotel with beautiful rooms beautiful immaculately clean ammenities the service is second to none from the bell desk to concierge they all do a perfect job. what can i say this place was amazing with breathtaking views from the rooms also... but really the staff... wow i can not say enough... and i am a picky picky customer... thx!!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this fabulous property twice in February and loved EVERY minute of our visit. Being Premium Platinum Elite members , access to the Concierge Lounge was an added bonus to our stay. The location is great with easy access to the subway station. The service from every staff member is impeccable and they will go above and beyond for all your needs. Honorable mention for exceptional service goes to Mr. Kentaro Usami (Manager of the Concierge Lounge) and his staff for making our stay extra comfortable. Kentaro was always there for any questions we had and made sure our stay was great in every aspect. This hotel is truly our 'second home' for all our future visits to Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I was waiting with writing this review as I have seen hotel’s comments that they are looking into this issue. However it seems that nothing has changed so far. Hotel decided to take away some benefits granted previously to Platinum members – access to Lounge and possibility to have Japanese breakfast at no charge. I know that it is not usual for a Luxury Collection brand to have Lounge and provide access to Platinum guests, but there is nothing preventing hotel from continuing with the previous policy. I can partially understand that Lounge is at full capacity at times (it was not when I visited the hotel), but I don’t see any rational why not to offer Platinum members the Japanese breakfast at no charge. Otherwise we loved the hotel and we were looking forward to returning this year. However if hotel continues with the negative changes I am not sure whether they want to see us there as guest.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Food is mediocre. Inflexible staff. Never get an upgrade for titanium elites. For what you pay, this isn’t luxurious. I travel a lot and I’ve been to much better hotels for half the price with upgrades. I’ve been coming here because of its location but this will definitely be my last stay. What kind of a “luxurious” hotel would not keep left behind items? I don’t expect you to ship it back to me but at least keep it in lost and found. 3T does it - terrible, terrible, terrible.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I’ve stayed here many times and will return. The facility, rooms, pool, and gym and amazing and very modern. Great location. This time we had friends that had one tattoo and the pool attendants freaked out. Asking them to cover them with a piece of plastic or wetsuit that would fit a small child. They eventually just left the pool in frustration. I was frustrated for them as well. The hotel needs to reconsider their tattoo in pool policy to modernize their antiquated traditions. Any famous person would most likely have a tattoo. This is an international Starwood/Marriott brand and I will not recommend it to my friends who I encourage to go Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel caters to the western visitor but still retaining a lot of the Japanese cultural traits in hospitality. Everything was taken care with the outmost care to detail. The only thing that it felt a little off is that the lobby is in the 36 th floor but to go to the rooms you actually have to go down. The rooms are great everything is tied up to the iPad in the room were you can control everything and order room service.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great hotel with spacious rooms for Tokyo. Impeccable service. Convenient to Akasaka Mitsuke subway station. Dean and Deluca, convenience store, market, pharmacy in attached mixed use building along with many restaurants. Hotel restaurants and bar/lounge also amazing. Pool and spa extraordinary on the 36th floor so incredible view!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The Prince Gallery is unlike any hotel I have ever stayed at during a vacation. I'm Marriott Titanium and have seen many great hotels, then I stayed at Prince Gallery. Pros: Service, Club Lounge, Service, Rooms, Location, Spa/Gym AreaCons: Club lounge no longer an upgrade for Elite members.The club lounge served daily food for breakfast, evening snacks and cocktails, and unmatched service. Worth the upgrade fee even for Titanium guests. The hotel is located about 5 minutes from the subway station and just a few stops from Tokyo Station. I'd recommend having some down time and soaking in the hot tub/cool dip/dry sauna areas of the hotel. They are complimentary to hotel guests and worth the stunning views and relaxation time. All views are amazing, including the view from the hotel bar that overlooks Tokyo Tower.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We traveled the world for years!!Japan was a giant surprise!The hotel service is way above a 5 starThe people in Japan are super helpful, happy kind and inspiring!!Everyone must go to Tokyo and all over Japan On our way soon to Singapore and Thailand but there is nothing like it hereSuper clean and safe too

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We recently stayed for a second time at the Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho. Our experience at the hotel was as wonderful as we had remembered it. We were impressed by the friendly and helpful staff members from the moment we arrived. We also appreciated the helpful and attentive concierge group.In terms of a luxurious hotel, the Prince Gallery is aptly named. The rooms are elegant, superbly well designed, with every comfort in mind. The bed and bedding are supremely comfortable, the terrycloth bathrobes soft and new, and Yukata lovely. Even cups and saucers in the room are tasteful and beautiful. It was also wonderful to have a Nescafé coffee brewing machine in the room as well as a lovely iron teapot in which to brew Japanese green tea.The architecture and lighting in the public rooms and in the guest rooms is absolutely amazing and the detail that has gone into every decision is remarkable.The views of Tokyo from everywhere in the hotel, including the guest rooms, are spectacular.We enjoyed using the exercise facility and were very impressed with the cleanliness of the gym and the quality of the equipment. We also enjoyed breakfast and happy hour in the lounge every day and found the staff very helpful and attentive. The food was delicious and the wines of excellent quality. We will certainly stay at the Prince Gallery during our next visit to Tokyo and have recommended it to all of our friends visiting Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stay here for one night. the hotel in on the top 6 floors of the building, that’s why you can overlook the breathtaking tokyo skyline from the lobby. The hotel is also connected to the metro station so it is also convenient.We check in at around 3 and immediately get the room. We book through Amex FHR with Marriott Titanium status, however, no upgrade in terms of room size is offered due to high occupancy, we get upgraded to a room with a better view (tokyo tower view). The front desk lady is not aware that we book via Amex FHR which include breakfast until being told. She ask if I would like to get breakfast, welcome gift or Marriott points as welcome amenity and I clarify that I should have include breakfast and finally she realize that, however, no further AMEX benefit is mentioned until I also question about the $100 USD hotel credit. Anyway I do think this is only some minor problem as the lady is very sincere and polite I which I feel very comfortable for the check in process. Finally I choose the welcome gift - a traditional design Japanese chopstick as the elite welcome gift.We are escorted to the room by the agent. She briefly introduced the room function. The hotel is very hi-tech with key is needed to access to elevator or gym/swimming pool. Ipad control panel is used for all functions in the room. The room is with a big bay window sofa so you can lie down relaxingly to enjoy the view with a drink. The hotel is very new so the hardware is unbeatable. As titanium member we suppose to get access to executive lounge, however, as told by the front desk agent, after the merger to Marriott Bonvoy program, elite members are no longer eligible to go into the lounge, but they said the give concession this time for us because of our loyalty. I do think it is not a good act towards the member but I understand as they suppose to be a top tier brand like ritz carlton. To be honest, it is not a loss even you cannot go into the lounge. There is nothing impressive despite the drink selection (I dont drink alcohol much). The liquor is basic selection without something premium. Food variety is also poor. No hot food is available. During the evening cocktail, there are only 3 kinds of cold appetizers and some Japanese rice crackers. We left the lounge for dinner.The hotel is close to the Akasaka which has lots of restaurants and convenient stores. Bed is soft and comfortable. We have a very good sleep. For the AMEX $100 USD credit it equals to around 10000 yen (actually it should be more but it is fine). We order room service for a premium sushi set as supper to use it up as we have breakfast include and we have dinner outside.The following morning we have breakfast in the all-day dining restaurant. For Marriott member who choose breakfast as the amenity, they only include the buffet breakfast. If you prefer Japanese set or american breakfast, 1000 yen additional is required. We choose the Japanese breakfast which is really really nice and beautiful! highly recommend!!We finally check out at 3pm although we request late check out until 4pm. We have a very lovely stay here and I will definitely return in the future! (I will give 4.5 instead of 4 but tripadvisor doenst have such rating) I will give 5 if more AMEX FHR benefits are really applied. Anyway, thanks for giving us a good stay!
