New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great location, perfect view, modern and clean rooms. The staff is super friendly. A property that delivers and why you don't question why you pay a large chunk of your salary for it. A walking distance to a large metro station.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Rooms were modern, spacious, clean, quiet and well decorated. Service at the hotel was excellent across all staff. Views from the room were also very nice - Park and/or city views. Restaurant for breakfast tended to be busy but waits were short. Nice and comfortable seating with, again, very nice views of the city. Recommended.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Gorgeous views, great service, really nice gym. And it’s on a good subway stop, which is important for getting all over Tokyo. Critical Dean & Deluca right downstairs for breakfast, too. Highly recommend.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stunning new building and hotel in a convenient location. The rooms are spacious, modern and well-equipped. Unfortunately it is trying to be too clever with the high-tech room controls via a tablet which seems to be breaking down continuously without the convenience of light switches. Quite inconvenient when maintenance staff has to come to your room at midnight when you are in your pyjamas. Ours had to be replaced every day. Also having a glass wall between the bathroom and the room is most inconvenient as when you have to use the bathroom or the toilet the lights come on automatically and wake up your partner.It was extremely surprising that very few of the staff spoke any English especially as the service at breakfast in the dining room was very disorganised. However the breakfast was excellent once they managed to bring a cappuccino after 3 attempts.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is my third time staying in Tokyo Prince Gallery, and the first time in summer. What has really impressed me is the quality of staff, especially those working in the Executive Lounge. They are professional, friendly, helpful, and always make you smile. Staff in the Reservation are wonderful too. At this rank of hotel, upgrade is difficult due to big demand of all types of rooms. The Reservation staff understand your needs and will accommodate you in the best possible room. The Lounge is by far the best place in this hotel. View and ambience are superb. Choice of snacks and beverages are great. One can really relax while enjoying the sunset in one of the most beautiful cities in the world.I would say that The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho is climbing up among the first-class hotels.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I normally prefer other hotels in this much adored city, ie Aman (stunning designs), Hoshinoya (perfectly designed modern “ryokan”), MO (great restaurants), Peninsula (luxurious & spacious), Palace (fab views) but my friend (a Spg platinum) raved about this place so for our trip to INUA restaurant we came here instead. Well there is nothing to complain about but definitely nothing to write home about either. I am only Spg gold & my friend always gets upgraded as a platinum, my room was a 42 sq m deluxe room with contemporary decor & a nice view of the city. Overall I did not find one thing that wowed me the way the other hotels did. I had lunch at Souten’s sushi counter which was decent but not as good as the better sushi places back at home. I had a comfortable stay but I will not come back coz there are better experiences in town. P.S. the room reminded me of a nice airport hotel room.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at The Prince Gallery Hotel very much. We booked a Grand Deluxe Corner King room which turned out to be a comfy and spacious room with a great view over Tokyo.The Club Lounge was very well stocked and the hotel staff was exceptionally friendly. We also liked the pool where you have to wear black bathing caps, which brought back childhood memories (it used to be compulsory to wear in public pools in Germany :-)).The closest tube station is Akasaka-Mitsuke (almost across the street) from where you can reach all of Tokyos´ sights easily.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is definitely one of my top 3 favorite hotels in the world. The rooms and facilities are stunning and ultra-modern / high tech, with an incredible attention to detail. Everything was thought out - everything anticipated. Even the bathrooms are fabulous! My favorite highlight: electronic controls next to the bed for everything from temperature, to blinds and curtains, to lighting, to the Do Not Disturb sign.The staff was amazing, and attended to our every need. I visited the spa for a massage and ordered room service, and both experiences were perfect. Room service can be ordered on an iPad and is delivered quickly. You can even request they pick up your tray via iPad! I was even amazed at the level of detail from housekeeping and turn-down service.There is one minor downside: The lobby is on the 36th Floor, and the rooms are below it. That means you've got to go up to 36 and through the lobby whenever you want to go down to street level.If you are visiting the Tokyo area, you must treat yourself to this hotel!
user_name:
TheDanTaylor
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Amazing attention to detail ... They clearly think about the overall experience... The hotel decor is stunning, fresh modern contemporary look and fully integrated with smart home technology.The room size is humongous for Tokyo with a stunning view of Tokyo skyline. Complimentary breakfast was incredible. A huge array of food and drink selection. Great mixed of Asian and western dishes as well as breads/desserts/juices. You can also opt for Japanese traditional breakfast if you want to. Really enjoy my stay and would definitely come back for more

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 1 very hot week in Tokyo. Luckily, the A/C worked fairly well in the room and was able to keep it cool enough to sleep. This is not always the case in Tokyo hotels, even the luxury properties. The deluxe king room is very well appointed and nice - good quality build with great views and a nice shower/bathroom. It had all of the typical Japanese technologies and was very quiet with unobtrusive service.Our primary issues during our week stay were the following:1) The down pillows and comforter were not only a bit hot, but on more than one occasion, did not smell fresh. We weren't sure if it was the down itself that had an odor or the cases and sheets. 2) Service was uneven. The front desk and porter service was quite good; however, breakfast service was not always friendly and often robotic. Additionally, because of the issue above (odor of pillows/comforter) we asked housekeeping for a room freshening spray we could use to mask the odor. We were heading out for the day and they said they would inquire about this. When we returned, there was a note saying that they have room freshener in their gift shop we could purchase. This was not exactly the kind of response we hoped to receive. On two particular occasions, breakfast service was not accommodating. The first instance centered around the Japanese breakfast set which we ordered and takes 20 minutes to prepare. The breakfast hours are until 10am and we had arrived at 9:45am. When we ordered the Japanese set, the waiter looked at his watch and even had to check if we were allowed to order this set at that time. This is unacceptable at a luxury hotel since we arrived before the official closing of breakfast at 10am and made us rather uncomfortable. Additionally, we ordered tea and went to the buffet to get some bakery products and after bringing them back to the table were told we weren't allowed to take items from the buffet if getting the Japanese set. This was not conveyed to us when we ordered the Japanese set, nor did it say so on the menu, again an uncomfortable moment. On another day, we wanted to move to a corner table after being seated and were told the table was reserved and we were not allowed to move. This was at 9:50am and when I asked what time the reservation was for since breakfast is closing in 10 minutes, I was met with silence. About 5 minutes later we were told we were allowed to move to the table. Overall, service during breakfast was uneven and typically we were met with "no" or told about a particular rule in a not particularly productive tone. 3) Breakfast quality - Although the buffet was large and many items were of good quality, there were also several that were not. The danish and pastries were soft and appeared not homemade. Additionally, they were the exact same every day, similar to other items like the mango pancakes which were good, but switching out the fruit each day would've made them better. There were also a distinct lack of healthy options especially coming from the kitchen which tended to focus on fried foods and eggs. Some homemade items using almond milk, yogurt and fresh nuts and berries would've been nice. The redundancy of the items, lack of quality, and uneven service persuaded us to go elsewhere on a couple mornings even though we had breakfast included in our room rate. Overall, this hotel is well maintained and located in a quiet, but accessible location in Tokyo. Improvements in breakfast quality and service would move it into the top among other hotels in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My stay was impacted by the following experiences:a) Rooms: rooms nothing special, but pretty new. in line with a 5* house. What is not in line is the AC situation: could almost not sleep as it was impossible to cool down the room. I am aware that Japanese energy saving regulations are in place, bit weird enough never encountered this in other hotels in Tokyo. A request for a mobile AC unit has been rejectedb) Service level: I was rejected to enter the pool without a swimming cap because of my hair...Saying that i should mention that I am bold without a single piece of haur on my head. Manager could not explain the logic behind that, just mentioned it is the rule...c) Food: only tried lunch, which was the same set every day and not worth the priceAll in all: there are by far better hotels in Tokyo at this price range, which might be older but at least treat you in an adequate way for the price you pay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I’ve had the pleasure of staying at this phenomenal hotel twice and for certain I will return again. This hotel is beautiful and staffed with the most professional, knowledgeable and courteous team of people. They made my stay here so enjoyable.Both, Kentaro and Ayaka in the Club Lounge, as well as the rest of the team there are superb. When starting my day there every morning for breakfast or stopping in during the afternoon for a break and cocktail, they made sure I was set with directions, recommendations and were just wonderful to talk to. The Concierge team was wonderful, especially Kimiwada. She was able to secure 3 dinner reservations for me at restaurants that I really wanted to go to, but I failed to plan for in advance. This included the Michelin Star restaurant Tempura Motoyoshi. I truly appreciate the effort she went through to secure these reservations for me. I stayed in a Club Deluxe room, which was beautiful. Decor is chic, modern and understated. And the layout is perfect. The bed sleeps like a dream, but the view is the best part. The blackout shades are essential when dealing with jetlag. Raising the shades every morning to a view of Mt Fuji and sitting in the window seat at night to take in the sprawling Tokyo skyline was awesome.With a less than 5 minute walk to the Metro station, whether you’re traveling for business or leisure, the Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho is the perfect place for your stay. You’re going to love it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I must caveat my review by saying this is my first visit to Japan, and this was the only hotel I had stayed at on this trip. Therefore, I can only base my assessment against the standards i have seen in hotels elsewhere in the world, but I am not sure how it measures up against other hotels in Japan.I was impressed from beginning to end. The service levels I had experienced throughout my 4-night stay left me with pretty much nothing to complain about. People were polite, helpful, well-organised, and efficient. I did not see any of the staff members put a foot wrong.Everything was precisely and efficiently executed. Things went according to plan, and there were no surprises in service delivery, which is greatly-appreciated, especially when I am travelling on business. I had ordered in-room dining for several of my breakfasts and dinners, and each time, the delivery arrived at precisely the requested time - down to the minute. Pretty much it was the same for the laundry service and other stuff. I found myself planning my time very precisely in the latter part of my stay, as if I was reliving my military days again.I had gotten so used to the precision that when one morning, my breakfast arrived four minutes early when I was still washing up, and I was taken aback. If breakfast arrived four minutes early when I am in almost anywhere else in the world, I would have been delighted, but it felt different in this hotel - such was the high standards the hotel was performing to during my stay.The high standards were also apparent in the maintenance and upkeep of the room and the hotel in general. Everything was clean and well-maintained. Things worked the way they were expected to. Other than a negligible point of a depleted battery in the bathroom weighing scale, I am hard-pressed to think of any other instance when something did not work. There is, however, no way that I am going to fault anyone for something as trivial as this though.The room was also spacious and comfortable. Practicality was obviously top-of-mind when the designers were working on the room, and again I am sure many business travellers would be pleased with that.The views from the room was amazing, and it was a most welcome bonus for a first-time visitor to the city. I got a room offering a view of the imperial palace and Tokyo Skytree.A tad expensive, but would love to be back again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We have been fortunate enough to stay at many fantastic high-end hotels around the world. PG - you are a big winner. The service - Prince Gallery is an 11/10. Outstanding and unparalleled in my lifetime. The Japanese know service like no other, and this hotel has extremely high marks.The quality - again 11/10. Linens, Club food, housekeeping all top notch. Superior level, Impossibly high - the training and execution is off the charts. Wow. The decor - modern and still warm, excellent in all respects.The ambiance - Small adjustment needed. This is a quiet hotel, serene ..almost like a club. Here the hotel could benefit from a little more liveliness in the main lobby area / front desk. A place to linger a little longer when you come back from long day out in the city.That’s all Prince..you are superb - will only stay here in Tokyo. My hat is off to you , owners, management and staff alike.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed here for five nights during our stay in Tokyo. We are Starwood preferred platinum and the management didn't disappoint giving us a magnificent suite with amazing views. The rooms are magnificent and spotlessly clean. Buffet breakfasts are good although the food didn't vary. Bar has an amazing view but each of our bloody mary's was $25USD. The hotel is a block from the subway that can get you anyplace in Tokyo. We would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Apart from a few first world issues, great Stay. Amazing view from the room. Ginza line is nearby that takes you to basically all the places to go in Tokyo. Nice bar for an evening chill out. Staff in Japan are awesome as always

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My wife and I went to Tokyo for 5 days and stayed at the Prince Gallery Kioicho. Our room was on the 33rd floor facing the Prudential Building. The view was incredible!We loved this hotel. The room was great, the toilet was awesome! Testaff was very helpful and guided us to a private driver and several restaurants in town. We plan on going back to Tokyo in 2020 for the Olympics, and we would definitely stay at this hotel again. It is in a great location for sightseeing.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Lovely, well sized rooms with great bath and shower.Fantastic staff who do their best to give you an early check which we really appreciated after climbing Mt Fuji and in desperate need of some luxury.Amazing bar with city views.Right above a subway station too which helps when getting around.Hard to find fault.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Been intrigued to try this hotel since the last visit to Tokyo on Jan 18, even more curious while got tag on my social media, got a plan to visit Tokyo in summer, and I think its a perfect time to try out this truly luxurious hotel.Location is a little bit hard to find at first as we travel by subway from another SPG hotel in Tokyo Bay and not familiar with Akasaka area, the result is we make a wrong exit and need to walk a little bit more from Nagatacho station, but once you familiar with the maps around the area, it will be very easy to explore.Never expected to get an upgrade to Designer Suite, been reading many reviews from various site, and it is almost impossible to get suite at this nice hotel, nevertheless, just try my luck cause I still have SNA to spend.Prior 5 days before arrival, got an email confirmation that my room got upgrade, to 100m2 room, come on, 100m2? In Tokyo, Japan? Real room price will cost me arm and legs, still to this day I still cannot believe it, many plat member just got upgraded to corner room, and its already very huge and comfortable, some more reason for the next few days, the hotel in Tokyo will be very full. Thank you again Prince Gallery for the chance.Check in is fast, as I think our room is prepared, we were approached by staffs that walk to us to our waiting table, even at check-in lounge you can feel the luxury , staffs explain thoroughly what is the benefit for us, extend the complimentary BF, of course very polite and attentive, and want to make sure that all our needs fulfilledWhile entering the room, we are stunned, its really really hugeeeeee, from what I can remember, its the largest room that I every stay, come on, 100m2, in Tokyo? even the bathroom is larger than most Tokyo's hotel room. :P.This hotel a bit hightech, have a single app on provided ipad to control room's electrical and curtain.The suite is on the corner, what a beautiful view of Tokyo.This hotel think of everything, they have charger and cables (lighting n micro usb) provided in the room, even in the safety box, they have power outlet, wow, such attention to detail and need.Bathup facing Tokyo Skyscraper is on another level, I think I spend almost one hour just to enjoy the view and comfort, did I mention there is a TV in bath up with channel and volume control attached to the wall? so you don't have to worry by using remote control (there is no remote control), it will be wet or fall to bath up, :D.Club is wonderful, have sufficient and variety of food, a perfect place to unwind, didn't try the swimming pool, just make a quick visit, sure will try on another visit, it will be interesting to enjoy the view while relaxing on the pool, even the smoking room feels luxurious. Smokers like me will feel the impressive and proximity.Breakfast have various Japanese and Western a la carte menu, they even have AN very beautiful Japanese BF presentation, staffs are all attentive to detail, once in a while will check whether you need something to fulfill your craving, I even watch some staff rearrange buffet food so its perfectly align and make art to the eye, even if there is one dot dirt in the table, which not really visible, they will clean it as fast as possible, that a well-trained staffs. :DWe request for late check out till 4 pm which granted with no problem, it's really sad to leave such a top notch hotel as wife want to do shopping in Ginza area and we move to another hotel. Our check out at Club is swift n easy. 5 thumbs up for concierge team to prepare our luggage for departure, such a good gesture.Thank you Prince Gallery a very amazing experience, sure will be back on next visit to Tokyo, :D

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My husband and I visited Tokyo as part of our business trip. In the last 30 years we stayed at another leading hotel in Ginza but from now on we will only stay at Tokyo Prince Galleria. The Club Lounge Manager Kentato Usami and the wonder staff at the Club Lounge are just fabulous. Right next door to the hotel on Level 3 is a vast selections of fine dining restaurants. We tried as much as we can and they are of the highest quality. The restaurants include: Ginza Kichi which is traditional Japanese cuisine. Ningyocho Imahan which served amazing Shabu Shabu, Kioicho Mitan, the freshest sashimi and Manwu which has very unique Japanese menu.Most importantly is the Japanese restaurant in the Hotel called Souten. It is modern Japanese but their creativity, taste amd presentation as well as service are just excellent. Nothing is too much trouble with this hotel. They are always helpful, concierge to front desk to the wonderful Club Lounge. First class accommodation and first class service. We even saw Mt. Fuji on a clear day from our room. Definitely to return as soon as we have another week to spare.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This was the hotel that I had great anticipation for in Japan. Having stayed here for a special milestone birthday for 7 nights the place was absolutley stunning it really does have the WOW factor from rooms to bathrooms the lobby and the gorgeous bar with the most incredible view. My experience was great and loved the hotel but from the time we arrived at the Prince Gallery having stayed for 7 nights in total and celebrating a special Birthday our room had no welcome or birthday note nothing. The staff just didn't give that level of warm comfort or assurance to see if everything was running smoothly. For me as an avid traveler having spent time in some beautiful hotels around the world it's not just about the aesthetics but the service too.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: A beautiful new modern hotel on the top floors of an office building. The service is excellent, attentive and warm. The hotel is immaculate and the room very modern and beautiful. Not sure I loved the location but I loved the hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: OK, an expensive stay but everything was perfect. You enter the 36th-floor lobby and you can just feel the 5 star level of this hotel. The only challenge was to have to go back to the 36th in order to go to the ground floor.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is one of the best hotels I stayed in, in Tokyo. The best thing about it is the location, it’s near most of the major metro lines that you need to conveniently travel in Tokyo. The hotel itself is very clean and luxurious, it’s a bit futuristic as everything is controlled with the tablet located in the room.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We had a 3 night stay here, and it was perfect ! A great room, loved the view over the city, comfy king bed, large bathroom with a big bath and separate shower. Good size wardrobe. My husband is SPG Plat so breakfast was included - it was a very good buffet breakfast in the restaurant. There were drink and canapés in the lounge each night. The hotel is situated at the top of a big building, with restaurants and shops on the lower levels. There is a beautiful garden on level 2 from memory. It was rose week and the garden was in full bloom. Walking the area around the hotel is very easy. We really enjoyed our 3 night stay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel on our trip to Tokyo from May 10-14, 2018. The hotel was great, truly a 5-star experience. What set this hotel apart from others on our Japan-Korea-China-Hong Kong trip was the following:Outstanding Service (We stayed on the Executive Lounge Floor)Beautiful rooms with the best shower I have ever had, literally (I'm thinking of redoing my condo bathrooms now)Greeted by a view of Mt Fuji from our bedroom window (on a very clear day)Great facilities and amenities on the lounge floorGreat concierge service and supportVery nice locationI would definitely go back to the Prince Gallery and recommend it to anyone visiting Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel from 8th June - 11th. We are SPG gold elite members and had beautiful rooms that were upgrades (within the same class but better view) to the corner room on 31st floor and for our partners to the 38th. The service was good, the concierge great, the lounge room beautifully discreet and private. In fact the whole hotel was luxurious and lovely. I swam every day, we ate in both the hotel‘s restaurants and I was happy. Breakfast was good to. BUT we returned to the hotel after traveling around Japna, for one night from 14th - 15th June and Haba very different experience. We were all quite tired from the three hour train journey from Hiroshima back to Tokyo and just wanted to settle into our rooms. The rooms they offered us did not have an upgrade though. I sent our parents up to the lounge, they were dropping from fatigue and spent over 20 minutes trying to straighten out the upgrades. The receptionist told me that we‘d have to be platinum members to get an automatic upgrade. This is something no other hotel or company has said before and I felt like I was having to really negotiate with someone tough. She offered us a slightly bigger room, but no upgrade to our parents room. I asked to speak to the manager. I had already been standing there for 20 minutes. Mr Tetsuji Yonemoto, the assistant manager, sorted out two rooms next to one another which were just a tiny bit larger. We were leaving very early so really they could have given us a suite and it would have been vacated by 9am the next day. I pointed out to Mr Yonemoto that at the Osaka Marriott Miyako Hotel this is exactly what happened. We stayed one night there and were leaving very early in the morning. They upgraded us to a suite and our partners to a room on the 54.h floor. They are on the same SPG alliance as The Princes Gallery, but we’re flexible. The Prince Gallery were not flexible at all. This is not good for either repeat customers, or those who have a high customer status within a hotel chain. This happened once before in Yangon and the hotel manager did apologize and sent up a cake and a bottle of champagne, at least by way of some small compensation for the room mess up. Mr Yonemoto did apologize, but seemed incapable, or unable to help us further. This left a very sour taste for all four of us. And a hotel I would have unstintingly recommended to others, I would now hesitate over.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We have been to Tokyo several times over the last few years, and have stayed in a number of hotels that we liked a lot, including Park Hyatt, Conrad and Grand Hyatt. However, we decided to try the Prince Gallery because we wanted to stay in a Starwood property, and this was the highest rated one for Tokyo. Well, we were exceptionally pleased with this hotel's service, rooms, facilities and location. The trip was an anniversary trip for my husband and me, and we had 2 of our kids with us. Our kids must have emailed the hotel in advance to let them know that we were celebrating an anniversary trip. When we arrived we were told that we had been upgraded to a suite, and when we were shown to our room, there was a beautiful chocolate and macaron plate and a nice congratulatory note from management. The suite was a corner suite, w/ an incredible view of the Tokyo skyline, and the furnishings were modern and beautiful. The location of the hotel - very close to a train station and in a beautiful building in a lovely area - is excellent.We had access to the lounge which was a nice plus as we could go in and get drinks during the day if we stopped back to the hotel. There wasn't a lot in the way of food offerings at the lounge, it wasn't a place where you'd go for a meal other than breakfast maybe if you didn't want to eat in the main restaurant.The pool, fitness center and spa are lovely, with a long lap pool that was never that crowded. It was a great way to start the day.Breakfast buffet here is good and the service is pleasant, but it did get very crowded on Sundays when people from outside the hotel come in and sometimes they ran out of things and didn't restock.The concierges were really helpful - we had messaged before our arrival, and they arranged for great restaurant reservations for us so that we didn't have to do that when we arrived. The location is pretty close to Ginza and the Imperial Gardens, and on top of one train station and near another. There are plenty of places to eat nearby as well.All in all, we had a great stay at this hotel, and will absolutely stay here on our next Tokyo visit.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Everything you’d expect from a 5-Star hotel. Great service, accommodation, view of then city, food, amenities. We appreciated the pool in the morning to help recover from the jet lag :-)It’s less than 10 min away from the nearest subway station.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Had a nice stay at this nice hotel in Kioicho! Secluded from the crowd, the hotel is minutes from everything you may need on a trip to fast paced Tokyo!! The room was nice, we could control all lights and blinds using an iPad provided in the room. The rooms were very spacious and overlooked a bustling street, dazzling away. There was a pair of yukatas to be worn while in the hotel premises, pretty neat stuff. The bar, Levita is superb and gives a fantastic feeling to its patrons. The lighting and ambience are chic, coupled with smart and crisp service. Its a good stay, a trifle expensive but a steal if you find a deal on this hotel anytime!!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Our family loved staying here. The hotel has a lovely modern design with all the electronics you’d expect to see in Japan. The views are amazing and the staff, particularly the club level and concierge services were very service oriented. We enjoyed our time there and would definitely recommend it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: First class hotel in A very good area of the cityVery relaxing and comfortable Makes a difference when your travelling far from homeEasy access to subwaysLarge roomsClean designVery good food in restaurantsBeautiful bar overlooking the city as wellGym and indoor pool all great

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: 我們在2018年除夕新年期間都待在東京王子畫廊飯店，有八天七夜其中四天是俱樂部房型，讓我印象非常深刻比我住過許多連鎖飯店的行政套房樓層都還要好，因為他的俱樂部提供的食物超乎一流的水準，早餐不但豐盛下午茶甜點更是令人驚喜，比外面賣的都還要好吃。We stay 7 nights in this hotel, the club floor is fantasic. If you need make a reservation, please choose the club room or you can book from SPG.The food of club is professtional and delicious!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Gorgeous property occupying the 30-36th floors. Very modern, clean, upscale with extremely nice service and beautiful artwork. Amazing views from the rooms, gym and restaurants. Excellent amenities, well equiped room. Breakfast buffet was just average so some room still left for improvement. Great location right next to subway station and some really good restaurants within walking distance. Will go back in few days...

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: First time at the Prince Gallery Hotel for us. But absolutely not the last time. We enjoyed every minute of our time here. I think the service in general at Japanese hotels like these is amazing. The lovely smell of the hotel, the people working there, the comfortable and beautifully decorated room which has such an amazing view. The products you have in your room, the shower which is just so nice. And then the bar, which is very impressive with again that amazing view. Drinks were really nice and perfect service. Only thing we were a bit disappointed by, is the fact that breakfast is only until 10 am. Would have been great If this was 10.30 am. Also, at a certain time, breakfast was quite busy, so you had to wait outside for a table. Other than that, breakfast was really good. Prince Gallery is definitely our first option if we return to Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We celebrated our wedding anniversary with 2 weeks in Japan, the first 3 nights of which we spent at the Prince Gallery Tokyo. We then had 5 nights at Suiran Kyoto, 2 nights at the Ritz-Carlton Kyoto, and ended with 3 nights at the St Regis Osaka.The Prince Gallery Tokyo hotel is truly stunning, offering a very modern Art Deco-inspired Japanese minimalist design throughout all of its public spaces and rooms/suites. The hotel design feels right at home in Tokyo's Chiyoda district, yet has its own design aesthetic that feels distinct from any of the other luxury hotels in the city.The Prince Gallery far exceeded even my lofty expectations and is a truly outstanding luxury hotel option for Tokyo. We loved its modern design, its use of technology, its spacious suite, and its amazing concierge and service team. While we did have some English language issues, those were usually quickly resolved by the service team.We also really loved the views from everywhere in the hotel--and the amazing toilets and technology that were so well integrated and easy to use. Platinum recognition here is truly impressive--especially for me as an Ambassador level guest. I was checked in at 7:15 am and got upgraded to a Kioi Suite despite there having been no suites available for over a week! The hotel clearly had pre-assigned a suite for us due to my status and due to the fact that we were celebrating our wedding anniversary on this trip.The concierge team here is world class. They arranged dinner reservations far in advance for us at 3 Michelin star Sushi Yoshitake and 2 Michelin star Narisawa. Even a few weekls before our arrival, they also were able to arrange lunch for us at 2 Michelin star Sushi Sawada. Really impressive for a city where such bookings can be very tough to arrange.Not only was the concierge able to get those, but they also arranged a private Samurai lesson for us with Tetsuro Shimaguchi, the Kill Bill Vol. 1 swordfight choreographer and actor who played Miki, leader of the Crazy 88. It was incredible! The concierge also arrange a fabulous private city tour for us on the morning of our arrival...and personalized it for us based on our requests.The concierge team certainly is among the best in the city--easily within the top few.We also had the chance to visit the Aman, Peninsula, Mandarin Oriental, and Four Seasons while in Tokyo. The only hotel with comparably excellent hard product is the Aman--but we experienced the same language challenges there even while only having tea. We also had a few service issues in seeing rooms at the Aman, and even on getting something to ease some stomach issues. The MO had quite dated decor and furnishings in its rooms, though it has a number of different F/B outlets. The FS was extremely disappointing, offering a brusk greeting, no real public spaces, and rooms that looked like they belong in an older Park Hyatt. No wonder that they are opening a new Four Seasons soon.Seeing the other hotels made us realize how special the Prince Gallery truly is. It is one of the best hard products of any hotel in Tokyo, and its soft product can compete with anyone--and will only improve as the English capabilities of its staff improve. We would gladly return in a heartbeat to the Prince Gallery for any future trips to Tokyo!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My absolute preferred place to stay while in Tokyo. Conveniently located, top notch service - well, isn’t that standard in Japan?! - beautifully equipped rooms and a super cool bar on the 36th floor with a stunning view.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We are Platinum SPG. Upgraded to a corner room the first time, which was fantastic. We left for 3 days and returned to an amazing corner suite. We had access to the lounge, which had hors d'oeuvres and alcoholic drinks each afternoon. We had free breakfast there, or in one of the restaurants. We could have anything from the extensive buffet, or the menu. The service was excellent!The hotel is steps away from the train station.So, you have access to the entire city. We really enjoyed our stay and would return. The benefits for platinum level are very good.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Where rooms and spaces in Tokyo are typically small Prince gallery defies this with rooms so spacious in their deluxe King that one forgets one is in japan. The room offers stunning views with extra wide and large window. Nighttime view is particularly enjoyable. Service is brisk and efficient, breakfast selection is excellent. Certainly for the prices you will expect at least this much in terms of quality, service and experience. The spa and gym is in the same floor and the scents from the spa surrounds the gym too. Direct limousine bus from the airport makes commute convenient.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I wrote a review on the 1st of Jan 2018 with title Disappointed Breakfast while I was still staying at the hotel. Tried to revised the review but couldn't do it.After the review, the manager met me and apologized, explained, and promised will improve. Surprisingly it was a 1 night effort. With their dedication and professionalism, they improved overnight. I felt more welcome and having such a wonderful experience when having breakfast on the next day. Thanks to the chef at the Japanese restaurant for creating a special vegetarian breakfast set for my family, we enjoyed it very much. And thanks to the front desk staff who helped me finding a good clinic for my son when he was unwell.Appreciate everything that they've done for us, definitely will come back on my next trip to Tokyo. Thank you.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a lovely hotel. Very luxurious feeling with great staff who can't do enough for you. The bar is very cool (although eye wateringly expensive at £13 a pint!) and has fabulous views over Tokyo, as do the rest of the public areas. The pool and gym are also very clean and modern and well equipt. the location is also very good - the subway can be reached by going directly underneath the hotel. There is also a wide variety of restaurants and a supermarket underneath the hotel.The rooms are very spacious and as the hotel is on the 32nd to 36th floors of this building they have great views over Tokyo. They are very modern - the room controls such as lighting and temperature are all touch screen, There are loads of toiletries and thoughtful extras. The bathroom has a massive deep soaking tub and rainfall shower, the beds are huge and comfortable, there is a big cushioned window seat for relaxing on, the TV is huge.... I could go on and on. The room was also immaculately clean and decorated beautifully. There was a daily turndown service too which was nice. We had paid for a club class room which I highly recommend doing as it gave us access to the club lounge which had a wide array of drinks (including alcohol from 5pm onwards) and snacks available all day and was a really nice place to go and relax after a long days sightseeing. We also ate breakfast in there each day. It was never particularly busy and it was a really great addition to the stay being able to use it.There were only 2 negatives for me - we had to get the airport limousine at 7am to get tot he airport and breakfast doesn't start until 7am, so we had to miss it. I did enquire if there was any way we could get anything to eat earlier and was advised that the only thing we could do was order from the 24 hour room service, which is an additional expense and which also doesn't have any real breakfast options. It would have been nice if the hotel were able to provide us something to take with us on the airport limousine (especially since it is an almost 2 hour journey) like a takeaway hot drink and maybe some fruit and pastry or similar. I have stayed at other hotels of a similar calibre who do offer a simple takeaway breakfast for guests who have to depart before standard breakfast service times. The other thing is the lighting setup in the bathrooms - the bathroom has glass walls so you can see fully in to the bathroom from the room. There is a privacy button which, once pressed, makes the glass opaque. This is a very cool feature, however when the bathroom light is on and the glass is opaque the light from the bathroom also lights up the bedroom - not as brightly as the bathroom itslef but still quite a lot. This isn't a problem in the day but we found that if one of us gets up in the night to use the toliet the light from the bathroom lit up the bedroom and disturbed the other person. Obviously you can go to the toilet without turning on the main bathroom light but the light in the toilet area is automatic and so comes on as soon as you go in there, so you can't help but light up the bedroom a bit. It was also annoying in the morning - I get up earlier than my husband and tend to get showered and ready whilst he sleeps longer, but I needed to turn the bathroom light on to take a shower etc and this disturbed him. Neither issues are major problems and wouldn't put me off staying in the hotel as all, but I would bring an eye mask for sleeping next time! Overall I would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I rarely write reviews. I feel compelled to write this one because of the way the hotel staff made us feel unwelcome and their inflexible and rigid attitude left us with a very unpleasant feeling about the hotel, notwithstanding the nice facilities and food.I am an SPG Platinum member and I wrote ahead to the hotel saying that I usually travel to SPG properties on business but this time I was traveling with my wife and 8 year old son, and I would therefore appreciate something special (service) for them. The concierge replied with a rigid and “standard” email stating that my son was not allowed to use the pool, and that lounge access was restricted to guest plus (two people per room), so my son could not use it. I found this response very strange and unlike the warm and flexible service that I usually receive at high-end SPG properties. I replied that I would be on business most of the time so I assume my wife and son could use the lounge.When we arrived at the hotel, it was raining and we decided to stay in. Given that my son is 8, he cannot use the lounge in the afternoon (cocktail hour) and I had breakfast planned with my company so I would not use it. I asked if they could reconsider allowing all of us in the lounge (without paying a small fortune for access, as the prices are designed for adults and not for small kids). Perhaps a good compromise could be that my wife and I use the lounge at cocktail hour (2 guests only) and my wife and son would use it for breakfast (2 guests). That way we stayed within their rigid guideline of two guests per room. I was happy and relieved they accepted this solution, and we had a good first night and day. The next day, however, my wife and I arrived at the lounge. The night manager promptly arrived and explained that we had only agreed that for the first night, and that this second night we were not allowed to use the lounge. I explained this was not correct, as the reception manager the night before clearly offered to have us pay for 2 nights, so the discussion was always for the entire stay (2 nights). He would not have it, and we were escorted out of the lounge. This was the most embarrassing and awful experience my wife and I have ever experienced at an SPG property, and our my son kept asking why he was not welcome at this hotel. In short:• The staff simply follow (rigid) rules and don’t think for themselves how to make guests feel welcome – particularly SPG Platinums• The staff, including concierge and reception have very poor English skills – a big part of this was lack of language ability• The rules in the hotel and very family and child unfriendly (children cannot use lounge or pool, lounge has guest + 1 limit)• The hotel is very SPG unfriendly (no welcome present for Platinum, non-status members have to pay a small fortune for access to pool, etc)Avoid this hotel if you travel with family or guests, or if you have SPG status. Also avoid if you have special requests or appreciate friendly, flexible, service minded staff that speak English. For me, this ruined my stay. And it was not the facilities, it was the way the staff made us feel unwelcome and not appreciated.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I highly recommend this hotel. The room is very nice with a comfortable seating area by the large window. The bathroom and shower are incredible. The water pressure is great and they even give you bath salts to use in the tub. Everything is electronically controlled including the awesome blackout shade. Spa is nice and concierge is helpful. We were woken up one morning at 8:30a for housekeeping which was way too early but it only happened one day. Turn down service is a nice touch. I can't speak to the food as we never ate here. Location is awesome. It's right by a subway stop and walking distance to lots of places to eat in Akasaka.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We were a little confused and doubtful when the taxi dropped us off on the main level and we had to go up to check-in - that seemed very odd. But our jaws dropped when the elevator doors opened and we saw the view and lights of the city scene (we arrived very late at night). And we keep being impressed the entire stay with every new discovery. I loved the artwork all over the hotel and thought it a very good idea to have a book in the rooms explaining or showing the art pieces throughout the hotel. Our absolute favorite feature, though, was the automatic black-out shower wall. We had so much fun just hitting the button to watch the wall go from translucent to opaque so quickly. It took me a little while to find the bathroom amenities as the majority of them were in a drawer. But the quality and variety of what was offered was top notch. We loved the special touch of providing the his and hers yukatas and snacks. I absolutely loved the window bench seat and the ability to pop open a spot to get fresh air in - even on the 32nd floor. The view was the best part of the room. We slept with the blinds open so we could thoroughly enjoy the night lights and watch the sunrise. The breakfast buffet was good - nice variety and tasty. On our last day before checking out, we actually chose not to leave and go do anything so that we could just stay in the hotel and enjoy ourselves at the hotel. It was extremely quiet, clean, awesome water pressure, fast wifi. I can't think of a single complaint or critique. Would definitely stay here again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We loved our time here. The hotel is very tranquil and luxurious, with terrific views, and centrally located. We had a large, corner room on the 34th floor. The Club Room was a great addition, with breakfast and afternoon cocktails served there. We would stay here again without hesitation.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Modern and stylish hotel, that seems to cater solely to business people and people without kids. It's been a long time (10 years+) that we had such a terrible experience.The pool access is 18+ ("because it's too deep", 1m20 !) and the manager suggested we take a taxi to a public swimming pool...The club lounge has more rules than one can digest (plus they charge extra even for your wife and kid) and the breakfast they serve is pretty random.The bar is adult-only and for drinks we were directed to the restaurant, where the staff gave us a strange look when I said "drinks only please". They wanted us to wait in the corridor for 15 mins while the restaurant was half empty.I ended up speaking with the manager on duty who kept apologizing but "these are the rules". They clearly need to be upfront about the various rules and policies. I checked, nothing in the SPG app, but some appear if you search the hotel website...

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We booked this hotel for a special occasion and they exceeded our expectations!Thank you very much to the staff members at The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho - and especially to Usami-san in the Club Lounge who made our stay very memorable and went above and beyond in his service. As this stay was for a once in a lifetime occasion we had requests that were quickly taken care of and everything was coordinated smoothly by Usami-san. Our rooms were beautiful with great views - we especially loved the seating by the window. Amenities were of excellent quality.Contact with other staff was always courteous, professional, and efficient. Morning breakfast and afternoon&evening lounge services were great! SPG Platinum local amenity gift is a beautiful set of chopsticks.Overall this is an amazing hotel and has become a special place for us. Hotel hardware is important but Usami-san and the rest of the staff make this a very special place. Thank you again for everything! We really appreciated all of your efforts and look forward to staying with you again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: During my second trip to Tokyo we stayed at the Prince Gallery for one week.The hotel is brand new, located on the upper floors of a huge commercial building. Location is a hit and miss. Plenty to do on weekdays (it’s a business area packed with offices), less on the weekends, BUT there are many subway stations in proximity of the hotel so you can go everywhere in Tokyo in just a few minutes. Coming from Haneda by train was super easy, and on our departure day we used the Airport Limousine Bus that stops right by the hotel and goes straight to Narita.In the basement of the hotel building there’s plenty of restaurants, bars, a supermarket and a convenience store open 24h. We always started our days with a coffee by Dean & Deluca downstairs.Our Deluxe Room, located on the 33rd floor, was comfortable, clean and quite spacious. Turndown service every night with bottled water and chocolates or macarons. Loved the iPad and the shower glass that can be “frosted” with a button so you can’t see anything from the room (this sometimes is a problem with the modern hotel rooms with an open bathroom).Service was generally quite good all around the hotel.. some things at the bar (nice for the views over the city) could be improved but overall we can’t complain.Only thing that prevents me from wanting to come back here is the fact that I forgot some of my clothes in the closet, realized it back at home one day later, contacted immediately the hotel (weird fact: I had to call them in Japan as it’s impossible to find an email), asked if they could send me back my things to Italy - at my own expenses- and their answer was that they didn’t find anything in the room. How’s that the housekeeper couldn’t find my clothes left in the closet?Needless to say that this episode ruined my experience at The Prince Gallery and that this is also the reason why I can’t give a higher rate to this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Fabulous high tech rooms in the heart - dead center heart - of Tokyo. Super modern, even the smells of a high end spa are piped in. Gracious and amazingly helpful staff. The club level was well staffed with helpful concierges and great food. Worth every penny. Location cannot be beat after staying in Shinjuku - 1/2 km from any public transit or Meguro/Ebisu where the Westin is a brisk 30 MINUTE walk under a busy freeway, it is just the best to go to the basement and get on one of 5 subway lines. I can't say enough about how this property is now my favorite in all of Japan and look forward to staying there again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel exceeded expectations. Reception is at 36th floor and spectacular views from the room. The TV was humongous and electronics controlled so many things in the room. Amenities were plentiful including lavender bath salts. The spa on 30th floor was amazing. Service top notch.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights in early April and enjoyed every moment. The rooms are spacious and comfortable ( we were on the 33 rd floor) with a fantastic view of Tokyo. The customer service offered at reception and concierge at the hotel was excellent. The hotel is close to the metro with only a few stops to Ginza, Rappongi, Shinjuju. Breakfast is excellent with a choice of Japanese or Western. The restaurants precinct below the hotel offers a good choice of food. The hotel will make reservations for you. This is not a inexpensive hotel but what it offers as far as comfort and location we will definitely stay at The Prince Gallery next time we are in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a 5 Star hotel and as such is not inexpensive but as I mentioned, you get what you pay for. The rooms (we had a deluxe double) are absolutely fabulous with a bay window and comfy relaxing sofa against the window so you can really appreciate the Tokyo skyline. Everything from the window to the bathroom (and toilet) to the comfort of the bed was exceptional - well done !The service and hospitality were second to none but very much in line with traditional Japanese values and customs. The hotel made you feel like a valued guest which is somewhat rare these days.All in all a spectacular hotel with fantastic views and absolutely fabulous service.Three small improvement areas as again the review is based on the hotel rating and price:1. No one asked if our stay was ok when we checked out - basic error and disappointing especially when it was great.2. The metal cladding in the breakfast area (around the columns) was covered in hand prints and stains - this was a let down based on the hotel as this is the sort of detail that counts.3. While the breakfast was good the options from the menu were limited to Japanese breakfast or two styles of egg. With the amount of staff and the size of the buffet this could have been much better.That said, these are small improvements that would not put me off coming back. This is the “diamond in the rough” so if you are looking for a true luxury hotel experience (unlike many hotels in Europe or North America) this is the place to go.A very choice hotel that I would highly recommend if in Tokyo,

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This place was totally rebuilt after the landmark of Akasaka Prince hotel. The hotel space is completely isolated, while new building is combined with business and residence floors. You must have quiet and luxurious experience in the very central area of the metropolis. Also you can enjoy nice different views of Tokyo skyscrapers from a room, spa, bar and restaurant. Although room equipment may be a little bit too contemporary high-tech for old style lovers, I liked in total.旧赤坂プリンス敷地に再建築されたホテル。オフィス棟や居住棟もあるが、ホテルは完全に分離されており、静かで贅沢な体験ができる。部屋、スパ、バー、レストランからそれぞれ東京の摩天楼が見渡せる。古いタイプのホテルスタイルを好む人にとっては、部屋の設備はちょっとハイテク過ぎるかもしれないが、自分は、全体としてはとても気に入った。

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Rooms were very nice and high tech. It did take me a few minutes to figure out how to turn on the lights but worth it. Great in hotel food and drink. Highly recommended. Not cheap but worth it. Also a great location so walking is easy.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed at this property on Monday night for a short business trip and what a wonderful surprise it was. The lobby was on the 36th floor, which offers stunning views over the city. The room was large and well designed, and the Club Lounge offered great snacks and beverages. The gym and spa facilities were fantastic, the onsens overlooked the imperial palace gardens. Will definitely come back again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The minute you enter this beautifully designed property you are welcomed by the highly attentive staff. Especially Masaki Morihara at the front office was particularly friendly and assigned us an incredible room. Overall we had a very pleasant stay and the staff was always on point.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: After 2 weeks of a very diverse try of many different accommodation formats in Japan we decided to give us a treatment at our last night before departure. ...and it was one: great location at the top of one of Tokyo's highrisers, cool and chic outfit, amazing views, great room, impecable service and a great dinning experience. The bar with an amazing selection of drinks and a framed view of Tokyo was a real treat. The price was a bit over the top though...

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I thought I had stayed in gorgeous hotels before, yet all my previous experiences can not compare to the stunning luxury of The Prince Gallery Tokyo. This hotel is truly beautiful and must be experienced to be truly appreciated. Located 36 levels above the streets of Tokyo the amazing view further enhances the beautiful interior of this hotel. The hotel suite is well appointed with a bench seat extending the length of the room to enable you to relax and take in the view. The glass encased bathroom invites further relaxation..... Although the span bathing facilities located on the lower levels of the hotel also present a luxurious bathing experience. Like the rooms, you are able to relax while taking in the expansive view of Tokyo below.The Hotel also offers a number of restaurants, both our dinner and breakfast were divine and gluten free requirements were accommodated. The Skyline Lounge, which features 2 two glass wall serves up a great cocktail as well as a great view.All staff - front desk, concierge, hospitality and housekeeping, were incredibly polite and attentive.Thank you all for offering up such a stunning and luxurious experience.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Prince Gallery. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was nice, and the shower huge. The club level was very nice and we used it multiple times. The staff in the club was very accommodating. The view outside our room was incredible, and I could have enjoyed it all night on our window seat. Visit the bar in the hotel, also, which has a great atmosphere and view. The drinks are pricey but stop in for one and enjoy. I would definitely recommend the hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: As with our previous stay, The Prince Gallery does not disappoint. We were not upgraded this time around, however the "standard" room was quite spacious and comfortable. It still has the same huge shower and bathtub as the larger rooms do. There's nothing like taking an immersive shower in that bathroom after a long flight. A reminder for folks who want to play tourist, this property is not centered in all the Shinjuku/Harajuku type energy, but it is a nice place to escape to. Four metro lines are accessible from this hotel which makes it really convenient for that type of travel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel at the end of our holiday, for a bit of a luxury treat. We loved it! We had a stunning view from the 32nd floor with Mount Fuji in the distance - watching the sun set was very special. The room was decorated to a very high standard and we loved the features like the transparent bathroom (with button for changing to opaque), iPad control pad and wonderful window seat. We also ate in one of the restaurants for our last evening. We had been a little dubious after reading some reviews but actually it was delicious. Lovely staff too. We’d definitely stay again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Beautiful rooms, with thoughtful design features. Immaculate bathroom, comfy beds, great turn-down service. Nice touches like chocolates, an origami bird, fresh flowers in the bathroom. Amazing view over the city and Mt. Fuji. The gym, pool and spa area is beautiful. That being said, the hotel is incredibly pricey, and I rather doubt the price reflects what you get. We had to wait rather long until our room was ready when checking-in (we were told it would be 15mins, but it was 35 in the end), but then, we had some questions for the concierge, and she went above and beyond. Again, the breakfast buffet was very good, but the bar is totally not worth it (apart from the view. That is stunning.). We had ordered some appetizers, two burgers and a dessert, and while the appetizer/dessert were great, the burgers with the accompanying fries were nearly cold, and the patties so cooked through that the wagyu beef was nearly tasteless. Our cocktails were so-so - the Champagne Mojito very nice, but the Tea & Orange cocktail very watered down by the bucket of crushed ice that they had used in it. So, in short, great with some short-comings, but for that price, I would've expected more.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We loved the standard room if this hotel. The design has been finished to an extremely high standard - really stunning finish. As soon as you work into the hotel it feels luxurious. Even on the ground floor before reaching the beautiful sky lobby the smell of the hotel is amazing (not sure what it was!).The reception staff of this hotel are extremely professional and welcoming. It was lovely being shown to our hotel room. The club lounge staff were also extremely friendly and welcoming. Drinks offered are high quality however we didn't find the afternoon/ evening food had much flavour. During one of the nights the lounge was full but we were allowed to take drinks back to our room. We stayed at this hotel twice. The second visit was in a corner suite. Although the view was really amazing we didn't like the room as much. The corner suite is long and narrow so it actually felt more cramped. Also quite a lot of the furniture was chipped which is a shame.
user_name:
amh723
Newcastle upon Tyne, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Amazing hotel in Tokyo. Reception at the 36th floor. Wonderful bedding. We had a room with a view on the Fujiyama mountain. Special thanks to the concierge who provided a efficient support in the organization of two of our business diners.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Located in a very nice part of Tokyo. Beautiful spacious room with very nice amenities. The hotel offers one of the most beautiful views in Tokyo having part of the building facing The Grand Palace. Breakfast Staff could be more attentive and offer service selection to staff. Ones can choose to dine buffet style or Japanese Breakfast.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I went on my honeymoon to Tokyo and stayed in this hotel for 6 days. We had a great experience. The views of the rooms were WOW, the service was impecable always aware of our needs and advised us very well in the concierge. Also the installations are new and the hotel very clean. The spa is very comfortable also with great service and massage. I would totally recommend this hotel to stay in Tokyo due to its location and overall experience was great.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Together with my husband we had arrive late in the evening and were warmly welcomed by polite and smiled staff. It is important to be prepared in advance that even in 5 stars hotel, the communication in English will be sometimes really difficult :) Despite this, we finished quickly with the reservation and were accompanied to our room. The building, where the hotel is located, is as well and office and the hotel reception is located at 36th floor but the guests rooms are from 30th floor and above :) quite strange at the beginning, but something different :).Our room was really nice, big enough, 33rd floor, amazing Tokyo view with nice and big bathroom. The service quality and the cleanliness are at top level. The whole room is managed by an Ipad - lightening, room service, orders, curtains, air conditioning, everything, really very useful.Since that is was almost 1 a.m in the morning when we finally arrived in our room, it was too late to go out for dinner so we ordered room service via the ipad manager and in 20 minutes we received all our orders - quickly and delicious. The breakfast was nice, with amazing view from the 36th floor. During the breakfast you can find everything you like nevertheless that you are coming from Europe, USA or you are Japanese. The location of the hotel is more than excellent - two minutes from the hotel there is a subway station (something very important for city like Tokyo, next to the hotel there is a street with many and different restaurants and as well it is very close to Asakusa part and castle.If we visit Tokyo again, definitely we will be again this hotel guests.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: It was like staying in a giant luxurious Lexus. Comfortable, quite, lots of automation to meet your every need. There were sliding glass doors, windows that automatically haze, electric curtains, push buttons control everything from the bed, Nespresso machine with caplets, cast iron tea pot, and a killer view. Even the toilet anticipates your approach. If you check in during the day, wait till you see the view at night. Our room on the 31st floor looked out to Tokyo Tower. The view from breakfast was equally as good and the meal was outstanding. There are some nice restaurants in the next building over, and some great less formal restaurants 3 to 4 blocks away. The hotel also had a beautiful gym, but I didn't get a chance to use it.The one thing that is confusing is that the lobby is on the 35th floor. So when you want to go out you first take the elevator up and then another elevator down. It took two days to press "Up" on the elevator when leaving.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Having spent the previous 3 nights at the Hoshinoya Tokyo, maybe my expectations were too high. While the Price Gallery is new, nice, clean, and offers a fantastic view, I was disappointed. Although a platinum member, sadly no upgrade or other recognition other than to ask if I wanted points or a small gift (chopsticks). Dinner in the Oasis restaurant (their main restaurant) was, by far, the worst I had during my 3 week trip around Japan. The hotel had a very impersonal feeling. Staff were nice, but did not go out of their way to help. Later during my trip, I stayed at the Marriott in Osaka - a very similar property - and had a much nicer (and significantly less expensive) experience. The location is decent, but not great. In summary, there is nothing wrong with this property, however, you pay a premium to stay here and I didn't feel I got what I paid for.

Washington DC, District of Columbia

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a brilliant hotel located a 10-15 minute taxi journey from Tokyo station. We arrived at 2pm, were quickly escorted to the lobby & then onto the club lounge, having booked a deluxe king club room for two nights. Check in was smoothest we’ve had in Japan with champagne welcome drinks. The hotel is ‘upside down’ in that the lobby is on the top floor, 36th. Club lounge is on the 34th floor. We had a top floor room and the view was breathtaking. I’d imagine all rooms have expansive views of Tokyo. The club deluxe room is of great size - plenty of space & the bay window with seating is impressive and gives a bigger appearance and feel to the room. What sets this property apart from others we’ve stayed in, are the in-room facilities & features. The iPad control is impressive - as numerous people have mentioned. The see through bathroom turns to frosted glass with a touch of a button - quirky & impressive. Another note of the in-room facilities, the kettle is a well sized delonghi. I know if I was reading this review and noted that, I might not see it as a big deal but this sets the tone for everything else in the room being of high quality. Club lounge has breakfast, afternoon tea with delicious pastries & evening cocktails with canapés. The service in the club lounge is the best I’ve experienced, special mention to Kentaro Usami the Club Lounge Manager for his wonderful service. I feel his service makes the club lounge experience what it should be and this is what sets this club lounge apart in terms of service, from others we have experienced throughout the world. The only negative I would give is that breakfast at Oasis was a let down. Service was rather non-existent and impersonal. A further note on service, the hotel went to great lengths to locate my sunglasses which I left in the taxi (the journey itself was eventful as the driver wasn’t sure how to get to the hotel despite me giving the hotel name and address in Japanese so I spent the journey directing him via google maps!)The gym, spa & swimming pool are of great standard as one would expect of a recently opened 5* property in Tokyo. Overall, I highly recommend this property & club lounge access if budget allows. I feel our stay may not have been as impressive if it were not for the club lounge, given our experience of breakfast at Oasis.
