Jagdip S
London, England, United Kingdom

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed 1N in this brand new hotel. The is a small hotel is within a large office building and located in a quiet and leafy neighborhood. Was given a regular room on the 30th with views to the new Tokyo Olympic Stadium and lots of greenery (unusual for Tokyo). Fittings were modern and befitting this premium hotel. I was assigned a regular room Internet was patchy and slow at night. Beds on the soft side. Club Lounge spread was decent, but the place was packed and the bubbly was served warm. The buffet breakfast in the restaurant was excellent. Bought tickets for the limo bus which took me directly from the hotel to Narita.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: With the lobby located on 36th floor, hotel provide panoramic views over Tokyo. Our suite room was big enough but the sitting area was totally separated and almost hard to use, suitable for business meetings and so on. Sorry to say that Internet speed is awful, and breakfast room is always full in the morning and prepare to queue for 15-20 minutes which is disappointing. Even the executive loung on 34th floor was full for breakfast and a little waiting was requested! Lounge has also nice view over the city and the staffs there are really helpful and kind.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Really excellent hotel with good facilities and transport options.The swimming pool is very very nice and they provide for you the necessary caps to wear. There are sweeping views from the rooms and it is a relaxing \ quiet luxury hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I stayed here for 8 nights. It is hard to find fault. The rooms are very big by Tokyo standards and have amazing views. The staff are helpful and welcoming. The lights and curtains are controlled by an ipad which works well- and at last a light switch which says “all off”....no more hunting for that elusive room light that seems to be immune from central control. The only slight miss is the 35F bar. This should have splendid views, but the bar itself runs along the window side. Better if the bar were to one side, allowing a full view from the lounge area. The lobby on 36F has spectacular views, but oddly doesn’t make use of the bar that is installed to the side there. But these are niggles. A great place to stay

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: A lot of hotel rooms in Japan are quite small but this is very spacious in Japanese standard (normal or slightly bigger than western hotels). It has a very nice view and conveniently located. There are restaurants, department stores in walking distance.Good service and nice staff,

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I stayed 2 nights in mid-March 2018 at this hotel, to basically be a tourist after a series of business meetings elsewhere in Japan. Quite simply, this was the best hotel I have ever stayed in (and I would say that I am fairly picky). The view from the room (I was in room 3344) was stupendous; there is even a couch/bench that spans the length of the room-sized window, which is a great spot to perch and watch the city of Tokyo. The shower was amazing, a walk-in shower with a "rain" overhead setting that has more than enough water pressure to provide a spa-like deluge. Every single thing about this hotel room was perfect, very attractive aesthetically, super clean, and luxurious.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: After staying at the Four Seasons & Conrad along with many others in Tokyo, I can assure you The Prince Gallery has to be one of the top if not top places to stay in Tokyo. There are many reasons why, first it sits on top of a building giving it expansive views of the city, once you enter your room you think you have the best view, then you goto breakfast and realize every room has the best view. Skytree, Shinjuku, shibuya all within viewing distance. Next is the distance the hotel has from multiple amazing metro lines that connect you to the city with a metro station that’s never overwhelmed. Get to shibuya or ginza within 25min or less, the hotel sits in the middle of the city. I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, the room was a king standard, space was average along with bathroom, enough for 2. The huge window had an amazing view with a sitting area on the window-sill. Room was fully automated, electronic curtains and lights with different scenes all controllable from a central controller. This room had an ipad which was useful for localized information. The TV was flush mounted into the wall, that was a first for me. The bathroom was beyond me. The shower glass wall separated the room from the bathroom, essentially you could take a shower and see the view clearly. If you wanted privacy, a single button turns on some sort of privacy shield in a blink of an eye creating a virtual wall, ive never seen anything like it. The toilet cover opens as soon as the door opens, flush mechanism was mounted to the wall with various options. The shower itself has plenty of pressure along with a rain shower and a huge tub. The cabinets that lined the entry of the room were equipped to store an entire suitcase if needed, plenty of drawers and hanging space. The room itself and the location along with the value of the price makes staying here a no brainer. 100% if I ever go back im staying here.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Arriving in Tokyo at Haneda we took trains to get to the hotel. Oddly we couldn’t find it when we got to the right stop - the key was to look up :) we were stood directly beneath it (its atop a commercial building - extremely modern and shiny). Express elevator to the reception which has stunning views across the city together with a cocktail bar which is absolutely stunning. Check in was excellent and service couldn’t be more efficient. Our club room was absolutely lovely - quite large given our expectations were lower from war stories. Beautifully appointed room wi5h picture window views across the city again (its difficult not to have excellent views from all angles of this hotel given its height and all windows being floor to ceiling). Visited the Club Lounge on our first evening and were told it was full which was a little off putting (admittedly a Saturday night but even so, not really acceptable) staff were a little embarrassed and tried to work things out with a number of couples who were in the same position. Eventually we got seats - drinks and food were good quality but what we found after staying there 5 nights was that the food didn’t actually change from day to day which was slightly disappointing. Service however was very attentive.Visited the pool and gym several times (remember to take your swim cap - but they will lend you one if you forgot) - Wowzer! The pool and views across the city are unforgettable - with a bit of jet lag we got up to swim and use the gym very early as the city was waking up - loved it. There’s also an onsen of its own which is another lovely way to relax after a day of walking etc.Club lounge quietened down from second night and was easily accessible with very lovely staff and drinks. Breakfast is served in the same lounge (or you can go down to the restaurant) - eggs cooked whichever way you want and then lots of other choices. Good range, but again this doesn’t show any variety over a period of time which was a little disappointing.Hotel location is central and next to two metro line stations. (Public transport across Tokyo is, without exception, excellent and have never felt safer at all times of day / night).Overall the experience was excellent - indeed, so excellent that we stayed again in our way back from Kyoto. Loved it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My husband and I are platinum SPG members and stayed here for the Tokyo Marathon. It is a stunning hotel on the upper floors of a tall building near Akasaka-Mitsuke station which has the very convenient Marunouchi subway line. From check-in to check-out, our stay was flawless. The staff speaks English and is extremely friendly and polite. The hotel was full so we did not get an upgrade but we were in a lovely King room with a wonderful view of the city, especially at night. Everything is very modern in the room, from the "robot" toilet that opens when you slide the door open, to the iPad that you can use for room service to the control panel that lets you control the lights, blinds, curtains, do not disturb, etc. The room was also silent - no hallway or adjacent room noise which I LOVED. The doors and construction are solid! The other areas of the hotel are also lovely. We went to the bar one day for a drink; the view is beautiful but at night it's lit up and very stunning. We did not eat in the actual hotel restaurant though we did have room service dinner a couple of times, which is a little limited. The restaurant may have more offerings than the room service menu. We did eat breakfast every morning in the Club Lounge on the 34th floor which, in my opinion, was fantastic. The lounge itself was lovely with yet another beautiful view, and the spread for breakfast was delightful. Eggs to order, Japanese and western breakfast offerings like vegetables, onigiri, fish, bacon, and yogurt. Lots of pastries, salads, quinoa, and of course coffee and juice. It was a treat every morning.I have only two small critiques: one is that the mattress was *very* firm, which might be tough for some people. The other is that the bathroom is walled in with glass (which can be screened using the control panel for privacy). That by itself was great, but there was a motion detector in the WC so when you stepped in there in the middle of the night, the light would pop on, potentially disturbing your partner in bed. Those two things aside, and it was a flawless stay.Finally, the staff was so helpful and assisted us in getting our limo bus tickets back to the airport the day before our departure. I would absolutely stay here again in a heartbeat. Everything was beautiful and in wonderful condition; the accommodations were very comfortable, and the staff was fantastic. I hope we can return to the Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho again soon!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Well designed rooms, extremely functional and filled with modern amenities. A fully stocked mini bar and coffee and tea. Automated toilets and fully automated window blinds and screens. Large size tv also fully remote from an ipad. Most impressive of all is the views from this place. Picture perfect!!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Although this hotel is located in the Tokyo business district, it fulfilled all our needs travelling as a family of four. Located at the top of a highrise building we had good view of the city which we could enjoy - as the first stop in Japan coming from Europe we were a bit jetlagged the first many days why it was nice to have great views while waiting to fall asleep. This is also maybe the only critisism we can think of in relation to the hotel - it would have been nice if a bar or coffee shop had been open at night for a place for the non-sleeping people to spend time. Other than that, the room was nice and lived up to the 5 stars. Not that we managed get our breakfast many mornings, sleeping very late, it was also delicate and really good. All in all, and considering the price, definately recommendable.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed here twice on our trip to Japan. It was the highlight of the trip. This place is pure luxury. I spent every night in the female onsen before bed gazing at the skyline. We loved the shower in the room too. Overall it was the perfect romantic getaway after long days exploring Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel is almost perfect in my opinion. All things balanced, this is my favorite in Tokyo. The pros are1) central location and easy access to subway lines that connect to places like Shinjuku, Ginza and Asakusa. 2) impeccable service and great English skills across the board -- even for Tokyo standard!3) cool high-tech gadgets that are also very useful (like the ipad control center and the glass that can turn from transparent to opaque)4) excellent club lounge with a wonderful view and very relaxed vibe (and good selections of f&b)5) great pool and spa area6) although it's relatively busy (with >300 rooms), it feels very quite and calm7) super clean (again, even for Tokyo)8) the window is one whole piece of huge glass providing unobstructed view of Tokyo9) attention to small details and proper signs and directions everywhere10) super-secured -- you'll have to swipe your room key three times before you reach your room -- feels like a CIA agent11) automatic toilet12) Lightening fast checking in. and the list goes on!To give you a balanced view, I have tried very hard and indeed (this is not easy!) found some slight issues that might need improvement:1) The breakfast options are only explained after you walked in the restaurant in the morning -- you can choose from the Japanese style breakfast and buffet style (I chose the former and it was great). This can be slightly confusing but once you got it, it's not a problem.2) I wish our room (club king) comes with twin washbasin. It can be useful.3) The light for the toilet is slightly too strong for the night. And since it's automatic there's no way to turn it off.Yes I have tried very hard to find these 'issues'! Still, 5/5 stars and I would like to thank all the efficient, warm and professional staff for the great experience I had in the Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, a Luxury Collection Hotel (that is a long name for a hotel...)Will definitely be back.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Very good hotel with perfect view of Fuji Yama, although blocked by clouds in my case, left with most impressive experience among all Tokyo hotels in all my Tokyo trips. Staff are most friendly and provided us with warmest care and service.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed there for two nights in February. Concierge hooked us up with an resevrations at Sushi Sawada which was amazing. They also helped us book last minute transportation including our skis when our plan to ship the skis back to the states fell through. This was not easy given I reached out to them two hours before I landed but they somehow made it happen. Really Amazing service!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The cleanest hotel I've ever seen.The shower was funky. The views from the hotel rooms are incredible. Amazing sushi bar. Some of the best I've ever tasted. The staff was so polite. The place even smelled nice which was great. I must go back!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great location! Beautiful hotel, with good loa tion, kust across the subway station. Very friendly staff. We stayed in a room in the 36th floor with an spectacular view of Tokyo. It’s a contemporary hotel. Very good breakfast.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Just came back from a 5 days trip from tokyo staying at the prince gallery. Overall it was a great experince at this establishment. Everything is brand new and modern. Staffs are friendly and professional. The front desk and conseigre staffs especially were eager to help me to answer all my questions and arrange all my needs. In room is equipped with a ipad, so with any thing i need from house keeping such as extra pillow or bottle water all i need to do is a few clicks from the ipad. The bed is nice big and comfy. With all the top end amenities.The location is also very central with serval metro lines just 5 mins walks within the hotel. It is also 40 mins commute from haneda airport with made things easier.Food wise, the mall below the hotel offers great selections of restaurants, I personally tried 3 of the japnese style places and each were really good. As well there is a area where there are a lot of restaurants and bars just within a short walk of hotel.If i were to nitpick, i would agree with my fellow reviewers about this hotel. The breakfast can be improved for sure. I spent two mornings having breakfast, to be specific. The food was good, and everything was prepared quite well. But it is quite small and lack selections. And the two times i ate there the food offered is exactly the same.If i were to eat there for 5 days straight, i think i would get bored and tired of eating the same food everyday.Would I recommend this hotel? For sure yes. If you are like me who likes everything to be new and have staffs pamper you then this is the place for you.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel is ultra modern and very new. Although my room is only at 33/F of the building, the view from the room is stunning and I can see the whole Tokyo skyline, from the Palace all the way to the Sky Tree and the buildings along the Tokyo Bay. The view is amazing whether it is during the day, at night or when the sun rise at 6am. The shower and bathroom is enclosed in glass on 3 sides, so you can see the city even when you take your morning shower. The staff attend to every details in their service. The hotel is connected to the subway station with 5 subway lines on 2/F, so it's very convenient to get to most places in Tokyo. Besides multiple restaurants within the hotel, there are more than 10 different restaurants in the small shopping center on 2/F and 3/F. There is also a small grocery store on 2/F. I had the room service Japanese Breakfast once and it is amazing. It includes a bit of every delicacies in Japanese cuisine, from beef to melon to urchin to tofu to crab. The only disappointment is that the gym is a bit small. But it is clean and the equipment is very new and tidy.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho Hotel is on the 30-36th floors, thus offering beautiful views of the city. We stayed for 2 nights in a twin room (3149) on the 31st floor. Below, there are plenty of restaurants and a shopping precinct. We were welcomed at the entrance; the staffs were able to speak fluent English and checked if we could go to the room earlier than the check in time. Receptionists and the lady at concierge were very helpful to give us information we needed. The Halls and lifts had a relaxing aromatic smell. The room had an amazing city view, comfortable beds, the shower/bath area was a glass cube that is visible to the bedroom, but by pressing a switch the glass becomes opaque, very modern. It had an ipad to control all the screens, lights and give information. When we came back from sightseeing, the room was made up, slippers and gowns (pretty Japanese one's too.) were laid nicely, and sweets including Macarons were provided. We had the buffet breakfast one morning which was OK, nothing fancy. The fried egg was not runny as I wanted but my partner's Eggs Benedict was cooked perfectly. There was a very wide range of items, so everyone was happy.Overall the hotel was so clean, modern and luxurious, which had many interesting art décor. The Staff were amazing and very attentive to all our needs. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Tokyo, unless they're on budget as this hotel is on the more expensive side of the scale.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Wow. This is an absolutely beautiful hotel - every detail is flawless - the staff are amazing, the room spacious and luxurious - views are amazing. The spa and pool facilities are also excellent. I cannot say enough about this hotel - It is one of the best hotels I have stayed in in the world.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Best suite room in my life, room condition is perfect and great view with corner.Some of high technology in room, make me laugh. Bath with view was also perfect.Club lounge is very kindly and suggest lot of alcohol(its important in japan)Especially bakery so impressive.Expensive but highly recommend specially SPG members.Pros- spectacular view- goodest club lounge- pool with design- very impressive design- high level restaurant- kind and effective serviceCons- restaurant can not discount for guest- no serendipity things for luxury class

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I can't explain how great this hotel is. Yes, of course it's expensive but it definitely isn't the most expensive. We walked into the hotel looking a bit run down/hot and sweaty, but were treated with the same brilliant service as the businessmen in front of us. We were escorted to our room and shown how everything works. Everything is controlled using buttons and an iPad. The whole room is pure luxury and if you have the money you should book this hotel now!!!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Beautiful luxury hotel with excellent amenities, perks and view. Great to control curtains, lighting, etc from the bedside iPad. The shower/bath area is a glass cube that is visible to the bedroom, but by pressing a switch the glass becomes opaque. Very cool. I liked this place better than the Tokyo & Osaka Ritz. If I'm back in this side of Tokyo would be happy to stay again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My husband and I travel frequently, and even months later still refer back to our great experience at the Prince Gallery Tokyo. We used points to book a King Deluxe room, which had tons of modern conveniences (smartly placed chargers, plugs, lighting) and an absolutely incredible view — we spent hours at night and in the morning just staring out the window.The staff were super friendly, helpful, and always greeted us as we went to the lifts, pool, breakfast, etc. We loved the hotel so much we purchased some of their signature aroma to be used back home.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I'm really glad that I choose The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho as my hotel for 5 nights stay in Tokyo. The staff were very attentive and they are eager to assist you. The room was extremely clean and also have amazing view ( I was assigned room with Tokyo Skytree view). Hotel's club lounge was very good with good selection of breakfast. unfortunately I don't have the chance to peruse the club lounge high tea and cocktail offering due to my activity. The night before my departure, I enquiry the front desk about forwarding my luggage. and they inform me that it should be no problem and they even contact my next hotel to inform them that my luggage will be sent to them.Upon check out, the staff, already prepare the forwarding form in advance to facilitate efficient check out. Overall I was extremely satisfied with the hotel and will definitely return when I happen to visit Tokyo in the future.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Having stayed at a few different hotels across Tokyo, I have to say that The Prince Gallery Hotel is by far my favorite. The contemporary rooms are spacious and clean. I loved all the different settings you can adjust to in the room, from the bathroom shower to the window shades (it's the little things that matter)! The hotel sits on top of a shopping mall, with plenty of different food options. We had lunch at a soba joint, coffee at the Dean & Deluca shop and grabbed chocolates bites from a cute little artisanal store. There's even a pharmacy and dry cleaner there, so super convenient. The hotel is also connected to two train stations, which made traveling around the city really convenient.We had the Club Room which gave us access to the Club Lounge, where we ate breakfast. And unlike some of the reviewers, we didn't find the breakfast to be a disappointment, in fact, it was one of the highlights of our stay. We loved the different juice and pastry options, and of course there was the Chef Special Omelette. Delicious! We're planning another trip to Tokyo in March and have already booked ourselves into this hotel! Can't wait to stay here again =)

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: When I booked this hotel it was frankly unclear what I was getting the web site is a bit vague and pics really do not do it justice. It’s a beautiful hotel well designed and extremely well appointed. Staff - especially the concierge- were good. Breakfast is good albeit a bit confusing, go for the buffet! The spay is good, however did not have time to do any treatments, I did try but getting info on line or emailing them in advance was impossible. They missed some business there, that would be my only tip for improvement. I would return in a heart beat.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I love this hotel. The lobby is gorgeous, the room is gorgeous, the gym and pool is gorgeous. The rooms are sexy with a shower that can be transparent to see the view or opaque for privacy. Fun and efficient storage.Absolutely comfortable beds.Convenient to subway lines. The hotel smells fantastic. The service was above and beyond excellent.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed for 4 nights with an infant daughter. The hotel is done in a chic, modern style with lots of modern art. But definitely a half step-down in terms of luxury compared to other Tokyo 5-stars. Not much difference, but still a difference. I would classify it more as a 4.5 stars. But good value for the price.Room: Very airy and modern, with good city views. Nice amenities.Food: Breakfast sucks, which is surprising for a hotel in Tokyo. This is one of the few places where I would definitely recommend against getting the B&B package. The Japanese restaurant at dinner was actually surprisingly good (modern Japanese cuisine). The important thing is that the hotel is part of the Tokyo Garden complex, which has lots of restaurants, services and shops to choose from.Location: It's in Akasaka sort of, but the immediate surrounding neighborhood is not much to look at. The Tokyo Garden complex is a nice place and our daughter loved the area. The good thing is that the hotel is a convenient base for other Tokyo neighborhoods like Ginza, Roppongi, Shibuya.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Lovely, new hotel, but couldn't get a chance to check out the amenities because they were under renovation. Breakfast selection was very basic, no Japanese breakfast at all! Also, I was in a rush in the morning when leaving, and asked the staff a piece of bread and tea. They would not do it for me. I was forced to take a bite of the bread and take it out with me with rude glares from the staff. I have never seen any business hotel do this, as all SPGs over Asia allow you to pack something small for on the road. I paid $400USD a night, this is not the service I expect. I would not recommend if you are here for business to stay at this hotel.
user_name:
miblacktea
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is my second stay there in two years. I can see lots of improvements in different aspects of the hotel. About the rooms: The Grand Deluxe Corner Room is a very refined room with spectacular view. Except that there is too little space for luggage, the room is very comfy. I am glad I could stay there to welcome 2018.About F&B:Souten is one of the places we greatly enjoy in Prince Gallery. It was great this year, as well as last year.I ordered twice the In-room dining which is okay, meeting the standard but not exceeding it. It is very simple, not surprisingly good. The portion of American breakfast is not big. Bread should have come with a toaster. Food was not stored in heated box when they came. No one asked me how many people were using the meal. So, there wes not enough utensils, and no extra serving bowl and dishes. No toothpicks, no salt and pepper. With that price, it is expected to be more in quality and quantity.About the Countdown Party:This is a bit of disappointment. About New Year events in hotel:Some activities are really nicely organized. . My kids went for the Kimono dress-up, and calligraphy on Japanese fan. We wanted to take the rickshaw ride, but there is only one-way and no return ride so we gave up. I think the hotel may consider introducing more events for the new year’s eve and new year’s day. The lobby was very quiet on 1 January when we went down to listen to the Japanese Koto playing. I think more activities would make the hotel more festive.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Loved our room, the concierge service and the lovely customer service. Negatives is that the bar area is always packed and there is no preference for the customers staying at the hotel and that breakfast is not included in the stay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a wonderful hotel, high above the city of Tokyo, the service, the rooms, The Bar!!! This hotel is everything you need when visiting a city like Tokyo. Located above the train station which is important in Tokyo, this hotel offers everything you need. We were here on vacation and the hotel staff we amazing, helping us navigate this vast city. I loved the Bar which was our Happy Place at the end of the day, this room has amazing views across the city. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The room is excellent, service was good, new hotel I think. Location not so good. However, the disappointing part, the breakfast. First, you have to line up for table even though it is not too full and without any reasons given. Then the food options is very limited for a 5* hotel, pity. I know that this is an International hotel, but why they don't have any Japanese food for breakfast? We are in Japan for God's sake. I'm currently still staying at this hotel, sadly. No excitement everytime going for breakfast. Too bad

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I stayed this hotel for three times.and I stayed in a room different from three times.I was very satisfied that can enjoy very different scenery from any room.All the staff including the manager whose name is Mr.Keisuke Hitomi are very kind and friendly to us that seems to be at home.When I stay in this hotel, I feel a wonderful hospitality.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed at this hotel for a week. Lovely hotel, restaurants, accommodations, location. 5 stars across the board. Would love to check out other hotels, but such a great experience I'm sure I'll be heading back :)

jphennessy
New York City, New York

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Loved this hotel. It is very new so everything feels clean. The rooms have fantastic views as it is 30 floors up. The beds are comfy. Each room has a small sitting space. The bathroom beautiful, though the frosted shower lacks complete privacy. The breakfasts were fantastic. Best croissants outside of Paris. We also had drinks in the sky bar which was fun and ate first night in their Japanese restaurant, which was very good but expensive.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Amazing views and modern room with lots of cool features. Room service was tasty and fast. Friendly staff who made us feel very welcome. Beautiful lobby and bar. Close to tube also which was handy for getting around.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel is amazing and the views are to die for. This is the second time staying at this hotel and am amazed even more the second time. The service has improved greatly and you do really feel welcome when staying at the hotel. Biggest disappointment staying here the first time was the concierge recommendations for restaurants. Hopefully they have improved their skill sets since opening and can rectify their deficiencies. I truly hope they are able to make great food recommendations and get reservations to some of the best eateries in Tokyo. Dining in Tokyo is truly hedonistic at its best.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Very good and new hotel. Centrally located with good access to the subway and to many restaurants in Akasaka. The rooms are really nice and spacious and also the bathroom and shower are real good with an amazing glass front to the room. Everything is very modern and all room functions (curtains, lights ...) can be controlled via tablet. The hotel has a great fitness centre and a really nice Spa area with great view over Tokyo. I highly recommend this hotel for a stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The pictures say it all ! Amazing views, we got upgraded to a corner suite. Even the bathroom had great views. Breakfast Buffet was delightful, lots of selection and they made pretty good omelet and pancakes. Super polite people and the club lounge was good too.The best part was the bar, chic, amazing views of the city and fascinating drinks! They stamp their ice ! Never seen that before ! Would love to stay here again on my next visit.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great location for all of Tokyo. Competent service. Very nicely done rooms. Nice gym and spa on 30th floor. Impressive two story main bar. Organized a great massage. Will stay here again. Close to subway. Floors1-3 have a number of good and some more casual restaurant options as well as coffee shops, which is very convenient. Will stay here on my annual Tokyo trip going forward. Prefer it to the Peninsula, Imperial, Otani, Grand Hyatt, where I have also stayed.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, a Luxury Collection Hotel for our honeymoon! I had to choose from one of the Starwood properties because I absolutely adore Starwood mostly from my career at the St. Regis in the US. From moment we stepped into the hotel till right now, a night before the checkout, everything has been spotless. They upgraded our room to a room with a better view, had a welcome/congratulating amenity waiting in the room along with towels shaped like a swan on the bed and treats with a nice note. These were somethings I used to do to my St. Regis guests so I know what it meant or how they wanted to congratulate the newly weds. My wife was blown away. The view of the hotel was spectacular. If I ever come back to Tokyo, this will be my go-to hotel as you can NEVER go wrong with Starwood especially The Luxury Collection and The St. Regis. I truly enjoyed my stay here at Tokyo and The Prince Gallery Kioicho definitely made it better!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This a relatively new hotel that is located on the top floors (30th to 36th floors) of an office/hotel building with an underground retail mall, transportation hub. The property is built on a small hill that adds to its advantage in terms of uninterrupted sight lines in almost every direction. The check-in lobby is located on the 36th floor along with its sunken bar and the hotel restaurant. It is reached by an express elevator from the ground level. Rooms are located on this floor and on the six lower floors. The club room is on 34. The club room is large....literally 1 side of the building with floor to ceiling windows, a great buffet selection and a helpful staff.Rooms: 250 large rooms, ranging from 42 square meters to over 100 square meters. The rooms are well appointed with wood trim, large windows and well conceived bathrooms. The corridors are long, but also wide and well appointed. There are three high speed, 'smart' elevators serving the guest rooms.Proximity: There are 5 subway lines reached by underground passages. It is a 15-20 minute trip to Tokyo Station or the Imperial Palace, about the same time as taking a taxi in off-hours (no traffic). The neighborhood abounds with retail, hotels and government buildings. The complex at the base of the hotel (and in surrounding areas) includes dozens of food outlets ranging from noodle shops to Starbucks to fine dining French restaurants.Amenities: indoor pool, hot bath, treatment room and fitness gym located on the 30th floor. The pool is large with one wall of windows with uninterrupted views over the Tokyo skyline. The concierge offers a full range of services.The property amenities, location and views make it an oasis in the middle of busy, chaotic Tokyo. A very fine refuge with easy access to the surrounding neighborhood and the city at large.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We opted for club rooms in this fabulous hotel set on the top 7 floors (30-36) of a luxury residential building. The club category gave us access to complementary breakfast, tea time and happy hour with fantastic view from the 34th floor club lounge. The rooms themselves are just as expected from the photos but the fantastic daybed in the window is more then just design. The spa and pop are is to die for. We just lived to start and sometimes even end our day there.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We love to stay in this hotel, everything we claim for 5 star experience, we surely get in this hotel. Location is near to 2 metro station. Beside the hotel is a building with many kinds of restaurants, include Starbucks. We are planning to stay again for our next trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This was a great way to end our Japan trip. If you book well in advance, look for deals, and don't mind weekdays, you can get very affordable rates for this type of service. I will definitely be recommending this place to friends/family, and returning here in the future.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Best intro to Tokyo that you would wish for. Calm, upper class environment. Staff were amazing, nothing was too much trouble. Especially the concierge, Room had a wonderful view and the best beds ever. Bar was not cheap but again the service made up for the cost.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Beautiful new hotel with great viewsVery nice buffet breakfastPretty good gym that is 24hrsnice meeting facilitiesRooms are beautiful, very clean, and modern. Bathrooms are modern, clean, and large. Coffee maker and tea kettle in the room.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: While the hotel is newer and nice there are some issues that would prevent me from visiting again. The Platinum upgrade is the #1 reason individuals like myself stay with SPG. There was no Platinum upgrade, and just for enjoyment I asked the front desk daily if there was an upgrade available. Each time I smiled and waited and in the Japanese style of letting you "save face", the hotel clerks made a big to-do of typing on their keyboards, looking at the computer screen, making little faces and then saying "I'm so sorry we are fully booked". So if you stay here have an expectation you will receive the room you booked. I went as far as saying any room upgrade would be nice, that we didn't even need the Platinum Suite upgrade. It was clearly NOT happening.I have stayed previously at Ritz Carlton. While the Prince Gallery can run $600-$700/night, the Ritz Carlton should be within $100 if you book in advance and they WILL recognize your Marriott/SPG status. The Ritz Carlton is also 5 star in every way shape and form.What I wasn't appreciative of at the Prince Gallery was a bathroom with a postage stamp size counter. There was no way for two people to get ready at the same time. The shower/bath area was quite large, but the sink area ridiculous. God help you if you had children with you and were trying to get ready in the morning. Breakfast buffet at both the club room and the restaurant was the SAME every day. There was no variety or change in the food presentations. Compare this to the Ritz Carlton club which has a greater variety and higher quality, that changes daily. The same holds true for their breakfast buffet. I was completely bored by the food presentation at both the Oasis restaurant and club level after the 2nd day of our stay. I cannot imagine with the chefs at the Prince Gallery they cannot envision any variety to their club room or buffet breakfast selections. When requesting coffee or tea in the restaurant we found it usually took 10 minutes or more and sometimes ordering a specific tea caused problems because of a lack of English skill and the server not necessarily understanding an American accent. One morning I requested a latte and received tea. The next morning I requested a latte and several minutes later the gal returned to tell me the espresso machine was "out of order". Usually at the morning breakfast they would offer you eggs cooked to order but on two occasions they did not, whether because they forgot to ask or it just wasn't being offered that morning. Technology and operations within the rooms at Prince Gallery are fine. Beds are comfortable. Amenities are as expected in a 5 star hotel. What we did not find acceptable were stains on the carpets both in the hallway and within the room. I actually called the front desk and pointed out that there were stains on our carpeting in the room and to please shampoo them. While they may have made an attempt while we were out, it did not in any way look or feel as though they had brought in a machine and cleaned the carpets. There's no way a 5 star hotel should allow stains on the carpets, especially with the prices they are charging.My guess is that Prince Gallery has affiliated with Luxury Collection simply because they wanted to tap into the U.S. tourist and business market. They are a bit nicer than Sheraton and Westin, so that said, it makes sense they would be affiliated with Luxury Collection. There's no way they would have passed branding themselves as a St Regis. The gym and soaking pool within the locker rooms is very nice. Not overly large, but comfortable. They have a NO Tattoo policy and one of the other guests was told to put on long sleeves to be able to use the men's soaking pool. I found this laughably archaic and thankfully I have no tattoos. But it is a nod to older Japanese culture and guests from other countries with tattoos will have a time of it if they want to use the soaking pools in the locker room. I believe there is a separate charge that's $45 or so to use the regular swimming pool. Given the room rates that is also inappropriate in my opinion. I'm giving the Prince Gallery a "generous" 4 Star Rating.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a magnificent view hotel.. it is built on the top 6 floors of a large office building. The corner rooms have multiple views ---tub overlooking Tokyo. Service exceptional...great concierge lounge with drinks and food. Breakfast in the restaurant (included with Starwood Platinum status) was a 3 room buffet with major selections.The two story bar has the most magnificent view in Tokyo. (yes better than the New York in the Hyatt). The whole building (below the hotel) had every restaurant and service that you could want without leaving the premise but we didn't know that till the last day. Two subway lines connect underground...beware that one took major walking.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Is the Prince a good hotel? YESWere the rooms pretty and clean? YESWere the beds comfortable? YESWas the bathroom large with a separate soaking tub? YES Was the location good? YESWere the views spectacular? YESSo what was missing? For me, having just stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Hong Kong the night before we arrive in Tokyo at the Prince, I was ruined. You see, the Ritz in HK set a new standard for me when it comes to service and really making you feel welcomed and at home (stay tuned for that review).I was so blown away by the service I had received at the Ritz HK and then to arrive at the Prince on my husband's birthday (we both had business and were celebrating his birthday weekend here), and not have any sort of birthday amenity or even a card offered seemed more than a little disappointing. To top it off, we got in around 10pm and the room I had originally booked (a king club room) was not available and they put us in a twin bedroom the night of my husband's birthday (though they did switch us later in our stay).Overall, the Prince was a good hotel, with a wonderful executive club area, but it was missing that personal touch that has a hotel go from good to great.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I've been to Tokyo a dozen time and this is my favorite hotel. Hotel is brand new, modern with excellent service and amazing views. We took the limo bus and it drop us in front of the hotel. Staff took our luggage and lead us to 36th floor reception to check in. The lobby is modern and beautiful with large windows. Room is modern, clean, large size bathroom shower/tub area with privacy glass that can switch between clear and cloudy via controls. The water pressure is high with big shower space and great amenities. Nice toto toilet with light sensor when you walk towards it. Bedside plugs and ipad control. Great turn down service. Gym is well equipped, nice and clean. While I was on the treadmill, staff came over, open and offer me bottle water. Staff like this makes the hotel.Outstanding staff from concierge always getting us a taxi and help us translate our destination, housekeeper, client services to reception. Beautiful bar with high ceilings and large window. Great friendly service, we tried 6 different cocktails and our favorite was the grapefruit mojito and mango smoothie. There is a supermarket, restaurants, convenient store on the 2nd floor.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Perfectly efficient and large (for Tokyo), spotless rooms with great views and comfortable beds. An attentive and polite staff service the hotel which has pleasantly scented common spaces. The hotel is located near the Imperial Palace and Ginza, but is in a business district with few closeby stores and eateries.The gym is well appointed and the sauna delicious and very clean. There is also a great lap pool. The TV selections in both the gym and room are sparce on english language channels and the internet works well in the room, but not on the gym equipment.The buffet breakfast is of high quality and terrific variety. While there is a high level of activity among the very polite staff, it sometimes takes a few requests for coffee and water.The only issue we had were very sparce "tourist services" alternatives at the concierge, from which we planned to fill out two days of touring. The local maps were virtutually useless with few road names. We ended up booking activities from the internet. All in all, I will be back.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed before alone during a business trip only for sleep :) very nice hotel. But this time with family. Any restrictions on Kids in this hotel? A little bit confused, as on SPG website, I could not put the # kids to book the deluxe/premier room, but on expedia I succeeded on the booking of 2 adults+2kids(4yrs+9yrs) for one deluxe twin room including breakfast for 4. SPG website states the family plan of this hotel allows kids below 12yrs. Any suggestions? Shall I keep the expedia booking to sacrifice my spg platinum recognition? Of make a reservation again on SPG for only 2 adults?

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The service in this hotel is exceptional and the view of the city from our room was breathtaking! Reception is located on the 36th floor and when you arrive by auto you are whisked away by a porter and taken to reception. The first thing you see exiting the elevator is a view of the city from on high. The Bar and Restaurant are located on the 34 through 36 floors with views of the city. Our hotel room was computer controlled by an iPad. The swimming pool is located on the 30th floor as is a workout area. The room was perfectly arranged and as it was our first night in Tokyo the experience was exceptionally significant! Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I was thrilled to discover this hotel, finally having a great SPG hotel within close proximity to my office her Hibiya/Ginza. The property is essentially brand new, and the management photos do it justice. Views are spectacular since the hotel operates on floors 30-36 of the building. This hotel also had the best water pressure I have ever experienced in a hotel. The rainfall shower was truly delightful. The gym and indoor pool are also highlights - the equipment is abundant, including many cardio options, machine and free weights, even a cable machine and a smith press machine. The locker room facilities with the hot and cold baths were totally luxe. and the gym, the pool, and the locker room have stunning views from the 30th floor. The automated room, with tablet controls was super cool, and the type of thing you enjoy and expect when visitingTokyo - it feels next-fen tech. It turned out my company travel agency booked a rate via expedia. For this reason, they didn't recognize my SPG elite status or award me points or late check-out, which i found frustrating and not something I've experienced elsewhere (though i wasn't aware the agency was booking through expedia when rates were favorable).

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for work for three nights I found the staff polite and courteous with good English. The rooms were good size and presentable strange that the TV stations sucked as really bad selection if you don’t understand Japanese. Being a high end 5 star hotel I find this unacceptable

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I lived in Japan when I was in the Navy and have traveled there since then a few times, but this was my fiance's first trip to Japan, so I wanted to make it special. Along those lines, this was a bit higher than I'd normally pay for more than a night or 2 at any hotel, but I had some SPG suite night awards I needed to use, so I thought I'd roll the dice and try for the ultimate experience. And I hit the jackpot. I'm not sure if it was because I'm SPG Platinum or if this room was the only one available for a suite upgrade those 4 nights, but they hooked me up BIG TIME. The suite was ridiculously awesome, super spacious and the views from the floor to ceiling windows were amazing. Loved the layout, amenities and little things like free water/macarons.The staff were always prompt, attentive, helpful and friendly. They made our stay super special, just like we had hoped for. I highly recommend this hotel and would love to stay there again next time I'm in Tokyo...

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I have waited a year until this property to run smooth to visit since I have high expectation from this Prince , though branded under SPG.Location: 5 mins walk to Akasaka Mitsuke stn with Ginza & Marounouchi Line , Direct access to Nagatacho station with 3 metro lines. There are many pubs and restaurants by Akasaka-Mitsuke station. While G to 3 level of the Hotel building (Tokyo Garden Terrace) also have a good variety of restaurants. I took taxi from Tokyo station, while taxi driver had no problem sending me there.There is a 24-hr convenience store on 2nd level of the building, and a Seijo-Ishi supermarket. This may not be a good hub for those shopping geaks who need to take metro or taxi to major shopping area, not much shopping in both area, mainly is a business area.Service: Overall English skill of staff is insufficient, especially in the Oasis restaurant.Japanese hospitality is courteous and helpful, so you could expect the same in this property. Just not meticulous, it was my birthday when I checked in, the front desk staff did not notice, while in the past, like Mandarin or Four Seasons either on check in date or during my stay, the hotel will take note. (Unfortunately, I always have work trip on my birthday). I request the Bell to mail a letter before I checked out which I have put more than enough stamps for a local mail, the staff was like encountering a crisis, check many times against the postage chart before accepting it. Room: I believe I have the lowest grade twin room which is not as big as I expected, may be the huge bathroom took up half of the 46 sq m.hardware is great, an ipad for a good selection of newspaper and magazine. Turndown service is good with treats(choco & Macarons). I requested for Buckwheat pillow that was sent up right away. The main control of lighting is only next to one Twin bed that 's not very handy.Dining: The bar is quite busy during weekday. Not very spacious. Breakfast spread is excellent, should have tried the Japanese breakfast during my 4-day stay. Next time... As other posters reviewed, there are many staff in the restaurant, but service is still lacking.. it took a long time to brew a second pot of tea. Every morning, despite I emphatically request for fresh lemon, every time, different staff still forget.One major flaw, on 32 floor, from the lift foyer thru a glass door the short passage, leading to the run of house rooms, is so dark from evening time, during morning time the passage was well-lit, but somehow, late pm evening thru the night, is very dim. I wonder if the timer is set wrong...I would love to return,

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I travel a lot and stay at hotels a lot. And I always feel finding the perfect hotel is not that easy. But this hotel was perfect.The room, which is just one-year old, is super functional (thanks for generous upgrade to a spacious corner room with a magnificent view) and people are nice and hospitable. Their swimming pool at the spa was also first class and enjoyable. Some major brand hotels sometimes make you feel they are running the hotel just for their business, even though they are categorized as Luxury. But this hotel made me feel they are running the hotel because they love running the hotel.As a Tokyoite, I remember Prince brand didn't enjoy a good reputation back in 90s-00s.But this completely-reborn Prince with Starwood could change my perception towards Prince Hotels.And I'm so glad this hotel is the nearest Starwood property to my home.Thank you Prince Gallery for a great stay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I stayed in a Club Deluxe King room last month for one night before I headed for Izu. The most fabulous thing about this hotel is its decoration in public area, so colorful and tasteful. Different kinds of lines and colors and shapes orchestrated to a beautiful and harmonic chapter with its own character. Guest room is nice, though not the one I will wow at the first sight, but it feels good to stay in there and many items they chose are with very good quality. Pool and gym are nice and spacious, and since I stayed in the club floor, I also had access to the locker room and sauna, which I will highly recommend to those who enjoy taking a good bath and beautiful scenery of Tokyo at the same time.Club Lounge is not too big and has a tranquil vibe. The food and drinks offered here are good as well, not to mention that you can see the iconic Tokyo Tower from here, it sparkles in the evening and comes extremely well with your cocktails or nightcaps.I had my breakfast in the All-day Dining Oasis Garden instead of the lounge, which I've enjoyed my tea time and cocktail time. The selection of buffet is excellent, though I chose the Japanese breakfast, which deserved very high ranking among my experiences. The taste was delicate and the presentation was photogenic.Now we move on to the not-so-amazing part of my stay in this hotel- the service. When I checked in, the female staff was not so fluent in English, which to my surprise in a luxury hotel like this (and it calls itself a Luxury Collection Hotel, right?). After that, she looked at me and asked if I can go down to the room by myself (and my huge suitcase stood besides me) or need a bellman to help with luggage and show me the room. I wondered if I did something wrong? It was my first time here and OF COURSE it would be more than pleasant if someone can help, and usually in my stays in other good or luxury hotels, they didn't ask their guest such question, they just did and help, so I was stunned..And what I saw in the Club Lounge (more than once, at least three times) was, the staffs took a glance of the guests who are apparently not Japanese or not Japanese-speaking (like me), but they DID came to ask those Japanese guest what they need served the drinks to their table in person, while foreigners like us were left behind and did our own buffet thing. It was so frustrated to see such things.And while the food at Oasis Garden was excellent, the service was way opposite. During my breakfast, even though there were many staffs walking around, no one stopped by and fill my glass with water, and of course no one to ask if I need some more coffee or tea, and you can easily guess, no one to ask me about my opinion of food. I used to stay in St. Regis Osaka, another top-notched hotel in SPG, and they effortlessly achieve these three requirements I mentioned above.Oh, and please visit their website, you won't find any email address to contact with the hotel. I've reflected this ridiculous thing to SPG and they promised to improve it, but still, the pride and stubbornness of the hotel let it remain the same. I really like its design, but to be called a Luxury hotel, it certainly has a long way to go in service wise.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: A wonderful stay , very kind , advanced , always there once u need something. Good assorted whiskey bar , didn’t get the change to try the dinner at 36 th floor , will try next time. Sushi restaurant amazing as u can surly expect in Japan. You have a real feeling of home

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I spent a week at the hotel in early September and was incredibly impressed. The staff was beyond friendly and helpful. The iPad control for the bedroom appliances is amazing. The bathroom amenities were first rate and plentiful. The Starwood relationship is still a bit hazy and needs to be better defined. Other than that, a first rate experience.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel. From the moment you walk in, the amazing views from the lobby and bar are absolutely breathtaking. The staff is so nice and welcoming. The concierge was extremely accommodating. Our room was fantastic, another amazing view and very modern/hi-tech. A control panel for lights, curtains, etc. An automatic light and toilet sensor for middle of the night bathroom trips. Excellent bath product quality. And the lounge has something to eat or drink all day and a great breakfast spread. It's on the expensive side, but very well worth it!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I stayed here for seven nights and would definitely stay again. The room was impeccably clean, service was perfect, and it has easy access to the Tokyo Metro. I had to leave my room mid-week because it was a king room and I had booked two twins, so I wasn't the happiest about that but I understood (the hotel needs more king bed rooms!). The next time I'm staying in Tokyo this will be at the top of my list.Pros:- Incredible service - everyone is friendly, no matter where you are.- The room is A+ with a beautiful seating area by the window and the shower is the best shower I have ever used!- Easy access to the Tokyo Metro- Cheaper dining options on the 2nd floor Cons:- The bar is beautiful but 2100 Yen for a mixed drink is robbery.- There are too many twin bed rooms.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I have been to Tokyo several times, still havent met any hotel room size could be up to my standard. This is the first time I have ever stayed in a room, and bathroom that is comparable to those big hotel rooms in Thailand. It gives me and my parter sufficient room to stretch and relax.Apart from that, I particularly love their gym room, it opens 24 hours a day, so i dont have to worry about if I come back too late, I couldnt use the facility.The executive lounge is just located near my room, snacks are being provided all day long. I think this is the best hotel I have ever stayed in Tokyo!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I really like this hotel. Decoration and room finishing is great. The pool is a decent size and gym is well equipped. Service was excellent, staff were very helpful in helping us sort out some difficulties during our travels. Hotel is located in the business district but not too far from the more touristy areas. There are 2 train lines that can be accessed less than 5 mins from the hotel so relatively convenient. Views are great as the hotel rooms are located on the higher floors of the building. Breakfast is international buffet style and good but they do have Japanese style breakfast if requested (didn't know that in the beginning so was really happy to find out they had a Japanese style breakfast). Overall a really good hotel to stay in while in Japan.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Prince gallery hotel surpassed all my expectations and is clearly setting the standard for Tokyo.The only main issue with Prince gallery is the location, it is not as prime compared to ritz carlton roppongi or grand Hyatt. Prince is located near the office district in Tokyo, however has good underground links. Taxis are also readily available, but just expect of time to get to common places like shibuya etc. The facilities and ID is simply first-class. The architecture is stunning and the interior is filled with modern lighting and slick finishes. There is an abundant of facilities there with 2 bars, a jap and all day dining res. Food served in both were great (jap fusion res was a little bitnunderwhelming for the price... this is the only part which I feel needs improvement.) The breakfast was superb, helpful staff with a great selection of western and jap options!In terms of facilities in can safely say it's one of the best - nice swimming pool,superb gym with the latest equipment and even with a powerplate. Overall love the design, efficient lifts, modern features they have adopted in the rooms with soft electronic lighting. Simply amazing!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Hotel looks beautiful from lobby to my club lounge king room. I love the modern design of the whole hotel. The room was very spacious, great huge window with great view, amazing bathroom. The hot bath & gym were well designed. Male hot bath has a great view. The hot bath was so soothing & definitely a wonderful added bonus to the hotel amenity list. Staff were so wonderful, professional, courteous, heart warming from the moment I get off the taxi to check in to the moment I left for taxi after check out. Taxi always came within seconds of request. The hotel is within a few minutes of walking to Akasaka area where there were lots of restaurants & convenient stores. The location is another great feature as well. I could not have asked for more. The service and the entire hotel stay were impeccable & literally perfect. I will definitely return to this hotel next time I visit Tokyo!!!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My wife and I (42 and 35) recently completed a 5-night stay here on a vacation to Tokyo. We are SPG platinum members who travel about 120 days a year. This was our first time in Tokyo so we didn't want to chance anything and we booked in the nicest hotel we could find on the SPG website.The Cons:The room lights, window shades, TV, are all automated on a tablet and touchscreen near your bed. This is all very state of the art and nothing like we have seen to date. The problem is with all this technology it was a hassle constantly as there were repeated communication errors. Doing the simplest thing like turning mood lighting off was a whole ordeal night after night. Very aggravating. The wifi was a disaster as well, constantly dropping and never consistent.I am an athlete so I need to workout in the mornings before I start my day. I was informed on day 1 when I walked into the gym that no tattoos were allowed to be exposed. There is no mention of this on their website or in any literature that I could find. I feel like discrimination like this should be left back for the days when it was tolerated, not in 2017. This policy is wrong on so many levels that I cannot begin to list them all. Mind you I have non-offensive arm tattoos, not an F-U tattooed on my forehead. I didn't travel with any long sleeve workout gear so I had to go shopping to accommodate this ridiculous rule. Needless to say, I only used the gym once after that and I went to a local gym down the street. Are the snobby people in the hotel really going to care about an Amercian guy with arm tattoos working out in the hotel gym? Wasnt body art made popular in Japan anyway????The staff are super overbearing. Its like way too much attention. To make eye contact with you, they would step in front of you as you walked by to get your attention. It isn't a really relaxing environment when you are forced to interact with everyone you walk by. Sometimes you just want to go from point A to point B without being asking 5-6-7 times, "how are you", "is everything ok", "can I help you". Wayyyyyyy too much. Management needs to chill with the pushiness on the employees.Our room wasn't upgraded upon check-in or as a Suite request upgrade months prior. I checked earlier in the day and they had Suites available online. This ticks me off as why have an elite status if the rules aren't honored??The cabs and Uber drivers can't find the place. This is a real pain when trying to go anywhere or get picked up. Pros:Mattress, pillows, room accommodations, room treats, bath amentities, bath fixtures all 5*. All top quality and in perfect shapeVery quiet rooms, hallways, as well as the building, is very secure, you need a keycard to go everywhere. This is all great for sleeping in and having a great night sleep.Being only 6 floors (the top 6 floors of a huge office building) the elevators were very fast. You are never left waiting and rarely ever have to share one. This was great.The club lounge was nice. They have a cook making eggs and their small buffet is 5* compared to all the other club lounges I've been in to date.Nothing is out of place and the building and property are immaculate.All in all, I won't be back because of the discriminating tattoo policy they have. Body art is a form of personal expression like any artist. Similar to having purple hair, a nose piercing or a woman wearing a Burka. I shouldn't have to be explaining this in 2017. Never again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The first time I stayed in this hotel was in Feb 2017. I was very impressed by the room layout and its spaciousness. And the location of this hotel is superb. I was equally impressed by the amazing service that I received from Mr. Kentaro Usami, the front office manager. It was my first time staying in this hotel so I asked for walking direction to my office. He not only gave me directions but he in fact accompanied me down to the Level where I'm supposed to be walking to my office. Really superb customer experience. And, of course, I'll be back again this Oct and looking forward to it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Several people from my office have tried to call the phone number listed on the website and no one answers the phone! There also is no email address to contact anyone at the hotel. This is very frustrating! We need to know what type of room number 305 is. Deluxe? Premier? Twin? Double? What? Can anyone help?

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I was fortunate to be able to stay at both the Kioi Suites and the Designer Suite for about a week for our 1 yr anniversary. The service here is great, they gave me recommendations for kobe beef restaurants and helped with reservations. I also asked if they could help us celebrate the occasion and they did not disappoint, decorating the room with rose petals and giving us a display of pastries, cards, wine, etc. to great us.I used the suite night upgrade for SPG and emailed the concierge that I had a preference for the Designer Suite. At check in they apologized for not being able to accommodate that specific suite but said it would be open on the last night of our stay. With our permission, they moved our luggage when the Designer Suite was available and it was seamless.I can not reiterate enough how welcoming, helpful and friendly the staff are at this hotel. The amenities, views, etc. are also stellar. It is a very business-focused and a bit formal of a hotel so I don't think I saw anyone under the age of 20 here and it does NOT have the vibe of a W.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Having stayed 6 nights at Prince Gallery, i would say that this hotel room is large, the finishing perfect and it is very new.Location is perfect, having served by a few train lines. It is located next to a shopping centre so there is ample food. Yakitori downstairs is nice.The room itself is tastefully furnished. Very nice view of Tokyo as all rooms are located between 30-36th floors. The staff very pleasant, and helpful. Only setback was the room service. Limited menu (for 3am drunk cravings, only beef curry was available and not even club sandwich). Besides the room service, everything went well. Would highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Expensive but you can book with Chase points. Probably the nicest hotel I've ever stayed in. Stunning in every way and a real treat in Tokyo. If budget is not a concern or you have loyalty points stashed away, do not hesitate to book. The rooms are large with the latest technology, a Bose Sound link so you can play your music. Pictures are of the view and exterior. Location is quiet but close to many subway lines. Multiple restaurants and convenience stores are close.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Prince Gallery for four days in July 2017, as part of our wedding anniversary trip to Japan.We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and particularly liked:- The exceptional service, and very accommodating staff- The modern rooms, where everything can be controlled by iPad- The well-equipped gym- Helpful concierge, who organized a dinner reservation for us- Relaxing, and well-stocked executive loungeDuring our time in Tokyo, we stayed at the Prince Gallery and the Ritz-Carlton. I had sent both hotels emails in advance of our stay, describing our special occasion. We felt the Ritz-Carlton did a superior job acknowledging our wedding anniversary. While the Prince Gallery arranged a dinner reservation for us, we felt there was no acknowledgement of our anniversary from the hotel or staff during our stay, and we felt much more special at the Ritz.We enjoyed our stay at the Prince Gallery and I would gladly travel here on business in the future. However, in order to compete with the best hotels in Tokyo, I would encourage the hotel to more strongly acknowledge special occasions, especially when notified about them in advance.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: A beautiful hotel with interesting design and art. The rooms are modern with great showers with privacy settings to fog out the glass. Cool room lighting easily managed at the bedside or with the available iPad. Great city views from the room or from the nice bar with views of Tokyo Tower. What was especially appreciated was the friendly service at every turn. There was always someone ready to help you or point you in the right direction. This place is an experience!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I was staying in Prince Gallery Tokyo for 5 nights with my family in summer time , and it was truly a great experience . Friendly staff, great breakfast, tho the swimming pool is not allowed for kids but we spend most of time exploring the city so we didn't mind. Subway is in walking distance and lots restaurants nearby, will definity go back.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We have been to Japan a few times and this is by far our favourite hotel we have stayed in. The location was perfect. It's not as busy as places like Shinjuku or shibuya which we find can get a little overwhelming. While it's still a busy area with lots of restaurants and shops close by it also has a slightly more relaxing vibe. It has two stations located less than five minutes walk away and is central so it's very easy to move around the city. The pool, spa and gym area are perfect. They have great views and there is someone constantly checking that everyone is ok. Myself and my partner unfortunately have tattoos which in Japan is not overly accepted in bathing and swimming areas. The staff went out of there way to help us use temporary skin tattoos, which the provide, to cover up so we could enjoy the pool area. They were very apologetic and kind about it.The rooms are wonderful! They are spotless with no wear and tear at all. Everything is high tech and is controlled by iPads. The room is spacious, which is not always the case in Tokyo, it has a well thought out layout and the views are incredible! From almost every spot in the room you can look out of a very large window over the city and nearby parks. Every night they would leave us a turn down present of some water, crackers and macaroons. This hotel only takes up the top few floors of the building so the views are really wonderful. We stayed in rooms 3044 and 3510 both were equally wonderful, I don't think that there is a bad room here. We moved rooms due to spending one night in the middle of our stay on mt fuji and the hotel was kind enough to hold our luggage while we were gone. Once we returned to the hotel the staff noticed we were sunburnt and organised a special rash shirt for us to swim in to avoid us having to place anything on our skin to cover our tattoos. This was such a thoughtful touch and we would like to thank the hotel for this. We booked the buffet breakfast and we would highly recommend it if you do stay here. The selection was plentiful, it was all freshly cooked, tasty and most importantly they do a good coffee. All the staff are incredibly respectful and will go out of there way to help you at any time. They make every person feel important and that they have an enjoyable stay. We will return to Japan and without fail we won't even look at other hotels, we will continue to come back here as there was nothing to fault. We were so happy and can't wait to get back again soon. Thank you to the hotel and all the staff for making this trip such a relaxing and easy stay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We arrived late from Narita airport and the staff couldn't have been more accommodating. Even at that late hour, the lounge was still open and we were offered champagne for a night-cap....how could we resist?The room was extremely comfortable and well laid out. The view from the room was great, especially at night.The breakfast buffet was quite complete and fresh.We'll be back, hopefully for a longer stay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I am a Japanese breakfast lover...wherever I go, I try to have the Japanese breakfast, it doesn't matter it is in Middle East nor North America, although I am not a Japanese. I have to say they offer the best Japanese breakfast, not one of the best , it is the best!!! They use good Japanese rice not the cheap one, it also comes with Waygu beef with braised tofu and entire crab claw on top. Although the claw was frozen, it still tasted well the highlight is the fresh sea urchin with slight seasoned tofu... it was prepared and tasted like it was presented in a stand alone dish offering...Sitting by the window on the 36/f overlooking the wonderful city view of Tokyo while enjoying this breakfast, I cannot find a better way of starting my day

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great room and wonderful staff. Wonderful breakfast buffet and high tech bathroom with glass that goes from clear to opaque. Rain shower and soaking tub were exceptional. Stayed 5 nights at this hotel and 15 days in other parts of Japan; this hotel was by far the best.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I have stayed at a number of hotels in Tokyo and the Prince Gallery is hands down the best.
