To list just some of the things I liked:- Brand new facilities that are as technologically advanced as you can get.- Amazing views from pretty much every part of the hotel.- Convenient, central location.- Excellent food.- Most importantly, top-notch staff. Service in Japan is always good, but the staff at the Prince Gallery consistently went above and beyond. All members of the staff were friendly and helpful. In particular, the concierge arranged several things for me that I did not think would be possible. They were amazing.Next time I am in Tokyo, I will definitely stay at the Prince Gallery. I can't recommend it enough.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed a total of 3 nights. The hotel is very new with modern amenities and a lot of nice tech. After a busy day in Tokyo, this hotel really brings a sense of zen and peace elevating you above the hustle and bustle of the city. Would definitely stay again on my next trip to Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Once you enter the hotel lobby, you will be in heaven. It is a great hotel with a magnificent breakfast. The rooms were big and ample. A great shower and incredible service throughout the hotel. At night, a drink at the bar is a must.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Truly enjoyed this property. Only stayed one night but would come back here in a heartbeat.Service was amazing, room very comfortable, clean, and well appointed.Would highly recommend this place.Location was good. Food was good, not great but overlooked it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Very cool, modern hotel in a decent location near two subway stations. Staff very friendly and helpful, with great English. The gym and pool are very good. Our room was great, very well equipped and fantastic views. Executive lounge very good. Expensive, but worth it. One of the best hotels we have stayed at worldwide.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: this hotel is the best in its class on all fronts: latest equipment, friendly and efficient staff, customer policy that makes common areas pleasant at all times. rooms are lofty, offer a tremendous view, breakfast is great, gym and swimming pool areas offer great equipment and super clean. it is a successful mix of western and japanese style hospitality. location is convenient, there is a direct access to te undergroundour best stay in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this hotel for the nights and it was great. Room was spacious for a city hotel and the staff was very polite. The staff was eager to be helpful, but it didn't make you uncomfortable like I have felt at other high end hotels. The spa was very nice and the fitness facility was good. The pool is really for lap swimming, no children allowed. The club lounge was nice, but very similar to other lounges in this type of hotel. Not to the standard of s Ritz Carlton lounge. The only thing I felt this hotel could work on was the concierge service. I actually received better concierge service from front desk and bell desk than I did from the concierge. In fact I would suggest actually using the other staff for any concierge needs you might have. I can't say enough about the staff at this hotel and would not hesitate to stay here again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I wanted to like this hotel, spent 4 night here and a frequent traveler to Tokyo. The rooms are very comfortable, beds spacious, shower and tub is basically perfect. Work out room very well equipped, pool and Japanese style spa with traditional bathing baths. What is off is the service. Plenty of people around and extremely polite but it's the little detailed things that you expect from St Regis, Ritz and similar quality hotels. Drink orders can take a while and sometimes not correct, concierge recommendations while acceptable are not precisely on mark, and sake servers disappear never to be seen again, and don't even bother with the free sake tasting. Food at Oasis is passable but very expensive for quality and portions. Location is just OK but not the hotel's fault. Very close to 5 subway lines so can get most anywhere but not much in immediate location as far as shops, restaurants and the such and due to that cab fare can get expensive getting around. 3 star rating is for relative as a 5 star hotel. In other words, it is safe, comfortable and has amenities but not up to comparable 5 star hotel expectations.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I woke up quite early (jet lag) to see Mt Fuji framed in my window. This hotel provides impeccable service. As a solo travel with very limited Japanese, I felt at ease and at home. It was a great jumping off point for exploring the city.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel the Gallery was just an amazing experience. I spent 2 nights here (room 3338), please fine here my reviewPositive- from the check-in to the concierge... everyone was extremely kind, professional and pro-active!- Room was 100% clean- Room had an amazing view, I could stay all the day just relaxing with this view- The lobby, bars etc are also just wonderful- The guest is really feeling welcomeNegative- Breakfast buffet was good, but not excellent: service was very slow, not a lot of sweets, croissants were not fresh, not a lot of cheese, etc. Overall the breakfast buffet was good, but not on the excellent level as the entire hotel.Every employee was really kind and everyone try to help in a pro-active way.I strongly recommend this beautiful hotel!I would like to thanks all the great employees of this hotel! It was a DREAM, just fantastic!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: How does one even begin to describe the incredible experience we had a this phenomenal hotel... it suited all our purposes of what we require to an absolute detail.Let's start with the service levels as that literally ensures ones time at any given place is enjoyable. From the minute your wheels stop rolling you are transported to a universe where you never want to leave. From the assistant who opens your door, to the carrying of any luggage, to opening doors where another person is already holding the elevator for your ride to the hotel reception where everything starts in terms of going anywhere in the hotel. Every single staff member role thereafter is seamless regarding their function and go above and beyond their call of duty. Nothing is too much of an effort for this team at all, no matter what your need is.The interior decor is completely modern and beautifully designed. Their website pictures are great but cannot even to compare with the exquisite detailing from the ceilings, walls, lighting down to the floors. Those enamored with technological gadgets will love how theirs blows ones mind especially when coming from a western world. The Toto is my favorite feature in the bathrooms. I literally want to write a separate article just on this outstanding bathroom toilet. Try it!!! The bedrooms have every necessity provided in packaging which is tasteful and classy. Nothing is overwhelming, just gently understated like the Japanese culture.The restaurants are superb and have all the basic needs for being in Japan with artistry in every piece of crockery, cutlery to serving style. The people friendly environment at the bar area is totally welcoming even for someone like me who doesn't imbibe any alcohol. It converts to a tea area in the afternoons and completely pleasant to sit and observe the ladies meeting daily for their little chit chats. The area in itself is a masterpiece in decor and centrifugal in welcoming you back from a weary day to its calming and amazing presence. I simply loved just sitting here every single day for my tea or coffee and simply being.The sheer convenience of traveling anywhere in Japan is easy from here and a few steps away from shops, restaurants, taxis and the subway system as well as the rail system which all interconnects below and above ground like a spiders web. The hotel will easily assist you with precise maps on exactly where to find which train to your destination. Don't misunderstand me, it's not a hotel for anyone who is looking for something central that bright and bustling. It's for discerning people who want a tranquil environment amidst the phenomenal storm that is Tokyo. It's a haven when inside and all your needs are catered for. My hotel is my place that needs to be home when on vacation and this one gives one that in abundance. I cannot even begin to describe this place no matter how I try. All I'm saying is that if you value quality, service excellence, convenience, environmentally friendly and green conscious comfort, technology, modern lodgings with old world attention you've arrived at your destination. Saving the best for last is the superb concierge team at this hotel. I cannot find sufficient superlatives to describe what they did for us for the period of a month on this journey. Momoi, you and your staff are the best ever!!! Keep up the fantastic service and we will certainly return soon to this place which felt like home. I can continue to wax lyrically for numerous more paragraphs but prefer that you keep this gem of an hotel top of mind when coming to Tokyo... then understand my rapture!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Loved my experience in the hotel. True 5 star hotel. The lobby is outstanding. The staff were accommodative. Spacious room. Beautiful view of Tokyo. Great spa, pool and gym. Definitely stay here if you want a luxury experience.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Actually I live in Tokyo, but sometime I stay a hotel for relaxing on weekend.I already stay, Park Hyatt, Grand Hyatt, Andaz, Rits Carlton, Hyatt Regency, Conrad, Four seasons, Mandarin etc.From my personal feeling, it is one of best hotel in Tokyo for relaxing.The hotel just has opened since last July, so facility is so nice. Also security might be more tight than other hotels. I am a platinum member, so I enjoyed executive lounge, but a variety of breakfast in lounge is a little bit not enough. Hospitality is great, they are always providing professional, warm and nice response. I am totally sensitive for price, I stay around 45,000Yen including tax and service charge, this price is reasonable. If the price hike over 50,000, you need to consider other hotel.In anyway, I strongly suggest, if you want to relax, you can stay!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I stayed in total 7 days in this hotel.First thing first, we got upgraded to Grand Deluxe room on our first leg and then to a Kioi (Junior) Suite on our second leg, due to my status as SPG Platinum.Service: Japanese quality, best of the best. Anything you need they will try to cater it. I would like to point out the excellent service and job of the concierge team (I mainly liaise with Ms Kimi). Try pocket concierge and arry japan if you are looking to dine in fancy and famous restaurant, also use tabelog.com for reference.Room Quality: High Tech, Clean, Modern and Comfy. Many other reviews have talk about the room extensively.Facilities: Although I didn't use the gym and swimming pool, I had a look, it was awesome. All new machinery, quiet and well maintain. Big note, they don't let kids swim in the swimming pool.Club Lounge: Not too big, but enough. Has unlimited drinks, alcohol and small snacks. Breakfast: The buffet is simple, there aren't that many varieties but rest assured the quality of the food and ingredient is of utmost quality. I would recommend that you try the Japanese Set, it's delicious and very delightful visually. Dining/Food: Downstairs you will find a complete options of cuisine to eat, all the way from casual to fine dining. Just on top of my head they have: indian, asian, soba, sushi, steak, italian, chinese, sukiyaki, bento, starbucks, oysters and others. We tried most of them casual ones and they are okay/good. Also, about 5 minutes walk is an area call Akasaka, basically there are hundreds of small restaurant in the area, so food-wise no hazzle and you won't run out of option. If you are lazy the hotel has in-room dining service and 2 restaurant, the buffet/mediteranian/casual and the japanese (alacarte, sushi bar and teppan in one restaurant) Location: Perfect, not only that on the same complex you have two supermarket, one runs by Seibu and the other one more of a convenience store (Family Mart), both have its own charm. There is a subway downstairs but we didn't use, we walked mostly to Akasaka-mitsuke (5 mins walk to the nearest entrance) it runs on Ginza and Manouchi lines, which are the two main lines that will connect you to Ginza, Shinjuku, Shibuya and etc. So overall this hotel is perfect. Only a couple of notes, we forgot to turn off our do not disturb sign, so when we return on a saturday evening (17.30) we asked them to clean the room, it seems that the 'actual' housekeeping people left already (maybe its saturday, who knows?) so came about 5-6 people in suits cleaning the place. But definitely the standard is way off, they didn't change many things. Maybe the hotel need to look into this, they should keep the standard and maybe the crew at all times, knowing its a luxury hotel.One more thing, the view is breathtaking. I attach in this review a picture of the view.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Work trip and with wife. Great club room. Wanted upgrade to suite - saw one which was huge but not as nice as our room, so we stayed there 6 nights. Breakfast in club area with chef for small dishes/ eggs. Afternoon team and evening snack. Champagne and drinks in evening. staff friendly and effective. Gym, spa, pool. Bar with great Views. Best stay so far in Tokyo. Short taxi ride to ginza, Tokyo station, shinjuku, shibuya. Lots of nice restaurants in building and convenience stores. Easy Metro access.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I think this is a relatively newer hotel. Tokyo is an overwhelming city so not sure exactly where it's located but easy enough to travel by taxi or subway. The room had a lot of push buttons and gadgets so very neat. Only downside is the breakfast restaurant didn't open until 7am. That's a bit late for a business traveler. Fitness center was fantastic.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: First stay in Tokyo. Great location close to CBD. Warm welcome and extremely professional. Very good service all around. Room was very comfortable and well appointed. I cannot fault this hotel in any way. Five Stars!!!!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This property has been receiving high praise since its opening. The accolades are well-deserved. I was there for one night on a lay-over, and enjoyed every moment of my stay. While I didn’t receive much of an upgrade as a lifetime SPG platinum, my room was well-appointed and the fit and finish was of the highest quality. It took me awhile to find the Nespresso machine tucked into the corner of the cabinet (OK, I had to call the front-desk for guidance), but everything else was intuitive. There were 3 areas that were particularly noteworthy. The gym and spa were gems with all the right equipment and impeccably maintained. The concierge lounge provided snacks and breakfast that could compete with a destination restaurant with a brilliant view of the city. And, finally the concierge staff were clearly dedicated to the notion of helping guests. They kindly figured out where I could enjoy some cherry blossom views even after all the traditional sites had shut for the evening. On past visits to Tokyo, I’ve stayed at the Park Hyatt and the Four Seasons. Going forward, you’ll find me at the Prince Gallery enjoying all the wonderful service, amenities and the most comfortable cotton pajamas ever.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We loved this hotel.. we spent five days there in April. The room was beautiful and the staff was fantastic. Everyone was eager to help us with anything we asked for. Nice gym and good Club Floor.Highly recommended.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The Hotel starts on the 35th floor and goes up from there. What more do I need to say? Well, how about impeccable service (every staff member spoke english much better than we spoke Japanese!), wonderful artwork everywhere, and a room with a view to die for! Oh, and the room--modern Japanese design at its best. If you like remote controls and wall switches, the room has it all (there was one button we couldn't figure out, but I guessed it turned on the searchlight on the roof, but my wife thought I was probably wrong!). The Club Room was spectacular in terms of service, food and view. Importantly, the entire Hotel just hummed with efficiency, a beautiful sound of everything working perfectly. Most of the staff greeted us by name--we don't know how they did it, but they did even though the hotel was fully booked! Even if you only stay one night, do yourself a favor and enjoy the hotel (but don't plan to do much the day you stay since you won't want to leave the hotel!).

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel sits atop a modern office tower, occupying floors 30-36. It is new, modern, and extremely comfortable. My room was quiet, spacious (for Tokyo), and had a very comfortable king size bed. Well organized and a great bathroom with a rain shower. The views are great, especially of the sunrise (combination of jet lag and work back in the US). My room faced the Imperial Palace and beyond to Marunouchi The bar has picture windows behind the bartenders with spectacular city views at night. Service was impeccable as is typical of high end hotels in Tokyo (US hotels can learn something).

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: If there is a competition for the biggest wide bed of hotel in Tokyo, this hotel definitely wins. Getting a King Size bed in Tokyo is not easy already, but getting a 78" wide king size bed and a nice suite and Jacuzzi is definitely making my trip even greater.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel compares favorably to the Mandarin Oriental. I like the location, next to the palace. The rooms are great. Only criticism would be better restaurants. The breakfast buffet is good not great. I ate at the sushi bar and it was so-so.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Loved this hotel.Arrived at 7am and early check in was no problem at all (thank you)The hotel is very new and feels a bit like being on a Star Trek ship. From the beautiful lobby and bar area (which has fantastic views over Tokyo) to the high tech rooms. I could not fault anything.Staff were very friendly (in the unique Japanese way) and helpful. nothing was too hard.Stayed for 3 nights.Expensive but felt it was worth it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hospitality, friendly smiles and excitement to welcome you, not only when you check in, but throughout your stay is how you are greeted. The modern, trendy atmosphere and incredible views of Tokyo are spectacular from the reception area - 36th floor to your room. The room was unbelievably spectacular! The view, comfortable and every modern convenience - you insert your room key to turn everything on - you can't begin to imagine. Prince Gallery staff, the attention to detail is really what makes this establishment 5 stars and then some. If you find yourself in Tokyo, this is where I would love for everyone to experience what caring about your guests is all about.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the Prince Gallery Hotel for 7 nights, in two of the club rooms while in Tokyo.The minute you arrive, the staff are polite and helpful and check-in was fast and efficient. The rooms had massive floor length windows, which you could see amazing views from being 30+ floors up, - you could spend hours looking out! The Club lounge was excellent, with helpful staff and a selection of snacks and drinks. We ate breakfast in the lounge most days, and there was a good section of food and wide choice of pastries to choose from, - even for a picky daughter!One night we ate at the Washoku Souten Restaurant in the hotel. There was a wide selection of sushi as well as other traditional Japanese dishes. The concierge were extremely helpful with anything we needed, including train times and directions, as well as finding us a sumo wrestling match to watch. The hotel is within 5-15 minutes by taxi of the main districts, so you don't need to travel far. There are also two metro stations close by. Overall, the hotel had everything to offer including great food and excellent views! As well as helpful staff. I would highly recommended if you are visiting Tokyo anytime soon!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I stayed in this hotel 3 times but every stay was quite long . In April , I had 10 nights there , and it was the best hotel I ever stayed in Tokyo . Excellent service , good spg recognition, nice lounge , great view , all the rooms are nicely done , location is great too . For the price you have to pay for other 5 star hotels , this one is by far the best . The only things I didn't like , was the elevator transfer and the Japanese breakfast . I had the same Japanese breakfast for 10 days and the buffet choice was very limited.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed in the Prince Gallery Hotel for three nights in April 2017 in one of the King Club Rooms. This modern hotel itself is on the top of a large office building, and navigating the lifts at first can be rather confusing! You go up to reception, and then down to the rooms, which are below reception. Check in was fast and efficient, no mention of my SPG status, but all the points filtered through to my account, as they should.The rooms have big picture windows, and the view from the rooms, which are over 30 floors up, are amazing, - I could sit looking out the window for hours!The Club Lounge was excellent. I often find that Club Lounges are either too formal, or so relaxed it feels like the hotel has forgotten about you! The Club Lounge at the Prince Gallery Hotel strikes exactly the right balance – helpful staff, and excellent food and drinks. It felt like a particularly relaxing and serene part of the hotel.Each morning we had breakfast in the Oasis Restaurant, which had an excellent selection of breakfast items, and a wonderful selection of breads and pastries. Eggs dishes were cooked to order, and were quickly delivered to your table from the kitchen.One evening we ate in the Washoku Souten Restaurant at the hotel, we had a range of sushi’s as well as a couple of hot dishes. The food was superb, but the restaurant was quiet and so lacked a little atmosphere. The tall windows in the restaurant did though provide another outstanding view of Tokyo.The hotel is well connected to the Tokyo metro – both Akasaka-Mitsuke and Nagatacho stations are close by, giving you access to various underground lines to give you good access to the whole of Tokyo, and the surrounding areas.Overall this super modern hotel is outstanding. Outstanding staff, fabulous rooms, with great food and drink (including in the Club Lounge). I would highly recommend this hotel - and next time I am in Tokyo I will definitely be returning to this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My husband and I spent two weeks in Japan and the Prince Gallery was the first stop of our tour. Well, we were not disapointed, the hotel is fantastic with great views of Tokyo from our room. The staff was very attentive and helpful with any request we had. Also, the hotel is in one of the best neighbourhood of Tokyo with the subway being right at the basement of the building. The breakfast was well assorted with everything we needed. The bar at night was a great place to hangout after a full day of walking in town. The hotel is spotless and the rooms being well decorated. I would gladly go back there for my next trip in Tokyo.
user_name:
kimberley l
Saint-Martin, St Martin / St Maarten

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel is extremely fancy! Right from the technology used, toilet seats with censors, to the view from the room. Things I really like about this hotel: 1. Clean, spotless room 2. View (high floor, so you get a fabulous view of Tokyo)3. Technology (you use an ipad to operate the power and curtains)4. Very comfortable bed5. Breakfast - their scrambled eggs are done to perfection! Puts Bill Granger's eggs to shame. :)What I didn't like:1. The censor for the toilet. I jump every time i walk past because it would raise the seat on its own even when you walk past the WC. 2. Their over zealous and perfectionist service. The front desk had forgotten to return me my passport upon checking in at 1am, and they slipped a note under my door asking for me to retrieve it in the morning. Because they are such perfectionists, they were adjusting the note properly on the marble floor of my room from under the door, and i didn't have a clue what that was in the middle night. And since that was my first night and I couldn't really sleep (despite being really tired from a , i freaked out on that sound (that sounded like feet sliding on my floor non-stop). This is a fabulous property but it is also very expensive. I didn't do it enough justice, as I was out the whole day, hence would suggest you stay here if you are spending a quality amount of time in it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I had an excellent stay at the Prince Gallery. I knew it was going to be a great stay because about two months before my arrival, I had wrote to Concierge to help with restaurant reservations. Many of the 5-star hotels do this, but Shinobu Momoi, Chiaki Kimiwada, and Mai Saki really took care of the multiple requests made and made excellent suggestions to improve my suggestion. Once I got there, it was a perfect stay. At check-in, my SPG status was recognized in addition to the benefits via the AMEX FH package. I loved my room. It was well designed, modern, and perfect as a home away from home. During my stay, I really felt like they were really taking care of me. They made good recommendations to help me optimize the trip. They were so helpful when I went to the wrong restaurant (my fault) that they had booked for me - making calls to both restaurants to resolve the issue. Facilities: Sauna is fantastic. Pool looked great. I wish I had used the spa and will use the next time I'm there. I had dinner at the Teppanyaki restaurant. Good but not the best ever. Drinks at the bar were flawless. I really can't wait to go back next year!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We booked our hotel stay here through Starwood as Plantinum guests and we loved this Hotel. Its new, fresh, very nice views from the 36th floor lobby check in. Our upgraded room was simply amazing!!! The view, modern amenities like lighting panels for the draperies, large bathroom with tub and shower (with a view as well). Lovely bar and restaurants. The concierge team was also helpful in setting up our dinner reservations and transportation to Narita. The limo bus was excellent and reasonably priced. Every one as this hotel was helpful. We met the Director of Rooms, Mr, Keisuke Hitomi, and told him ours was one the most beautiful room we have had traveling with Starwood in the world.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The Prince Gallery is very new. It's on the top floors of a new office complex with stunning views from the public areas and all the rooms. My favorite part of the hotel is the amazing indoor pool and the decent fitness area. The locker room also offered a sauna along with hot and cold plunges.At the base of the building, there is retail on the a couple of levels as is typical in Tokyo. (Coffee lovers rejoice: Within that retail complex there is a Starbucks, a Coffee Bean and a Dean and Deluca). That said the retail space is organized in a way that is anything but intuitive. The hotel is well situated in a nice area within about 200 meters of a subway station. There is apparently a tunnel from the hotel to the subway, but we never actually found it because its unmarked. As I say, you are never as lost as you are in Tokyo.The area is clean and pleasant and seems close to a lot of governmental offices. For most travelers, the more important information about it's locations is that the hotel is within a ten minute walk of lively area of Akasaka where you will find hundreds of restaurants and other entertainment options.The thing I liked least is that while one of the hallmarks of Japan is their super respectful service, I never got any real human warmth from any of the hotel staff. Also, the guidance from the concierge was dicey. On three separate occasions, they recommended restaurants and gave us their names and addresses in Roman letters (i.e., how they would be spelled in English.) But no such words appear on the restaurant. On one trip out the taxi driver circled endlessly through Ginza traffic. After retracing himself three times. He let us out and pointed down a alley. Thirty minutes later, we gave us and ate somewhere else (which was pretty awesome by the way).A quick note for Starwood members, they did not acknowledge my Starwood status. When I specifically asked them about potential upgrades or amenities, they instantly told me no upgrades were available. That may have been true, but there was no reason for the chilly delivery of that message and no excuse for not even quickly looking to see if there was something they could do. I think Starwood loyalists will understand why this is atypical of most Starwood properties.Bottom line is that I would consider staying here again, I'd even recommend it; but there was nothing so compelling about the hotel that would make me yearn to return, either.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is my second stay at the Prince Gallery. Excellent stay and highly impressed. The Prince Gallery has noticeably increased its English language speaking staff. Concierge was incredibly helpful with reservations. Conveniently located near metro station and restaurants and cafes and close to business and shopping districts. The views are amazing.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Amazing stay in grand confort and modest luxury (5 nights - during the Tokyo leg of our Japan vacation). The hotel is simply breathtaking, located on floors 30-36 of a fabulous new building. Every contact point was excellent:- Design, decor, smells, cleanliness - were outstanding throughout all areas of the hotel- Room layout, confort, amenities and cityscape view- World class fitness center with excellent equipment and plenty of space- Cool lounge/bar, good drinks and amazing view- All day dining restaurant (Oasis Garden) offers a good menu selection- The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, they went beyond our expectations- The hotel is conveniently located next to Akasaka-Mitsuke metro station providing easy access to all major metro lines. The immediate surroundings provide a green, peaceful environment.You can't go wrong with this hotel, this is a great place to stay, although it does not come cheap! Highly recommended!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Staff so friendly and very helpful. We arrived in Tokyo at the hotel at 7:00am and they were understanding enough to let us have our room. Room is very clean and very comfortable, but the views are just breathtaking. Close to a railway station and their train system is quite good and reasonably priced. Very close to lots of restaurants, Cafe's and some shops.The club lounge was great for breakfast but very disappointing for the rest of the day, otherwise can't complain about anything else.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The Prince Gallery Hotel was the first hotel of our Japan trip. The hotel is beautiful and all is new and high tech. We had club level rooms and the staff there was very friendly, supportive and helpful and breakfast and pre-dinner drinks & food was nice - thank you again! We had forgotten an ipad on the plane and they checked with our airline and organized for it to be delivered to our room for example. The rooms offered splendid views over the city and we could even see the Fujiyama one day when it was a bit more clear. We enjoyed our stay and since the hotel is closely located to a train station it was also easy to get around. There are a number of restaurants etc. near by - so for us the location was good. In the complex of the hotel there is a small shopping center with a number of restaurants and also a Nail Spa (which was great!).The architecture of the bar etc was wonderful - really beautiful and all looked brand new.Only a couple of smaller things that did not work - since we got off a 12 hrs flight we had requested an early check in indicating arrival time around 12. That did not work - we kindly got into one of our rooms at 13.30 but in return the second room was not available until 17.30. No possibility to book any restaurant at the hotel (we could not even get in for lunch / early afternoon) because of the high season - so you really have to plan ahead if you want to eat there.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a new luxury hotel and is beautifully done. The room was spectacular with amazing views from the 35th floor, tastefully furnished in a modern style. The bathroom was incredible, with a large walk-in shower area, glass that turns opaque, and a fabulous Toto toilet that does everything you can imagine. The room temperature, blinds (which were super effective) and lights can all be controlled by a bedside tablet. Service at the hotel was beyond anything we have experienced at any other luxury hotel, with a large staff to guest ratio. Most spoke decent English, and the concierge and front desk staff were extremely helpful and gracious. There are good dining opportunities outside and nearby, as well as a convenience market in a small shopping area below the hotel. Lastly, the location is perfect if you want to be centrally located in Tokyo. The hotel is not inexpensive, but it is worth it and you get what you pay for here.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: the room is great, perhaps the second best(first is Aman), view is great, even better than Ritz but may not as good as Andaz, lounge is best best best,I will come back this summer, and can I have the email of your reservation department? or the email of one of ur GSM?

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Brand new. Rooms are high up (floors 30-36) with magnificent views of Tokyo skyline and the Emperor Palace. Everything bright and modern, service is impeccable and friendly. Terrific gym, spa looked amazing. I did not try the bars, but they do enjoy the same billion yen views. In the room technology rules to a degree that you wish for less buttons. Well designed in timeless elegance and with all the frills of Japanese luxury hotels. Prices are steep even by Tokyo standards. Sorry to say but this beats the Grand Hyatt. Highly recommended if you can spare the change

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My husband and I traveled to Tokyo and treated ourselves the last few nights in town to this hotel. The hotel is absolutely gorgeous, the views are breathtaking and every detail in the room is just spectacular. The service could not be more friendly, the beds couldn't be more luxurious and the amenities are top notch. If you have the opportunity to stay on the club level, it's so worth it. The breakfast is lovely and as a Chef, I found it to be an example in hospitality. This hotel is a great value for the price. You'll be so glad you booked here instead of a large name brand spot. We intially looked at the Park Hyatt, but stayed here instead. So glad we did!! We'll be back!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed in early April 2017 at this gorgeous Prince Gallery Hotel (I had stayed at the Akasaka Prince Hotel at this location in 2000). Everything about the hotel is absolutely enticing - the lobby and two story bar on 36th floor, the Club Lounge and the rooms provide excellent views of Tokyo. The entire staff was highly customer-centric. I want to commend Hitomi-San, Director of Rooms, and Yumi-San (Front Desk) who made our stay enjoyable. This will become my "choice hotel" in Tokyo on future visits. Vishu

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I've stayed in many hotels around the world. I have to say that The Prince Gallery may be the very finest hotel I have ever stayed at. Everything about the hotel is gorgeous; from the views in the bar to the club lounge to the very artwork placed on every floor. The rooms are gorgeous and brilliant. Everything in the room can be controlled from an iPad they provide. The shower/tub combo is awesome, and there is glass around it that can be made opaque with the touch of a button.I honestly cannot think of anything to improve upon. It is not cheap, but it is amazing.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a new hotel that is amazing. It is a part of the Starwood Preferred Luxury Chain. The service is impeccable. The waterfall shower has glass that can be adjusted so that the room is completely transparent to the bedroom and you can see the Tokyo Skyline outside. Electronic everything controlled with an iPad, includingDigital Worldwide Newspapers.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The PGTI is a quite new hotel offering all services you would expect from a modern 5-star hotel. The location is excellent close to Ginza and Maranouchi metro lines (approx. 5 min walking). Check-in was seemless but there is still a lack of SPG elite members. No upgrade or ammenties are offered. Rooms are nevertheless great with very nice views around Tokyo (rooms are floor 30 to 35). Beds are extremly comfortable. The bathroom is divided from the room with glass walls which could be electronically blinded. Standard rooms already provide any comfort needed.Concierge service was good and very friendly.Breakfast offers a wide variety in buffet style plus all the typical Japanese choices. Downside : no kids allowed in the fitness / pool area. (I think this is somewhat outdated and our teens have been really disappointed)Service in the garden oasis restaurant could improve and become much more customer orientated. It was a shame that window tables are constantly not available (all reserved) despite the fact that the restaurant remains completely empty during our lunch. Any extra wishes could not be accomodated. This might not be critical but it differentiates a 5 to a 4 rating

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel itself is very nice. Room is good, overall feel was good. However the Concierge was terrible, one of the worst in 5-star hotels in Tokyo. Concierge is quite critical in Tokyo if you don't speak Japanese. This one happened to botch several of my restaurant reservations in consecutive days. Although they did try hard to rectify, it didn't really help my dissatisfaction. The main issue is that they are really passive in communications and English competency wasn't near the level needed to communicate with the more demanding guests.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: 3 night stay late Feb 2017. Staff was excellent ( special kudos to Mayuki for making us feel very at home; very professional!) as all were attentive, kind, and offering to help at every turn. Room and bathroom were brand new and superior in every respect. View was as good as the Tokyo Tower. Lounge and gym absolutely excellent. Access to metro 3-5 min walk. Very easy. I cannot say enough about my experience at Prince Gallery. This is in my top 3 hotel stays ever. Brian from Los Angeles

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is up there in my list of top hotels that I have stayed in. The hotel itself is very new, which is evident throughout the entire hotel. The room we had was fantastic. Very spacious with absolutely everything we could have wanted. The shower and bath were great. The bedding and linens were all top notch. The views of course are to die for. I really don't think you can have a bad one. We had a west facing room which was great. I used the pool and gym facility once, which was perfect. Sitting in a hot tub with those views is something you don't get to do everyday, and certainly takes your breath. We had access to the club floor facilities which we used everyday for breakfast, and once for afternoon tea. The breakfast was perfect, a very good mix of Western and Asian cuisine. It set us up for a lot of walking in the city. As tourists, I think the hotel was pretty well located. Connected to the subway station, on several lines to get around very easily. My one slightly negative comment would be on the concierge. We asked for help every night for dinner recommendations. We felt that the options they gave us quite limited. They didn't really have a list of recommendations to give us. A small point, but it would have helped as I always like to rely on concierge to get the best dinner recommendations in the city I am visiting. Overall, a fantastic hotel that I would highly recommend and go back to visit again and again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I had the pleasure of staying at the new Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho hotel in Tokyo for a week in late February when I came to run the Tokyo Marathon. Asian hotels are known for their incredible service and luxury, but the Prince Gallery took my stay to a new level. As my car from the airport drove up to the hotel, I was quickly greeted by staff members that knew my name (they obviously had pulled up my photo form the internet) and quickly ushered me to the elevator. They said my bags would be brought directly to the room. As I exited the elevator, the manager, Mr. Hetome, greeted me with another staff member. After taking a quick imprint of my credit card and copy of my passport, they ushered me into one of the most beautiful suites I have stayed in while visiting a major city. The suite was on the top floor and had sweeping views of most of Tokyo. In addition to two beautiful bathrooms, there was a livingroom/diningroom along with a huge bedroom with large seating area with floor to ceilings windows with a spectacular view of the city. The suite was probably 2000 square feet that was all well appointed with tastefully decorated furniture and state of the art electronics and sound system. An iPad next to the bed controlled everything, including the 3 lawyers of drapes, the lighting, temperature and audio/visual system. A butler came to my room and assisted me with unpacking as well as folding and pressing my clothing. After I was unpacked, I took a shower in the most spectacular bathroom I have been in. In addition to having an incredible view, the bathroom had a TV and lots of other amenities (brushes, shaver, selection of soaps and creams, etc.). The bathrooms both had the high end, fully electronic Toto toilet. After cleaning up I went down to the Club Lounge. Probably the nicest Club Lounge I have ever been in. In addition to having a super premium liquor selection, there was Moët Champagne for free along with a wonderful selection of food and desserts. One could actually eat all their meals in the Club Lounge. The breakfast was extraordinary.The service at the hotel was fantastic. Everyone knew my name and was very helpful. The fitness center/pool/spa was the nicest I have ever been in. In the men's locker room they had a full spa with baths and tubs overlooking the Emperors Palace. I highly recommend the Prince Gallery Tokyo. I have stayed at the Park Hyatt and the Palace (same owner as the Prince Gallery) and they don't compare. The Prince Gallery is super exclusive, very comfortable and provides the highest level of service you can find anywhere in the world. For a frequent traveler like me to be so impressed, the hotel had to be off the charts.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We had a stunning view out to Mt Fuji (on a clear day). The room was great, the glass walled bathroom was nice and you click a switch and it becomes privately screened. We used the pool and gym each day - really gorgeous facilities. The cocktail bar was fabulous at night, lovely ambience and friendly. Great location, so close to the subway and across the road from a good shopping district. Room was very quiet. Can highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We had a really enjoyable stay, luxurious room with great amenities: ipad controlled lights, curtains, etc. Good wifi, bed was huge and comfy. Breakfast was great with options for Japanese traditional breakfast, buffet, American and Continental breakfast.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel is beautiful but really pricey. We checked in with a little bit of confusion. As we passed over our passports, they said they couldn't find our reservation. I pulled up my confirmation and they seemed surprised that the hotel was in my name vs my husbands (I also noticed after check in, they changed the room to my husbands name. We had to ask they change it back...I didn't want to loose the points on my account by causing confusion). After we got through that, they recognized my Platinum SPG status right away. They did give us complementary access to the club lounge but were not able to upgrade our room. Our room did have an amazing view though so, I am not sure we cared. The room does have some cool shading features for the bathroom for privacy. The cleaning staff didn't leave a spec of dirt anywhere. The kimono robes were also a pretty cool touch for the hotel to provide. Access to the lounge was amazing. Must get the chef's egg each morning. It is amazing. There is a really great selection for breakfast and tea. We also appreciated an evening cocktail there. There service was also great. The spoke excellent English as I believe they are trying to cater to the business crowd. The hotel is located near the subway station making it really easy to get anywhere you need to go. The lobby bar was a frustration to us. We ordered 2 drinks that were close to $50US dollars...they also charged us a cover charge that was about $20 US dollars. It was removed once we complained but I still couldn't tell why it was so expensive. Because of this, we avoided the restaurants there (we didn't want to go through the efforts of getting charges like this removed). TIP: There are a few other restaurants in the building that speak fluent English and are reasonably priced.Overall, the hotel is beautiful and spotless. While it is pricey, I would stay there again if I was in the area even know it is geared to business travelers.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Friendly ,sophisticated helpful staff ,FULL recognition of our platinum life status !!!!!!Very knowledgeable,professional and patient concierge service .Everything fresh,new,high quality .Lounge with best food breakfast and evening food ,made in on site kitchen.Gym /spa professional .100% cleanliness everywhere.We will be back !Top location for metro use and exploring of tokyo ,walking distance to imperial palace.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Always the best! Was there with my family & twin brother for the holidays. Was surprised by the staff that they still recognized us from an earlier November trip. Hands down in food, bar & simply relaxation.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My girlfriend and I spent one night at the Prince Gallery and it was a wonderful experience. The staff is great, very cordial and most helpful. The concierge staff was also outstanding: when I booked the stay few months ago, I contacted the concierge staff to get help securing a reservation at a high end restaurant, which they did. The room itself was great, with s very comfortable bed. The bathroom was awesome, expecially the shower/bath area, had one of the best shower of my life, water pressure was great! Didn't have the chance to try the restaurants by the look great, especially the bar liking over a suggestive view of Tokyo from above. Would definitely come back, awesome stay!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Hotel is new and its really great value for the price range.Staff are very friendly and lounge is great, serves high quality SAKEBar at also amazing being high up you enjoy great view of Tokyo All round.There is a mall and train station just below the hotel so its convenient tooGreat for Business and Couples getaway.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I couldn't recommend this property enough. The service was outstanding, the room was modern and immaculate, and the hotel itself is centrally located, and near several subway stations. This just may be the finest hotel I have ever had the privilege to visit.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Hotel and staff were superb. If you don't speak Japanese, it is critical to have an attentive concierge to help with plans. I was very impressed with the thoughtfulness and knowledge of the staff. The club lounge was nicely appointed with a beautiful view and excellent food and drink. Breakfast was particularly well done with custom eggs of restaurant quality.Room was elegant and spacious. Gym was brand new and with latest equipment. I very much liked the mini onsen. I recommend this hotel for business or pleasure travel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I really enjoyed my recent business stay at this hotel: My room was stylish, comfortable, quiet, and in outstanding condition and had a great view of the imperial palace. All the facilities were in great shape (incl. a very good gym with a great view). The food in the SPG lounge was very good, service was exceptionally attentive (and very formal). Room service was expensive (as is to be expected in Tokyo) but of good quality.If I had one criticism of this hotel (and its a minor one) it is that it doesn't have much personality, almost feels a bit aseptic. But I'm definitely planning to come back.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My son and I recently spent some time in Tokyo, we stayed in three ultra-high end hotels. Of the three properties the service at Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho was head and shoulders above the rest. I have stayed at many high-end properties and worked with many different concierges over the years. I can say without hesitation that the concierge team at Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho were the finest I ever worked with. I contacted them before my stay and asked them about a number of activities that were not the standard fare. They researched all my ideas, asked me questions and set up a number of options for me, each carefully presented with photographs, maps and all estimated costs considered. Finally they made all the arrangements (including a last minute date change). They considered every detail. All the arrangements went flawlessly. Their incredible service continued throughout my stay. I felt like I had my own team of personal assistants. I plan on returning to this hotel for the service alone!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a wonderful property. The Metro is just across the street. Very easy to get to. The room had a top 5 decor for me especially the bathroom. The lobby and reception are on the 36th floor and the rooms are below that. This is the Top of the line for a Prince property and not to be compared to the more everyday 3star level of the Prince Brand.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I just stayed here for a night on the way back from a ski week as a bit of a treat before flying home. It just wasn't worth it. It feels way too corporate, lacking any character and is way too overpriced for what it is. The entrance is beneath a huge office building - you kind of arrive via an underground carpark. The hotel itself occupies a few floors at the top of this large building. I paid over $600/night (which was a heavily discounted rate) and still breakfast wasn't included nor was a swim in the pool! The swanky bar doesn't have a great view once you're sitting down. The whole thing just feels over the top yet wrong. There are staff everywhere in stiff outfits doing what they can to make you feel special, as if they're trying to find ways to justify the price with what you actually get. The room itself was spacious and nicely done. However again, with no charm. All a bit cold and corporate. Never again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: First of all, here are easy directions taking trains from Narita. Take the Narita Express (3,020 Yen) to Tokyo Station. Take the Maronouchi line (red) to Akasaka Misui station, just a handful of stops (about 10 minutes, 170 Yen). Take exit 10 D. Upon exiting the station, just cross the river and the hotel is across the street.Overall this hotel is amazing. It is under a year old and feels it. The location is very central, just a few station stops from either Shibuya or Shinjuku. The area around the hotel is more business-oriented, but there are a few streets rowdy with sushi and noodle shops, bars and pizza places just over the bridge. The hotel is in a complex with a Coffee Bean and Dean & Deluca. The lobby of the hotel is on the 36th floor with a bar that looks like it's out of Emerald City in Oz. The rooms are spiffy, relatively spacious for Tokyo and very modern. Most controls in the room are operated by an iPad next to the bed, although there is a luddite-ready box on the other side of the bed that just requires hitting buttons. Room service is also on the iPad. Neato.My room had a huge bath and overhead shower, surrounded by glass that can be muted with the push of a button. The star of the room is the window, which comes with a couch built into the frame, where you can lay and look 35 stories below. Much of my time was spent working on my laptop, just gazing out. The bed was huge and comfortable. The massive TV had a wired sound system that was top notch. The inclusion of an easy-to-bluetooth Bose Soundlink portable speaker in the room gets big points. The wifi is very strong.The staff is beyond helpful, very white-glove service. I made mention that I needed to find an ATM and by the time the elevator had landed on the bottom floor, someone from the hotel was there to direct me to one. English speakers will have no problems at all, very international vibe.I did not get any kind of SPG upgrade. SPG was not even really advertised or mentioned inside the hotel.A couple of downsides: The website doesn't have a contact email if you have any questions in advance (which is why I posted airport directions). The hotel pool is only available for free to club level/suite guests and costs 5,000 Yen to other guests, which is a shame.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I stayed at The Prince Gallery for 10 days for a holiday. I was looking for a modern 5 star hotel. This fit the profile perfectly. The hotel is centrally located and walking distance to the subway system.This hotel has an amazing sense of arrival. The views from the lobby are spectacular. You truly get a sense of the vastness and megapolis that Tokyo truly is. Their is a fragrance in the hotel lobby that makes you feel you have entered a spa. If this is intentional, great job guys.The breakfast room is large and you can walk around to get complete 360 degree views of the city. The breakfast buffet lacks in variety, especially in terms of Japanese food choices. You need to provide more local food options in order for me to feel that I am not having a generic 5 star breakfast. The staff attending guests can also be slightly more attentive and quick to serve guests.The rooms are luxurious and the views from the room are fantastic. The shampoo, body wash and hand cream are all top quality. I would improve the quality of the shaving razor, which is very poor and rough on your skin. The room is brimming with all the latest technology/ toys and the internet is fast. I loved the kimonos provided to sleep in.POOL - This is my biggest complaint and only reason to give the hotel 4 stars. They charge you around US$50 per person to use the swimming pool. I have never before been charged for using a swimming pool at any luxury hotel in the world. I am not writing this here to stop anyone from booking and staying at this property. It is merely to highlight this ridiculous policy to Starwood and the Hotel. Please change this policy.I would like to give a special mention to the Director of Rooms Mr. Keisuke Hitomi. He was very friendly, helpful and veritably made my stay a truly memorable experience. If it was not for him I would not have rated my stay so highly. Thank you again Prince Gallery for the experience and best of luck.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Great hotel in a good location. Spacious rooms with great views. Staff are helpful and are always will to please. Breakfast buffet the eggs are cooked to order and everything else is plentiful, varied and delicious. Love the hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My husband and I stayed two nights in the Club Level room last December. This new 5 star hotel is just excellent. The room is super high tech and everything is controlled with iPad in the room. Just about everything in this hotel is perfect! The only thing I'd change is the wine selection at the lounge. Akasaka is one of the most convenient places in Tokyo to base yourself as you can get to almost anywhere in Tokyo directly from nearby Akasaka-Mitsuke/Nagatacho subway station ( 5 lines available there.) There are hundreds of great restaurants, izakayas and bars in downtown Alaska as well. I've stayed at almost all 5 star hotels in Tokyo and this one is one of my very favorites now.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: After skiing in a nearby resort, we stayed at The Prince Gallery Tokyo for 3 days with our 2 children before going back to Hong Kong, China. We stayed in a corner suite and our children in an interconnecting twin room on 34/F. The rooms are very spacious by Tokyo standards. The corner suite is about 800 sq ft and the other one is about 400 sq ft. The suite has a stunning view of the city and a big and impressive wet room in the bathroom. It was most enjoyable, after a long day of shopping, to take a shower with a view! The breakfast buffet was sumptuous. The food in their signature Japanese restaurant was quite expensive but very delicious. If you do not want to eat in the hotel, there are plenty of restaurants and a convenient store on the basement level. The underground station is only a short walk away. We understand that the hotel is only a few months old and everything is like brand new.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My second time in this hotel. Service is close to immaculate and food at the restaurants are very well prepared. This hotel is only 7 months old and under its old name (Akasaka Prince) it was already well known to locals. I'm happy that SPG has added this to its Tokyo portfolio.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Held an important client event in Oasis Garden at The Prince Gallery - roughly 25 attendees. Superb. The hotel has been open for roughly 7 months and is part of the Marriott/St.Regis luxury hotel collection. The facilities are first-class, as-are the staff; everyone incredibly friendly and efficient. The hotel staff were particularly helpful working with our Firm's marketing staff to ensure our clients were well taken-care-of. Food is superb; several courses very well-sequenced. I learned from several Tokyo colleagues that in a very short period of time The Prince Gallery has established an enviable reputation. It is sure to be a destination in the future.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: What a fantastic hotel! We read some of the mixed reviews before going there and did not know what to expect. In the end, we liked it so much that we even cancelled our subsequent reservation at the Park Hyatt to stay at the Prince Gallery a bit longer.Rooms are ultra-modern, with iPad controls, window seating to watch the 360 degree skyline and a fantastic bath/shower combination. Service was great and helpful, e.g. we had a lot of fun calling the downstairs pharmacy together with the concierge. There is a lounge for SPG Platinum members which you should definitly visit for pre-dinner drinks & snacks. We also tried the top floor restaurant, which has great breakfast but poor value for money in the evenings. Instead, better to sit at the bar and enjoy drinks & view.Location is great as well. There is a metro station 2min from the hotel entrance, from where you can reach most of downtown within 10-20min. And I can really recommend to explore the neighborhood, which has some nice architecture and restaurants.All in all, it was a great stay and will definitly go there again the next time I'm in Tokyo!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Hard product is grade A throughout: brushed metal, leather, marble everywhere and seemingly not a single non-Schott Zwiesel glass in the hotel. The style is quite masculine and very modern. The blackout blind is the best I've ever seen (you almost can't tell if it's daytime or not with it closed). My room was facing the Imperial Palace and The Skytree, which I think the hotel considers to be the second best 'side' after the Tokyo Tower view one. All sides seem to have a good view though.Service was mostly excellent, attentive but fairly formal. This hotel feels more 'Japanese' than many of the international chains in Tokyo.A few small-ish nit picks. Checking in with FHR was a bit strange. I made a point of calling Amex beforehand to check that the Deluxe King Room upgraded into a Club one. No mention of FHR benefits or upgrade was made at check in other than being handed the USD 100 food and beverage voucher and so after the attendant offered to show me to my room I asked if any upgrade was available given I had booked through FHR. I was asked to take a seat and after a little while was told I could have a 'nice corner room' if I took twin beds instead of a king. On getting to the room it seemed to be indistinguishable from the standard Deluxe Twin, other than being the room next to the suite on the corner. Perhaps I was upgraded to a Club Twin Room without club access? FHR credit must be used in a single sitting. I used mine for a meal in the main restaurant and whilst the starter (millefeuille of scallops) and pudding (Tiramisu affogato-style) were both wonderful, the main course venison burger was merely OK. I've had better for less than half the price in London. The lack of freshly squeezed orange juice with breakfast was also a bit surprising. Breakfast seems to finish at 10am in the main restaurant even on a Saturday.The Levita bar is physically impressive but I think the drinks still need work. I had the Fuzei and it was really very good, but the other two cocktails I had were just not bad. For somewhere that prices itself as one of the most expensive hotel bars in Tokyo (seems to be a c.15-20% premium to, say, the Andaz rooftop bar) I think they needed to be better.All-in-all then a very good stay, with a little bit of work it could be a contender for one of the very best in Tokyo. I'm already looking at booking my next stay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Move over Grand Hyatt! No, I still love you but there is a younger more exciting hotel. Meet The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho.This is a very new hotel, genuinely 5 star and while you do need to pay 5 star room rates it is worth considering. Pros:- Super new. Rooms are very modern and spacious for Tokyo. Everything can be controlled from the iPad.- Great views given the hotel is located at the top of an office block. Great to relax on the day bed (think W Hotel Taipei for those that have been there)- Club lounge, although small, had top quality food choices. That egg, truffle and jamon for breakfast was stunning- Quality of food at all the restaurants were very high but actually there are heaps of restaurant choices in this building. - Japanese service at its best. Great staff all around.- Very well trained housekeeping - immaculate each time, particularly at turn down service.Cons:- I loved the quality of the food but honestly, some of the food was very pricey, even for a 5 star hotel- Location is fine for me but for those in Tokyo for tourism, there are some better located hotels. It is super close to two subway stops though.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We loved the modern and luxurious accommodations, friendly and helpful staff, and convenient location. The hotel is situated in a relatively tranquil part of Tokyo, yet super close to subway stations with connections to most main lines. We will come back to stay for future visits, if only to experience the shower room. Thank you, Prince Gallery, for a lovely time!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Visiting this venue as bar owner puts into context that you can always do things better, but their better is on a different planet. I ate here 3 times and they were the best meals. The whisky lounge was stunning - 3 mixologists were Diageo 1st class finalists, that is insane! The experience was so good that my friend and I felt like we had been at a Spa - a must!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights and lived every second of it. As it's new obviously the decor etc is pristine. The rooms are very spacious and really well laid out, great views and all the mod cons you could expect in a 5 star hotel.Staff were amazing, really helpful at every interaction. Superb bar with amazing city views.I only ate breakfast in the hotel but this too was to a really high standard. Whilst I stayed there for work I would definitely go back on my own time.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed three nights and had an amazing experience. We got engaged while staying at the hotel and the staff helped make it an even more special experience. The technology in the room was top notch and our view was spectacular. The staff was very warm and very helpful whenever needed. We liked the hotel so much that we changed our plans to stay again in a week.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I found this property to be amazing. Great location I felt for Tokyo the prices were good al although at times there is a speaking English issues with certain staff, but they really try the ones where there English is not good. Overall the staff are extremely attentive and very quaint property. I as a Platinum member highly recommend it.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I travel for work and stay in many hotels through the course of the year. This place takes the cake regards the quality and service of any hotel I've stayed inThe service from the front desk of checking me in to the concierge tracking down a sake I wanted to buy, the attention to making your experience as unique as possible was impressive. Now the room... that's the crown jewel! From fully automated lights, toilet seats, to iPad control, the whole room is top notch! There's no need to even turn on the TV when you have the incredible views in front of you! In case you're traveling with friends, just note... the showers are one of "those" showers with glass all around, but no worries, a touch of a button will turn them opaque! Only downside as mentioned in order reviews is the lack of access to a pool or spa area. All that's extra costs sadly. Cannot wait to return and to enjoy the hotel again!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Three night stay, young Asian American couple with one toddler, English speaking. SPG Platinum booked at a high holiday rate, no upgrades. Location - Taxis don't seem to know where this property is. The port cochere is buried deep in a parking garage. Google maps currently shows the construction of the building bc it is so new. We found the easiest way was to access the hotel via Subway as the building is directly connected to the Nanboku line. To access other lines, like the Ginza, Marunochi, and Hanzomon lines, you need to either cross the street or follow the underground signs. We found that even though it was relatively easy (surprisingly especially after all the not to bring a stroller to Japan) this was the only subway station we had trouble with pushing a stroller. It required us to exit the building, walk across the street to take an elevator back underground. Rooms - Excellent, all new technology with full room automation controls. Great shower/bath combo room. High pressure/flow fixtures. Toto Washlet toilet in Water Closet - motion sensor light, and auto open lid. Bathroom amenities included bath salts, body scrub cloths and sponges. Beds were comfortable, and HVAC was seamless/quiet. Best part was full iPad control of all room features, as well as communication to services. We were able to text message housekeeping for requests, concierge, and also front desk. I requested a Humidifier from their drop down list, and 2 people came within 5 min to set it up. Turn down service included macaroons, and 3 staff members at your door. Top notch service. Dining - With SPG-P, we had breakfast every morning at the Club Lounge. Not a large lounge, but well appointed. Small buffet, but excellent selection and quality. The crispy bacon not to be forgotten, as it just melted in your mouth. To order Egg choices are delicious and properly made. Conclusion - I'm not sure if we really maximized our dollar here. We spent a pretty penny, but found ourselves enjoying the city for most of the day. It's comforting to be welcomed back everyday to the hotel, with a staff member greeting you at every corner, all the way from the port cochere up to the 36th floor lobby. The art, the views, the smells, the elevators, all 5 star. However at the $500/nt mark, you begin to wonder if this luxury hotel in an office building is just an oasis, or really a place you can call home for a few days. My wife and I could not decide if we'd come back or not, there are so many other luxury hotels in better locations. However on our last night, we stumbled upon an amazing Yakiniku place in Akasaka (neighborhood across the street) called KINTAN. You MUST get the Sukiyaki - to die for. We will return to Japan just to have that again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: First of all, I had high expectation to this Prince hotel since it is now the Prince hotel in Japan at its highest rank. However, its low recognition of SPG status does upset me. With my Platinum status as well as using the Suite Night Award together with my record of staying in four different Prince hotels in this trip, they still do not decide to upgrade my room. Frankly, if the hotel could frankly state that upgrade can only be done from a certain type of room, I think it makes me easier to follow. Instead of waiting for months for the SNA, I could know earlier whether I would get the upgrade or if I want to pay more for the designated type of room in order to get a further upgrade.Another thing that disappointed me is the mailing service. I am certain the Concierge lady understands what I am saying here since I was very disturbed by the fact that the Concierge asked me to sign a credit card slip without putting the amount at the time of checking out because they said they do not know the postage until the parcel is sent to the Post Office. For frequent travelers to Japan, we all know that hotels at this level all provide the service of mailing parcels for their customers. The Concierge only need to follow the instruction sheet provided by the Japan Post with indications of size of parcel. Postage to each country is clearly listed according to the sending method and weight. The Post Office will come to the hotel to collect and confirm the postage, but it does not mean nothing is done by the Concierge after I passed the parcel and completed form to the hotel until I checked out. Not even someone told me that the parcel is still unsent until I asked about the postage I should pay. This is quite a surprisingly ridiculous act. I was told on the phone after calling Prince One that I can send down the parcel to the Concierge anytime and they will tell me the postage. Apparently, that's not what happened.There are, however, many good sides about the hotel. The sushi lunch I had in Souten on 24 Dec was greater than great. They serve with great professionalism. The Christmas dinner I had in the Classic House is another pleasant dining experience. The Club Lounge has a marvelous view over Tokyo and the cocktail hours offer enjoyable moments.I do hope the management would pay more attention to foreign customers with good record and loyalty. These are the customers who will repeatedly visit your property, in Japan and in other countries. The Prince Gallery is a gorgeous property and deserves everyone work hard in it to keep up the reputation and serve loyal customers who appreciate your brand that would last for years of patronage.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We spent two nights at Prince Gallery, and it's the best hotel I have ever visited. Our room was great with a view of Mount Fuji. Everything is very modern, and control panel via an iPad in the room. The hotel staff is extremely attentive, the concierge went out of their way to arrange our requests, and finally, the breakfast was great. I did not try the Japanese breakfast and did not have time to try the gym/heated pool. I highly recommend this hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel is impeccably designed - from the moment you enter the property there is a lovely, clean smell. The lobby is on the 26th floor, and offers a spectacular view of Tokyo. The service is excellent - polite and always at the ready. The room was very impressive - a comfortable bed, huge TV, wonderful bathroom with a fantastic soaking tub and both overhead and directed showers. Counter space in the bathroom was limited (especially if you are traveling as a couple). The real show stopper was the view - almost full floor to ceiling window with a lovely and comfortable window nook to stretch out and read - or gaze at the city below. We loved the view and the way it was presented. Some negatives: the hotel is very sleek and modern, and there are no "Japan touches". From the moment you enter the hotel, you could be anywhere in the world - there is nothing to remind you that you are in Japan. Breakfast was not included, which is a bit frustrating at these prices. My main complaint is that we paid more than US $500 per night for a standard room, but to use the hotel pool we would have had to pay an extra US $45 (!), per person, each day. To me that is unacceptable (both as a regular swimmer and on principle), and will probably be the reason I will seek a different hotel when I return to Tokyo given the myriad of options.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Our first visit to Prince and we were blown away. The service, the meticulous attention to detail and the room and property themselves. And for the price they charge, i would say it's a steal for a 5 star hotel. I have absolutely no qualms about staying here again. Great job people.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
