review_body: I believe this is the newest luxury hotel in Tokyo as the hotel has just in operational for a few months and most of the reviews are very positive and this is the reason I take the opportunity to spend 4 nights (2 rooms ) with my family.The minute when you arrived the hotel, you are served immediately by the hotel staffs and you don't have to worry about anything since you will be escorted by individual hotel staffs to lead you to check-in and to be shown to your hotel rooms.Rooms are specious (compare to others in the city of Tokyo) and views are excellent since the hotel rooms are all on very high floors (from 31-36 floors)The only comment that most guests will make is you have to reach the lobby level on 36th floor before you can change another elevator to your rooms unless you are staying at the lobby level on the 36th floor.the hotel building provides a big selection of good restaurants that serve not only traditional Japanese food but also a good choice of Western food.The location is excellent since you are literally near to two sub-way stations.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel was only recently opened. Rooms offer every amenity and have sweeping views of the city. Our room afforded views over the Imperial Palace grounds. There is a subway station effectively connected to the hotel's lower levels making transportation convenient. Great place to stay.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: No doubt one of the best. Rooms are big go Japan hotels. Service excellent and quality in detail extraordinary. Love the views and the location no bad too. The bar is outstanding and the design of modern minimalistic with just the perfect amount of Japanese touches. Highly recommended

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Unbeknownst to me, this hotel opened in July 2016, and it is still brand new and shiny. The staff practically fall over themselves to help (despite some English language impediments), but the location, service, rooms and views put this hotel so far into the stratosphere I can hardly believe it. Maybe my expectations just weren't high enough and I was over delivered on an exceptional two-night stay, but this was one of the most glitteringly beautiful hotels I've ever stayed in.The rooms were huge (by almost any city's standards), the amenities top notch—the same, in fact, as I received at the St. Regis in San Francisco. The Toto toilet was a marvel of engineering and Japanese fastidiousness, and the panoramic views through the single, enormous window in the room was hard to move away from.The shower was huge and contemporary and sleek with plush, push towels, toiletries including lufa sponge, a personal washcloth (yep, a personal washcloth), two bottles of water a day, Nespresso maker, tea kettle, sleek white enameled panelling...I could go on and on, but suffice it to say this is a contemporary jewel in Tokyo's crown. About 15 minute cab ride from the Ginza, and only a 10 minute cab ride from Hamamatsu-cho train station (accessed directly from Haneda via the Monorail), I couldn't have been happier with this choice.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: As others have commented, this new hotel is superior to other Prince and Starwood-affiliated hotels in the City, and does almost everything perfectly. Views from the spacious windows are impressive. Check-in staff was excellent and helpful in securing a reservation at a desired restaurant close to closing time. Exit the elevator to your floor and you find varied sculptures recessed into the walls in front of you, along with different scents infused into the hallway air. Once in the room you have to use your key to activate the lights. Bedside control panels set varied moods and control most lights individually or in sets. Shower is oversized and its opaque feature is a cool touch whose absence is a turn-off at the many hotels with glass showers facing off to the sleeping area. TV is huge, though using the channel up.down buttons were the only issues I had in my room. Bed was US King or larger, and was insanely comfortable. Lounge offered a full breakfast including eggs to order, smoked salmon, fruits, breads, pastries, etc. More suited to Western than Eastern tastes. While only spent one night, their afternoon spread included more pastries, chocolates, small cakes. And of course a variety of beverages, including sakes, several beers and wine. Spent about an hour at the 31st floor pool/health club, with complimentary access for Platinum SPG/Marriott members, and bathing suits available (for a small fee) if you didn't bring one of your own. Everything again had impressive floor-to-ceiling views of the city. A short walkway from the pool entry has sensors that activate 5 overhead shower heads to walk beneath, providing a warm "wash-off" before getting into the pool Pool was comfortably warm, and the oversized spa pool was hot without scalding, and large bench areas all around. The mens locker area had a sauna, a smaller hot tub, and an accompaying cold tub, as well as traditional asian bathing benches and western showers. All had nice toiletry products.All in all, a wonderful one-night stay. Close proximity to 2 subways make for easy transport, and large gardens nearby. While I didn't explore much, our dinner in Rappongi was about 10mins by cab. While I'd traditionally stay in the Conrad when able, this may be my new go-to property in Tokyo.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I've been in this hotel for visiting Tokyo. It's very good hotel.it has 2 metro stations near. The view was very good, and the size of the room perfect too. The people is very amazing and helps in what you need. It's little expensive.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Best stay ever in Tokyo, facilities are simply amazing esp. the highly automated features of my/3314 room & bathroom. Reception staff perfect. The Bar is excellent, good service from Mr John of Uzbekistan! Will be back around 2nd week of December. Thank you.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The best "Prince" hotel among it's many branch locations in Tokyo. Panoramic views from the hotel's 36th floor lobby and restaurants. The hotel is located on the towers 30 - 36th floors and has some great views of the Palace and other Tokyo landmarks.Check-in: Pop up to the 36 floor sky lobby and check in takes a few minutes. All of the rooms are located below 36 in a separate elevator bank - like the Mandarin Oriental in Vegas... a bit time consuming - but quick.Room: 400+ sq ft of sparkling new build out. Large window that creates a framed sky-view of the city. HUGE California King bed with very nice sheets and comforter. Massive TV - although the remote control was weak at best. Tons of electronic controls, ample closet space, safe, mini-bar, ironing board, blow dryer, desk etc. Huge window has a built in seat / cushions that let you lean your head right up against the window to get the view. Reminded me of Bladerunner look on one rainy night.Bathroom: Modern, Sleek, new. Combined Shower/ Tub room - enclose in glass cube that has view of bedroom and window. 1 flick of a switch and it becomes opaque to avoid anyone peeping into your 30+ story room from a surrounding skyscraper. Typical "Star Trek" asian toilet and nice shampoo/ conditioner assortment. Thick towels.Restaurants: Only tried the hotels' breakfast buffet on the 36th floor - great views, wide assortment of food options - but 39K Yen - so not cheap. Lots of alternative restaurants in the public space on floors 2 - 4 (Japanese, Chinese, Korean, Seafood, etc. etc.) and much, much cheaper.Location: Central Tokyo - blocks to the Palace and close to public transportation, shopping etc.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I have been in Japan such amazing country wonderful people prince gallery hotel one of the new hotel in Tokyo from the moment the taxi drop you until the moment you leave the hotel in your last day I assure you that your experience in this hotel is different from other hotel in the world for me I give 100% the receptions staff every single day for 8 days they will run to you when you step out from the taxi to greet you and get the left ready for you the room is fully advanced technology I just can't explain it so amazing I never seen A room like that in my life the staff very very well groomed very polite more than excellent the hotel concierge she was just more than beautiful and excellent customer service she went beyond her job to help us every day regarding tour around Tokyo The view from the room you can see Tokyo over all I have no enough words to describe my experience for me I will always be the best hotel in ever been And I didn't think I will find other hotel with same quality as prince gallery hotel I had the best vacation in Japan amazing hotel at final if you planing to visit Tokyo you have to stay in prince gallery hotel this hotel went beyond the excellent customer service and hospitality thank you prince gallery hotel for your efforts and made my stay memorable

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: So happy we stayed here. The hotel is very modern, clean and beautiful. Don't think twice if you want a decent sized room that is luxurious. The staff is also ver friendly and attentive. They are they to help with anything.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Now this is a hotel. Ushered into the skyscraper by a discreet entrance, sliding doors open to your hallway. Room is perfect, bed, bathroom, incredible views. IPad was a bit wonk. Bath window goes opaque with a touch. Nespresso machine in room. Service was impeccable. Bar was killer as well. Top shelf all the way.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at the Prince Gallery for two nights on a recent trip to Tokyo and I was absolutely impressed. The property is stunning (it is brand new) and service outstanding.We stayed in one of their corner suites with an absolutely amazing view of Tokyo. The design, furniture, decoration of the room were excellent, the bathroom larger than most average rooms in Tokyo and well equipped.Service at the club lounge was great, fantastic breakfast buffet (their signature egg dish was out of this world), great afternoon tea and very good evening snacks and drinks. Service was fantastic, just like everywhere else at the hotel.The location is great too and everything either a short hop away by taxi or subway. In the mall downstairs one can find some great restaurants for lunch and dinner. I would definitely return again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I am SPG platinum...had high expectation from this new property...average stay. Lounge is good - overall feels like a new built of westin Ebisu...so not a luxury collection. Technology is modern...and views are good.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: I tried the Prince Galeria for the first time, honestly because literally ever other hotel I normally stay at in Tokyo was booked solid. The rooms are really nice and the hotel is very modern. I only had one meal there in the Japanese restaurant and the sushi was a little disappointing (though the amazing view helped negate my dissatisfaction somewhat). The staff here seemed to be really good though, and the check in staff and the concierge in particular were super helpful.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: first of all, i must praise the staff of this hotel, no matter the bell desk, front desk or restaurant staff, they are all very willing to help. but this is the only good thing to praise. for a hotel at this price range, guest rooms must be nice, that is expected. i stayed there last week for 3 nights on business trip, my first impression was very TROUBLESOME. hotel front desk located on 36th floor, i needed to take an elevator from the 2nd floor to 36th floor first, but guest rooms are on 30th-35th floors, that means, after check-in, i needed to take another elevator go "down" to my room. imagine if you needed to go up and down lots of times everyday from ground to front desk and then to your room (or vice versa), how troublesome and tiring that can be!! in addition, room card is required to open a door access to the lift lobby to 30th-35th floors, okay... that's normal. however, the troublesome part is, when it reached my floor, room card is needed again to open another door between lift lobby and guest rooms corridor! hotel staff said that's for the guests privacy, but i doubted who needed that level of privacy except hollywood stars (or those guys staying with their mistresses?)by the way, i almost forgot, free wifi (in my room) speed was very slow. i know that doesn't sound reasonable, but that was true. i couldn't stand that and had to use my mobile roaming which is much faster!actually there are some guest rooms located on the 36th floor, next time if i "have to" stay in this hotel again, i will ask hotel reservations to confirm my room must on 36th floor, otherwise i will stay somewhere else. with that much of money that i was paying, i have plenty of choices.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel is in a quieter part of town on a nice sunny hilltop. Follow the directions and the hotel is easy to find from the correct subway exit. The huge windows in lobby area had awesome views. And the lobby wasn't super busy and crowded so it seemed more peaceful. Same great views upon entering guestroom. Was lucky, I suppose, not having overcasting days during my stay. Loved the window seat but best of all was the blackout shade. I wouldn't have woken up without my alarm clock, the room was so dark and bed so comfy. And the windows were really pretty quiet (heard couple emergency vehicles) and heard nothing from neighbors or from hallway. Gym is fairly standard, has the pulley machine thing in a private training studio. Pool fee waived for certain room categories and SPG status. My main complaint is there is so much technology in the room (iPad controls too) that there's a gazillion things glowing at night. The light control panel, the thermostat, light switch at door entry and bathroom. Would be nice if there was a low glow setting or cover. I ended up covering stuff up with pillows and other light blocking objects. Need key for elevator and to enter guest floors. Keep the toilet room door closed or it senses motion from the sink area and keeps waking up. Dinner was fairly quiet, nice night views over the city. Enjoyed a leisurely two-hour breakfast and wasn't rushed at all. Probably will get busier as time goes on but I enjoyed the peaceful setting there.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel is located in a business area not far from Ginza area ,wonderful city view from all the sides , hotel is located at 36 floor , top floor.. if you look around all is perfect , high level starting from the furniture of the rooms .

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: The hotel is located on the top floors of a very very modern and new building, surrounded by restaurants and bars.The hotel staff was very attentive upon check-in (due to SPG Platinum status the did this at the lounge) We were received with a glass of champagne and various amenities.The suite assigned was simply astounding, incredible panoramic views of the city, and everything in the suite screamed luxury. Beatiful details, furniture and louging areas by the windows.The Staff was very efficient, attentive and professional. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, I can't say enough how great our stay was!Congratulations to all the team and the managers of the hotel, for such great work.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We can't praise this place enough. It takes a lot to impress us and we were certainly impressed. The location is perfect as it is in a more quiet area of Tokyo. It is very near the subway, Imperial Palace Park (easy walk), and not in the middle of the chaos. The lobby is on the 36th floor and has stunning views of Tokyo on all sides. The lobby bar was excellent. The breakfast was simply outstanding. The staff was phenomenal and so nice. The rooms were excellent. The beds were perfect, the shower the best ever, and the decor perfect. It was as good as the Mandarin Oriental in NYC.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a brand new Hotel, part of Starwoods hotels chain.This hotel is amazing and deserves excellent rating. I had corner room that has view of Tokyo tower and Mount Fuji. Staff were very courteous and efficient.I gave it 4 because the executive lounge has limited evening snacks and small in size and smoking is not allowed in the main bar which is rather unusual in Japan.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel sets a new standard of luxury and discretion in a city with many top hotels. The guest room was one of the most sumptuous we have ever experienced and while not large, the views out over Tokyo from the 34th floor were captivating. Especially when reclining on the expansive thickly upholstered window seat which runs the entire width of the room. Heaven! The SPG lounge was like a michelin starred restaurant and presented a wide variety of goodies day and night and premium liquors. We enjoyed dinner at the sushi restaurant our first night and it was magical...like having a private sushi chef. Every member of staff was gracious and helpful...they have had excellent training. The location is great with access to several train lines and many additional restaurants and shops right downstairs. Don't miss this one...it's very special!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This brand-new hotel is lovely. Large plate glass window nearly the width of the room with a window bench from which to enjoy the view. Exquisitely appointed bathroom. Electronic controls for the blinds and lights next to the bed.I'd happily stay here again.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Everything about this hotel is elegant and pure luxury. The room, the VIEWS, the service, the ammenities and offerings in the room, the food! Everything! Yes its expensive, but all the nicer hotels in Tokyo are! We LOVED it!!!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My wife and I stayed four nights over Labor Day weekend. Welcome area for Plat is standard, but personal touch and upgrade that followed was excellent. Upgraded to corner suite overlooking baseball field and Mt. Fuji. We utilized the SPA, pool, and lounge (all included for SPG Plat). Lounge staff was very accommodating and helpfully throughout our stay. Snacks and free drinks throughout the day. If Plat. you have a choice to eat in lounge our main restaurant for breakfast. They prefer lounge, however, restaurant is acceptable. I would recommend eating there once to experience the traditional Japanese breakfast. Additional items - hotel is brand new and connected to a newer building with plenty of restaurant options and access to a grocery store. Departure was at 12am, so we went with the late check out and Yakitori downstairs. Taxis are readily available along with Uber (HND). Would recommend printing address if transferring from train to taxi at Tokyo station (upon arrival from NRT). Transfer is easy to hotel station(s) if you have comfortable shoes and little luggage. Only negative, food in lounge was pretty much the same each day. Menu needs to be expanded. Wine and cocktail options were average.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: For the first part of our trip we had stayed at the Four Season, and on our return from Osaka we decided to stay at this hotel. At the four seasons we have certain expectation in terms of service, but I had no idea what to expect here. I was truly impressed by the service level at this hotel I am happy to report. At check in we were escorted to our room by a member of the hotel staff who explained how to operate the electronics in the room etc. Excellent views of the skyline from our 34th floor room. When we were leaving our hotel to go sight seeing, a staff member rushed to us with 2 umbrellas saying it might rain. Really appreciate this attention to detail by the staff. The Bar looks fantastic and has exceptional views, but the green wall lighting somehow makes you feel uneasy. Even though we liked this bar, we wanted to leave after a drink because it did not feel relaxing. Felt we would hear the slot machines ringing any moment. One thing I did not like at this hotel was that they wanted to charge you $45 per person per day to use their pool. This seems very petty and I almost wanted to give the hotel 4 stars instead of 5 because of this.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: My husband and I have spent five glorious nights in this incredible hotel. Everything is wonderful from the fully automated room complete with iPads and a toto self-flushing toilet to wonderful bedding to delightful sweets in your room at 5 pm, to the wonderful service.The view from our room (Room 3337) was mind-blowing. The fitness centre is pristine with great equipment. The pool looks fabulous but you have to pay a hefty fee to use it, which is a negative. Other than that, I can't say enough about this amazing place. We really don't want to leave!! Make your booking as soon as you can!

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed 4 nights for business. Very new hotel and even some taxi drivers are not familiar with the place. It deserves 5 stars from me in Japan when comparing this hotel to the Westin and Sheraton in Tokyo. Platinum privileges are as usual, very basic, like most of the SPG hotels in North Asia. Service is clinical and professional and based on the highest Japanese standards. A rightful comparison for this hotel is actually the Palace Hotel. Of course, the Palace Hotel's location is more prestigious but in terms of the room, amenities, service, the Prince Gallery is up there. The fitness gym was fantastic. My only complaint is the ridiculous amount of money I paid for lunch at the only restaurant in the hotel.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a brand new hotel in the SPG group. Maybe because of this I experienced some issues. As a platinum member I issued some suite night awards a week before arrival. No communication at all about this being approved or not being available before arrival. Upon arrival the staff had no clue what I was talking about when referring to suite night awards so they assigned a standard room. After asking if this was the best room available they ended up giving me a better room however no suite. The hotel wasn't fully booked at all so Platinum status doesn't really count here.The room however was good with great views. Platinum lounge cocktails in the afternoon is ok. Breakfast not bad at all. For the price you pay this hotel is good but not perfect yet.The one hour Narita to hotel public taxi ride will cost you an insane amount of 250usd. Shuttle bus which is quite ok will cost you about 35usd.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Stayed there for 2 nights and going back for one more, tomorrow. The rooms, while on the smaller side, are beautiful in every detail. Everything in the entire hotel is shiny brand new and you get the feeling that the staff is working very hard to keep it looking that way. I'm an SPG platinum member and had lounge access. I've never seen such great desserts anywhere and they are available virtually all afternoon in the lounge! The pool and gym are both beautiful and no one else was using the facilities while I was using them. Breakfast was also super, they have a Japanese set menu my wife chose and although I hate food photos (and the people who take them) I have to admit her Japanese set breakfast was photo-worthy. I attached a photo of the view from our room, which virtually every room shares. So what's the negative side? Well, the price. It's very high but in Japan you get what you pay for. After several weeks traveling in Japan, I can say there are no "deals" to be had here! If you have the cash (or points) and are coming to Tokyo, give this place a try - you'd have to be insane (or a serious nitpicker) to not love it. Oh one more thing - its just near a nice neighborhood with plenty of small restaurants - I ate twice at the stand-up sushi place down the street - you can get a tasty meal around there for a very normal price like $15 a person or so.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This hotel is ultra-modern and beautiful. Great amenities and outstanding customer service. Hotel was only open for about 2 weeks so a few quirks like our door didn't shut all the way, but service was great. Concierge helped us get a few dinner reservations and the airport shuttle. The bar was a little slow in service but the drinks were delicious.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Pros:-Location: located above a bunch of shops and restaurants as well as above a subway station with three different lines-Brand new hotel (as of the time of this review) and everything was spotless-Staff was generally knowledgable and extremely courteous (greeting and bowing regularly)-Latest technology in the rooms (maybe a little too excessive) with iPads and touch panels controlling most of the features in the room-Evening complimentary desserts provided in the room-Gorgeous rooms with great views (hotel is located in floors 30-36 of a high rise building)Cons:-Price: at ~$400/night, the hotel was on the pricier end-Gym was complimentary but spa/pool access was $45 (even if you wanted to just use the locker room). Would have been nice if it was closer to the $20 range. I saw nobody using any of the paid services the four nights I was there.-Hotel layout: This was the weirdest aspect of the hotel. Rooms were on floors 30-36 but the lobby was on 36 (presumably because of the views). In order to get to any other floor, you first had to take an elevator from the ground floor entrance to floor 36 and walk a few minutes to another elevator to go down. The same applied when needing to exit the hotel. This got annoying really quickly.-SPG recognition: Other than them mentioning my status at check-in, I didn't really see any other indication of my status. The staff was confused when I asked for upgrade options.Overall: This is a great, new addition to the SPG portfolio in Tokyo (which didn't have many great options).

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: Brand new hotel in Tokyo. I was there on their second week of operation. On the positive: Very impressive decoration and architecture. Good size rooms, well equipped. Easy access to Metro and a few stores at the bottom of the building. On the not so positive: - Price quality ratio is not playing in the favor of this hotel. YES it is nice and luxurious but still, it does not justify a $450 (after all room taxes and fees) per night price. - One critical design flaws will turn off every business travelers: there is no accessible power outlet on the desk. So bring a power cord if you want to work longer than your battery life on your PC. These days this is unreal to find such design flaws in hotel that are supposed to cater to business people. Very annoying... On the negative: - upon checking the check-in desk people did not want to give me access to the Lounge floor despite my Gold status with Starwood. In most hotel around the world, my gold status gets me access to the lounge floor. the attendant at the check-in refused to get me access. And she did not do it in a nice way... - there is a ~$45 fee to use the pool and sauna facility (the gym is free)... $45 ?? Really??? is it a joke?? Needless to say I did not see anybody in the pool... - Breakfast buffet is $45 !! I could not get a coffee pot and had to ask the server to come every time to fill a tiny cup. I asked if he could leave the servicing pot and he said he could not !?!.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We stayed at this newly opened hotel for 8 days while on a family vacation in Tokyo. I was very impressed with everything. The staff are very accommodating to ensure that your stay is comfortable. It definitely added to my family's awesome experience in Japan! The only thing I didn't quite understand is to why they do not allow children (under 16) or anyone with visible tattoos on the pool. Is this something this cultural? If so, I suggest having this information on the website. We've never experienced this in any of our travels.Other than the pool situation, this is an ideal hotel to stay. Very good location and great service. Concierge is very helpful.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a nice hotel. Nice. Comfortable. High quality. Attentive staff. All that. Yet somehow I've left the Prince Gallery hotel feeling unsatisfied with my experience. I've stayed at a number of luxury collection hotels around the world. This felt.... Well, ok. Just ok. The rooms included iPads to Oder food and control the room. Also a nifty function to give privacy in the glass of the shower. All nifty. Not praiseworthy. Hotel entrance is less than grand. Bar is interesting but 1. There are many hotels with much better views, and 2. It felt uninviting - as if I was imposing on the people there to enjoy a drink. Rooms were smaller than what I'd expect at this level. I could go on. However to summarize, next time I'm in Tokyo (which is often), I'll take my luxury hotel Yen elsewhere.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: We had a great stay at Prince Gallery, staff very attentive, beautiful rooms with the most modern design and technology and amazing view too. I have been fortunate to stay at several nice hotels in Tokyo and elsewhere and I have to say this was certainly one of the best I have seen. Nice breakfast and services in their club lounge. Mandatory swim cap in the pool area is a bit exaggerated to me though.

hotel_name: The Prince Gallery Tokyo Kioicho, A Luxury Collection Hotel
review_body: This is a beautiful all-around hotel in the Akasaka area near to Roppongi:- Hotel is on floors 30-36 with unobstructed panoramic views of Tokyo all around from every room, restaurant, bar, and lobby lounge.- Room quality, furnishings, fixtures, carpeting are all top-line quality (metal, wood, glass), with iPad controls from lighting to curtains.- Washroom amenities from Laboratoire Remede are excellent and fully stocked including loofah, razor, and bath salts.- Gym is large for a hotel with several treadmills, eliptical/stairs, weight machines, and free weights (pool, hot tub, and steam room extra charge of JPY 4,752 (USD 40) but given the quality of facilities and amenities (Shiseido) very well worth it).- Top service, consistent from driveway to the room, with hotel staff very attentive, informative, and helpful (including in-room check-in and hotel walkaround service by front desk (K. Su)).- Two beautiful bars, each of different styles - one has a two-storey Tokyo view, the other more intimate with leather chairs and whiskey.- Personally welcomed by Aki Takei (Prince Hotels Area General Manager Tokyo) and Nobuo Ohmori (Prince Gallery General Manager) to the elevator.- Hotel building has many restaurants and shops on the second, third, and fourth floors, is around a plethora of restaurant and shopping streets in Akasaka, and has easy access to five Tokyo Metro subway lines (5-10 min taxi ride to Roppongi).
